original: de yi rang bzhin yon tan ldan pa byang chub chen po'i rigs rgyas shes par bya //
analyzed: de yi rang bzhin yon tan ldan pa byang chub chen po'i rigs rgyas shes par bya //
translated: One should know that the family endowed with those qualities by nature is the basis for the development of the lineage of great enlightenment.

original: zhes bya ba ni byang chub sems dpa'i rigs de ni gong du bshad pa'i tshul ltar na rang bzhin gyis yon tan dang ldan pa zhes bya ste /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni byang chub sems dpa'i rigs de ni gong du bshad pa'i tshul ltar na rang bzhin gyis yon tan dang ldan pa zhes bya ste /
translated: The family of the bodhisattvas is said to be endowed with good qualities by nature in the manner just explained.

original: de ltar rang bzhin gyis yon tan dang ldan pas rigs de shin tu rgya che ba dang / mthu che bar bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: de ltar rang bzhin gyis yon tan dang ldan pas rigs de shin tu rgya che ba dang / mthu che bar bya ba'i don to //
translated: Since it is endowed with good qualities by nature, the family is said to be very extensive and to have great power.

original: rigs kyi 'bras bu'i khyad par du tshigs su bcad pa zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: rigs kyi 'bras bu'i khyad par du tshigs su bcad pa zhes bya ba la /
translated: A verse on the distinctive result of the family

original: nyan thos kyi rigs dang rang sangs rgyas kyi rigs kyis rang rang gi 'bras bu thob pa bas byang chub sems dpa'i rigs kyis byang chub chen po'i 'bras bu thob pa khyad zhugs par bstan pa'i phyir tshigs su bcad pa rtsom mo zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: nyan thos kyi rigs dang rang sangs rgyas kyi rigs kyis rang rang gi 'bras bu thob pa bas byang chub sems dpa'i rigs kyis byang chub chen po'i 'bras bu thob pa khyad zhugs par bstan pa'i phyir tshigs su bcad pa rtsom mo zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: In order to demonstrate that the attainment of the result of great enlightenment by the spiritual gene of the bodhisattva is superior to the attainment of their respective results by the disciples' and hermit buddhas' spiritual genes, the verse is begun.üîΩThe bodhisattva spiritual gene is supreme, like a good root,

original: shin tu yangs pa'i yon tan byang chub shing skyes pas //
analyzed: shin tu yangs pa'i yon tan byang chub shing skyes pas //
translated: because it produces the tree of enlightenment with its vast good qualities,

original: stug pos bde zhing sdug bsngal zhi bas dmigs pa'i phyir //üîΩbdag dang gzhan la phan bde bya ba 'bras bu bas //
analyzed: stug pos bde zhing sdug bsngal zhi bas dmigs pa'i phyir // bdag dang gzhan la phan bde bya ba 'bras bu bas //
translated: because it is the basis of the happiness and the pacification of the suffering of oneself and others,

original: rtsa ba bzang po bzhin du rigs 'di mchog yin no //üîΩzhes bya ba la /
analyzed: rtsa ba bzang po bzhin du rigs 'di mchog yin no // zhes bya ba la /
translated: and because it is the basis of the result, the benefit and happiness of oneself and others.

original: rtsa ba bzang po ni rtsa ba brtan pa dang / rtsa ba ma rul ba'o //
analyzed: rtsa ba bzang po ni rtsa ba brtan pa dang / rtsa ba ma rul ba'o //
translated: A good root is a firm root and an unrotten root.

original: dper na rtsa ba bzang po'i shing las sdong po dang / me tog la sogs pa brtan zhing bzang po 'byung ba dang / yal ga dang / 'dab ma la sogs pa sdug cing mdzes pa 'byung ba dang / @50b de'i rgyus grib ma bsil ba yod pa dang /
analyzed: dper na rtsa ba bzang po'i shing las sdong po dang / me tog la sogs pa brtan zhing bzang po 'byung ba dang / yal ga dang / 'dab ma la sogs pa sdug cing mdzes pa 'byung ba dang / @50b de'i rgyus grib ma bsil ba yod pa dang /
translated: For example, from a tree with good roots, a trunk, flowers and so forth arise firmly and well, branches, leaves and so forth arise beautifully and attractively, and because of that, there is cool shade.

original: 'bras bu phun sum tshogs pas gzhan la phan pa byed pa bzhin du byang chub kyi rigs 'di las kyang de dang mthun pa'i yon tan dag 'byung bas byang chub kyi rigs 'di ni shing gi rtsa ba bzang po dang 'dra'o //
analyzed: 'bras bu phun sum tshogs pas gzhan la phan pa byed pa bzhin du byang chub kyi rigs 'di las kyang de dang mthun pa'i yon tan dag 'byung bas byang chub kyi rigs 'di ni shing gi rtsa ba bzang po dang 'dra'o //
translated: And because of the abundant fruit, it benefits others. In the same way, from this enlightened heritage, these good qualities arise in a similar way. This enlightened heritage is like a good tree root.

original: dper na shing rtsa ba bzang po las sdong po sbom zhing bskams pa dang sungs ba med pa 'byung ba dang / me tog sna tshogs pa 'byung ba de bzhin du /
analyzed: dper na shing rtsa ba bzang po las sdong po sbom zhing bskams pa dang sungs ba med pa 'byung ba dang / me tog sna tshogs pa 'byung ba de bzhin du /
translated: For example, from a tree with a good root, a trunk arises that is thick, firm and sound, and various flowers arise.

original: rigs de las kyang stobs dang mi 'jigs pa dang / ma 'dres pa la sogs pa'i yon tan rgya chen me tog dang 'dra bar 'byung ba dang / zad la mi skye ba'i ye shes kyang byang chub chen po cis kyang mi tshugs pa shing sdong lta bu skyes pas na shing gi rtsa ba ma zad par shes par bya'o //
analyzed: rigs de las kyang stobs dang mi 'jigs pa dang / ma 'dres pa la sogs pa'i yon tan rgya chen me tog dang 'dra bar 'byung ba dang / zad la mi skye ba'i ye shes kyang byang chub chen po cis kyang mi tshugs pa shing sdong lta bu skyes pas na shing gi rtsa ba ma zad par shes par bya'o //
translated: And from that potential, qualities such as the strengths, fearlessnesses and distinctive qualities arise like flowers, and the gnosis of the exhaustion of defilements and of the nonarising of the factors of existence is produced like the trunk of a tree, which is the great enlightenment that nothing can destroy.

original: dper na shing rtsa ba bzang po las yal ga dang 'dab ma stug po yod pas grib ma'i bsil ba dang ldan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: dper na shing rtsa ba bzang po las yal ga dang 'dab ma stug po yod pas grib ma'i bsil ba dang ldan pa'i phyir /
translated: For example, because of the dense foliage of branches and leaves on a tree with a good trunk, it has a cool shade

original: sems can rnams kyi tsha ba'i sdug bsngal ni sel /
analyzed: sems can rnams kyi tsha ba'i sdug bsngal ni sel /
translated: and it dispels the suffering of heat for sentient beings.

original: bsil ba'i bde ba thob pa de bzhin du /
analyzed: bsil ba'i bde ba thob pa de bzhin du /
translated: It gives them the bliss of coolness.

original: byang chub sems dpa'i rigs 'di las kyang sa dang pha rol tu phyin pa'i yal ga dang 'dab ma stug po byung bas sems can gyi bde ba stug po rgya che ba ni thob par byed pa mthong /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i rigs 'di las kyang sa dang pha rol tu phyin pa'i yal ga dang 'dab ma stug po byung bas sems can gyi bde ba stug po rgya che ba ni thob par byed pa mthong /
translated: In the same way, from this potential of the bodhisattva, the dense foliage of the levels and transcendent perfections appears and one sees that it brings about the dense, extensive happiness of sentient beings.

original: sdug bsngal stug po mi bzad pa ni zhi bar byed par mthong bas rtsa ba bzang pho dang 'dra'o //
analyzed: sdug bsngal stug po mi bzad pa ni zhi bar byed par mthong bas rtsa ba bzang pho dang 'dra'o //
translated: It is like a good root, because it is seen to pacify the thick, unbearable suffering.

original: dper na rtsa ba bzang po'i shing la 'bras bu phun sum tshogs pa yod pas sems can gyi don phun sum tshogs par byed pa de bzhin du byang chub kyi rigs 'di las kyang bdag la phan pa la dang bde bar bya ba dang / gzhan la phan pa dang bde bar bya ba'i 'bras bu 'byung bas na rtsa ba bzang po dang 'dra'o //
analyzed: dper na rtsa ba bzang po'i shing la 'bras bu phun sum tshogs pa yod pas sems can gyi don phun sum tshogs par byed pa de bzhin du byang chub kyi rigs 'di las kyang bdag la phan pa la dang bde bar bya ba dang / gzhan la phan pa dang bde bar bya ba'i 'bras bu 'byung bas na rtsa ba bzang po dang 'dra'o //
translated: For example, a tree with a good root has an abundance of fruit, and so it accomplishes the benefit of sentient beings. In the same way, this spiritual gene of the bodhisattva produces the fruit of benefit and happiness for oneself and benefit and happiness for others. It is like a good root.

original: de la shing rtsa ba bzang na sdong po la sogs pa 'gyel bar mi 'gyur bas rtsa ba bzang po nyid bdag gi don to //
analyzed: de la shing rtsa ba bzang na sdong po la sogs pa 'gyel bar mi 'gyur bas rtsa ba bzang po nyid bdag gi don to //
translated: There, the good root itself is the benefit of oneself, because when the tree has a good root, the trunk and so on do not fall down.

original: yal ga dang 'dab ma dang me tog dang 'bras bu rgya che zhing stug pas ni gzhan la phan par byed pas gzhan gyi don to //
analyzed: yal ga dang 'dab ma dang me tog dang 'bras bu rgya che zhing stug pas ni gzhan la phan par byed pas gzhan gyi don to //
translated: The benefit of others is the abundance of branches, leaves, flowers, and fruit, because they benefit others.

original: de bzhin du byang chub kyi rigs la yang shin tu yangs pa'i yon tan gyi byang chub kyi shing skyes pa ni bdag gi don to //
analyzed: de bzhin du byang chub kyi rigs la yang shin tu yangs pa'i yon tan gyi byang chub kyi shing skyes pa ni bdag gi don to //
translated: Likewise, the arising of the tree of enlightenment, which is the quality of the very vast enlightenment gene, is for one's own benefit.

original: stug pos bde zhing sdug bsngal zhi ba dmigs pa ni gzhan gyi don to //
analyzed: stug pos bde zhing sdug bsngal zhi ba dmigs pa ni gzhan gyi don to //
translated: The observation of the pacification of suffering by the dense foliage is for the benefit of others.

original: bdag dang gzhan la phan pa'i 'bras bu zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: bdag dang gzhan la phan pa'i 'bras bu zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
translated: The result that benefits oneself and others, etc.

original: byang chub kyi shing gi rtsa bar byang chub kyi rigs 'di gyur pas /
analyzed: byang chub kyi shing gi rtsa bar byang chub kyi rigs 'di gyur pas /
translated: This enlightenment gene, which is the root of the tree of enlightenment,

original: rigs de las bdag dang gzhan la phan pa'i 'bras bu 'byung bas na byang chub kyi rigs kyi yon tan @51a * //
analyzed: rigs de las bdag dang gzhan la phan pa'i 'bras bu 'byung bas na byang chub kyi rigs kyi yon tan @51a * //
translated: is the enlightenment gene. Since the result that benefits oneself and others arises from that gene, it is the praise of the quality of the enlightenment gene.

original: bsngags pa yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: bsngags pa yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: This is the meaning.

original: rigs kyi skabs bshad pa rdzogs so /üîΩ// / rigs kyi skabs kyi rjes la /
analyzed: rigs kyi skabs bshad pa rdzogs so / // / rigs kyi skabs kyi rjes la /
translated: The explanation of the chapter on the gene is finished.

original: sems bskyed pa'i skabs bshad par cis 'brel zhe na /
analyzed: sems bskyed pa'i skabs bshad par cis 'brel zhe na /
translated: After the chapter on the gene, why is the chapter on the generation of the thought of enlightenment explained?

original: gong du rigs bshad pa'i rjes la /
analyzed: gong du rigs bshad pa'i rjes la /
translated: After the explanation of the gene above,

original: shin tu yangs pa'i yon tan byang chub shing skyes pas //
analyzed: shin tu yangs pa'i yon tan byang chub shing skyes pas //
translated: the arising of the tree of enlightenment, which is the quality of the very vast enlightenment gene,

original: stug po bde zhing sdug bsngal zhib dmigs pa'i phyir //
analyzed: stug po bde zhing sdug bsngal zhib dmigs pa'i phyir //
translated: because it is the basis of the bliss of meditative concentration and the discernment of suffering.

original: bdag dang gzhan la phan bde bya bas 'bras bu bas //
analyzed: bdag dang gzhan la phan bde bya bas 'bras bu bas //
translated: Its result is the benefit and happiness of self and other.

original: rtsa ba bzang po bzhin du rigs 'di mchog yin no //
analyzed: rtsa ba bzang po bzhin du rigs 'di mchog yin no //
translated: This spiritual gene is the best, like a good root.

original: zhes bshad de ji ltar rtsa ba bzang po'i shing dang rtsa ba bzang po nyid rang gi don phun sum tshogs pa'o //
analyzed: zhes bshad de ji ltar rtsa ba bzang po'i shing dang rtsa ba bzang po nyid rang gi don phun sum tshogs pa'o //
translated: Just as a tree with a good root has a good root itself, which is the perfection of its own aim,

original: de la yal ga dang 'dab ma dang me tog dang 'bras bu la sogs pa rgya chen po yod pas ni 'gro ba mang po'i longs spyod du gyur pas gzhan gyi don phun sum tshogs ba zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de la yal ga dang 'dab ma dang me tog dang 'bras bu la sogs pa rgya chen po yod pas ni 'gro ba mang po'i longs spyod du gyur pas gzhan gyi don phun sum tshogs ba zhes bya'o //
translated: and it has a vastness of branches, leaves, flowers, and fruits, which are the perfection of the aims of others, because it is the enjoyment of many beings,

original: de bzhin du rang bzhin la gnas pa'i rigs yod na /
analyzed: de bzhin du rang bzhin la gnas pa'i rigs yod na /
translated: in the same way, when the spiritual gene that is the natural existence of the element exists,

original: byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyis bdag dang gzhan gyi don gnyis 'grub par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyis bdag dang gzhan gyi don gnyis 'grub par 'gyur ro //
translated: the two aims of the bodhisattvas are accomplished.

original: de la rnam pa gnyis 'grub pa yang rigs 'ba' zhig yod pa tsam gyis mi chog gi rigs la brten nas sems bskyed pa la sogs pa'i rim pas bsgrubs na 'dod pa 'grub kyi sems ma bskyed na ni mi 'grub bo //
analyzed: de la rnam pa gnyis 'grub pa yang rigs 'ba' zhig yod pa tsam gyis mi chog gi rigs la brten nas sems bskyed pa la sogs pa'i rim pas bsgrubs na 'dod pa 'grub kyi sems ma bskyed na ni mi 'grub bo //
translated: If one does not generate the Thought, it is not accomplished.üîΩAlso, in generating the Thought, etc., if one has the lineage, one's aims are fulfilled.üîΩIf one has the lineage, one will certainly generate the Thought for Unsurpassed Awakening.

original: sems bskyed pa la sogs pa la yang rigs yod na 'dod pa 'byung ste gang la rigs yod pa de gdon mi za bar bla na med pa'i byang chub tu sems bskyed bar 'gyur bas na rigs kyi skabs kyi rjes la sems bskyed par 'gyur ba'i skabs bshadüîΩpar 'brel to //
analyzed: sems bskyed pa la sogs pa la yang rigs yod na 'dod pa 'byung ste gang la rigs yod pa de gdon mi za bar bla na med pa'i byang chub tu sems bskyed bar 'gyur bas na rigs kyi skabs kyi rjes la sems bskyed par 'gyur ba'i skabs bshad par 'brel to //
translated: Thus, the section on the lineage is connected with the section on generating the Thought.

original: yang na sems bskyed pa'i rang bzhin ni 'di ltar gyur cig ces smon lam 'debs pa'i mtshan nyid do //
analyzed: yang na sems bskyed pa'i rang bzhin ni 'di ltar gyur cig ces smon lam 'debs pa'i mtshan nyid do //
translated: Or else, the nature of generating the Thought is the character of making a vow, ‚ÄúMay it be like this!‚Äù

original: smon lam 'debs pa de yang bdag nyid bla na med pa'i byang chub 'dod pa dang / sems can gyi don byed par 'dod pa'i phyir smon lam 'debs te /
analyzed: smon lam 'debs pa de yang bdag nyid bla na med pa'i byang chub 'dod pa dang / sems can gyi don byed par 'dod pa'i phyir smon lam 'debs te /
translated: And that vow is made because one desires Unsurpassed Awakening for oneself and desires to work for the welfare of sentient beings.

original: sems can gyi don bya ba'i thabs ni bla na med pa'i byang chub tu sangs rgyas pa thob pa'o //
analyzed: sems can gyi don bya ba'i thabs ni bla na med pa'i byang chub tu sangs rgyas pa thob pa'o //
translated: The means for accomplishing the aims of sentient beings is the attainment of Buddhahood, which is unexcelled enlightenment.

original: de bas na sems can gyi thabs su gyur pas bla na med pa'i byang chub bsgrubs na byang chub tu sems bskyed pa la sogs pa'i rim pas bsgrub pa'o //
analyzed: de bas na sems can gyi thabs su gyur pas bla na med pa'i byang chub bsgrubs na byang chub tu sems bskyed pa la sogs pa'i rim pas bsgrub pa'o //
translated: Therefore, if one practices unexcelled enlightenment, which is the means for accomplishing the aims of sentient beings, one practices by means of the stages beginning with the generation of the Thought of enlightenment.

original: de la yang rigs dang bcas pa'i stobs kyis byang chub tu sems bskyed na ni sems can de ldog pa med pa'i chos su 'gyur ro zhes bstan pa'i phyir rigs kyi rjes la sems bskyed pa'i skabs bshad par 'brel to //üîΩsems bskyed @51b pa'i mtshan nyid du tshigs su bcad pa zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: de la yang rigs dang bcas pa'i stobs kyis byang chub tu sems bskyed na ni sems can de ldog pa med pa'i chos su 'gyur ro zhes bstan pa'i phyir rigs kyi rjes la sems bskyed pa'i skabs bshad par 'brel to // sems bskyed @51b pa'i mtshan nyid du tshigs su bcad pa zhes bya ba la /
translated: And in that regard, if one generates the Thought of enlightenment by the power of possessing the spiritual gene, then that sentient being becomes one whose nature is irreversible. In order to demonstrate this, the section on the generation of the Thought after the spiritual gene is relevant.üîΩA verse on the definition of the generation of the Thought of enlightenment.

original: byang chub tu sems bskyed pa'i mtshan nyid du rang bzhin bstan par bya ba'i phyir tshigs su bcad pa rtsom mo zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: byang chub tu sems bskyed pa'i mtshan nyid du rang bzhin bstan par bya ba'i phyir tshigs su bcad pa rtsom mo zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: In order to demonstrate the nature of the generation of the Thought of enlightenment, a verse is begun.

original: spro ba che zhing rtsom pa che //
analyzed: spro ba che zhing rtsom pa che //
translated: It is the great commitment, the great armor,

original: don chen po dga' thob pa che //
analyzed: don chen po dga' thob pa che //
translated: The great meaning, the great attainment.

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' ste //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' ste //
translated: The Bodhisattva is the hero

original: don gnyis dang ni sems bskyed pa'o //üîΩzhes bya ba la /
analyzed: don gnyis dang ni sems bskyed pa'o // zhes bya ba la /
translated: of the two aims and of the generation of the Thought.

original: byang chub kyi sems kyi mtshan nyid ni spro ba che ba'i mtshan nyid dang / rtsom pa che ba'i mtshan nyid dang / don che ba'i mtshan nyid dang / thob pa che ba'i mtshan nyid dang / don gnyis la dmigs pa'i mtshan nyid de /
analyzed: byang chub kyi sems kyi mtshan nyid ni spro ba che ba'i mtshan nyid dang / rtsom pa che ba'i mtshan nyid dang / don che ba'i mtshan nyid dang / thob pa che ba'i mtshan nyid dang / don gnyis la dmigs pa'i mtshan nyid de /
translated: The definition of the Thought of Enlightenment is fivefold: the definition of great enthusiasm, the definition of great undertaking, the definition of great meaning, the definition of great attainment, and the definition of the focus on the two aims.

original: gong du bshad pa rnams bsgrub par bya'o snyam du sems bskyed pa'i sems las byung bas sems dpa' zhes bya ba'i sems las g-yo ba'i rang bzhin la sems bskyed ba zhes bya'o //
analyzed: gong du bshad pa rnams bsgrub par bya'o snyam du sems bskyed pa'i sems las byung bas sems dpa' zhes bya ba'i sems las g-yo ba'i rang bzhin la sems bskyed ba zhes bya'o //
translated: The word hero is used because the Thought is the source of the generation of the Thought, which is the resolve, I will accomplish the above-mentioned things.

original: spro ba che ba ni go cha'i brtson 'grus kyis theg pa chen po'i chos la zab cing rgya che ba'i chos rnams mnyan ba dang / bsam pa la sogs pa'i sgo nas rtogs par bya'o zhes sems spro zhing mi ldog pa dang / sems can gyi don du bskal pa grangs med par mgo dang rkang lag la sogs pa gtong ba'i dka' ba spyod pa la spro zhing mi ldog pa'i sems bskyed pa dang bo la spro ba che ba zhes bya'o //
analyzed: spro ba che ba ni go cha'i brtson 'grus kyis theg pa chen po'i chos la zab cing rgya che ba'i chos rnams mnyan ba dang / bsam pa la sogs pa'i sgo nas rtogs par bya'o zhes sems spro zhing mi ldog pa dang / sems can gyi don du bskal pa grangs med par mgo dang rkang lag la sogs pa gtong ba'i dka' ba spyod pa la spro zhing mi ldog pa'i sems bskyed pa dang bo la spro ba che ba zhes bya'o //
translated: Great enthusiasm is the enthusiasm and non-discouragement of the bodhicitta that thinks, ‚ÄúI will listen to the profound and extensive Dharma of the Great Vehicle and understand it by means of reflection and so forth,‚Äù and the enthusiasm and non-discouragement of the bodhicitta that thinks, ‚ÄúI will work for the benefit of sentient beings and undergo hardships such as giving away my head, legs, and arms for countless eons.‚Äù

original: rtsom pa che ba ni de ltar go cha'i brtson 'grus brtsams nas go cha brtsams shing khas blangs pa bzhin du sbyor ba'i brtson 'grus kyi ji ltar go cha ba go zhing khas blangs pa bzhin du zab cing rgya che ba'i chos rtogs par bya ba'i phyir ni
analyzed: rtsom pa che ba ni de ltar go cha'i brtson 'grus brtsams nas go cha brtsams shing khas blangs pa bzhin du sbyor ba'i brtson 'grus kyi ji ltar go cha ba go zhing khas blangs pa bzhin du zab cing rgya che ba'i chos rtogs par bya ba'i phyir ni
translated: Great undertaking is, having thus undertaken the armor-like effort, the application-based effort that is in accordance with the armor-like effort and the vows one has taken.

original: chos nyan pa dang / sems pa goms pa la 'jug / sems can gyi don du ni pha rol tu phyin pa drug la sogs pa dang dka' ba spyad pa rnam ba sna tshogs bsgrub pa'i phyir rtsom pa che ba zhes bya'o //
analyzed: chos nyan pa dang / sems pa goms pa la 'jug / sems can gyi don du ni pha rol tu phyin pa drug la sogs pa dang dka' ba spyad pa rnam ba sna tshogs bsgrub pa'i phyir rtsom pa che ba zhes bya'o //
translated: It is a great undertaking because it is the practice of listening to the Dharma, reflecting on it and meditating on it, and for the sake of sentient beings, it is the practice of the six perfections and the accomplishment of various kinds of difficult action.

original: sems bskyed pa de'ang bdag gi don phun sum tshogs pa bsgrub par bya ba dang / gzhan gyi don phun sum tshogs pa bsgrub par bya ba'i phyir sems bskyed pas na don che ba'o //
analyzed: sems bskyed pa de'ang bdag gi don phun sum tshogs pa bsgrub par bya ba dang / gzhan gyi don phun sum tshogs pa bsgrub par bya ba'i phyir sems bskyed pas na don che ba'o //
translated: It is of great benefit because it is the generation of the mind of enlightenment for the sake of accomplishing one's own aim and for the sake of accomplishing the aim of others.

original: de ltar sems bskyed nas mjug tu 'bras bu bla na med pa'i byang chub thob pas na thob pa che ba zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de ltar sems bskyed nas mjug tu 'bras bu bla na med pa'i byang chub thob pas na thob pa che ba zhes bya'o //
translated: Having generated the mind of enlightenment in this way, it is of great attainment because in the end one attains the unsurpassed enlightenment.

original: byang chub kyi sems de yang sems g-yo zhing 'gul bar byed pa'i mtshan nyid sems las byung bas sems pa zhes bya bas bskyod nas byang chub kyi sems bskyed pas na byang chub sems dpa'i sems zhes bya ste /
analyzed: byang chub kyi sems de yang sems g-yo zhing 'gul bar byed pa'i mtshan nyid sems las byung bas sems pa zhes bya bas bskyod nas byang chub kyi sems bskyed pas na byang chub sems dpa'i sems zhes bya ste /
translated: This mind of enlightenment is called the mind of enlightenment of the bodhisattva because it is generated by the mind of enlightenment, which is called intention, a mental factor with the characteristic of moving and stirring the mind.

original: byang chub kyi sems de ni @52a * //
analyzed: byang chub kyi sems de ni @52a * //
translated: That thought of enlightenment

original: sems dpa' zhes bya ba'i sems bskyed do zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: sems dpa' zhes bya ba'i sems bskyed do zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: is called the thought of the bodhisattva.

original: byang chub kyi sems de ci las dmigs nas sems skye zhe na //
analyzed: byang chub kyi sems de ci las dmigs nas sems skye zhe na //
translated: In what does the thought of enlightenment consist?

original: de nyid don gnyis la dmigs nas sems skye ste /
analyzed: de nyid don gnyis la dmigs nas sems skye ste /
translated: It consists of the two aims.

original: don gnyis ni bdag nyid byang chub chen po thob par bya bar dmigs pa dang / sems can la phan pa dang bde ba'i don bya bar dmigs nas byang chub kyi sems bskyed do zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: don gnyis ni bdag nyid byang chub chen po thob par bya bar dmigs pa dang / sems can la phan pa dang bde ba'i don bya bar dmigs nas byang chub kyi sems bskyed do zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The thought of enlightenment is generated in the thought of the bodhisattva, who has the two aims: the aim of attaining great enlightenment for himself, and the aim of working for the benefit and happiness of all sentient beings.

original: de yan chad kyis mdor na byang chub kyi sems de yon tan gsum dang ldan pa dang / don gnyis la dmigs pa yin par bstan to //
analyzed: de yan chad kyis mdor na byang chub kyi sems de yon tan gsum dang ldan pa dang / don gnyis la dmigs pa yin par bstan to //
translated: In brief, this shows that the thought of enlightenment has three virtues and two aims.

original: de la yon tan rnam pa gsum ni /
analyzed: de la yon tan rnam pa gsum ni /
translated: What are the three virtues?

original: skyes bu byed pa'i yon tan dang / don byed pa'i yon tan dang / 'bras bu yongs su 'dzin pa'i yon tan no //
analyzed: skyes bu byed pa'i yon tan dang / don byed pa'i yon tan dang / 'bras bu yongs su 'dzin pa'i yon tan no //
translated: The virtue of the person, the virtue of the function, and the virtue of the result.

original: don gnyis ni byang chub kyi don la dmigs pa dang / sems can gyi don la dmigs pa'o //
analyzed: don gnyis ni byang chub kyi don la dmigs pa dang / sems can gyi don la dmigs pa'o //
translated: The two aims are the aim of enlightenment and the aim of sentient beings.

original: de la spro ba che zhing rtsom pa che //
analyzed: de la spro ba che zhing rtsom pa che //
translated: It is a great undertaking, and it is a great achievement.

original: zhes bya ba'i tshig gnyis kyis skyes bu byed pa'i yon tan bstan te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba'i tshig gnyis kyis skyes bu byed pa'i yon tan bstan te /
translated: These two lines teach the quality of being a human action.

original: dang po sems bskyed pa na yang sems kyi shugs drag tu bskyed la phyis sgrub pa'i tshe na yang dka' ba spyod pa thams cad de bzhin du bsgrub pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dang po sems bskyed pa na yang sems kyi shugs drag tu bskyed la phyis sgrub pa'i tshe na yang dka' ba spyod pa thams cad de bzhin du bsgrub pa'i phyir ro //
translated: When one first generates the Thought, one generates it with a strong force of mind, and later, when one practices, one practices in the same way, in order to accomplish all the difficult practices.

original: don chen po zhes bya bas don chen po'i yon tan bstan te /
analyzed: don chen po zhes bya bas don chen po'i yon tan bstan te /
translated: It is a great aim. This teaches the quality of having a great aim.

original: bdag dang gzhan gyi don byed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bdag dang gzhan gyi don byed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It accomplishes the aims of self and other.

original: thob pa che zhes bya bas 'bras bu yongs su 'dzin pa'i yon tan bstan te mthar bla na med pa'i byang chub len pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: thob pa che zhes bya bas 'bras bu yongs su 'dzin pa'i yon tan bstan te mthar bla na med pa'i byang chub len pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is a great attainment. This teaches the quality of embracing a great result.

original: don gnyis zhes bya bas gnyis la dmigs pa bstan te /
analyzed: don gnyis zhes bya bas gnyis la dmigs pa bstan te /
translated: It is the aim of the two. This teaches the aim of the two.

original: byang chub dang sems can gyi don la dmigs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: byang chub dang sems can gyi don la dmigs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is the aim of enlightenment and the aim of sentient beings.

original: sems bskyed pa rab tu dbye ba'i tshigs su bcad pa zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: sems bskyed pa rab tu dbye ba'i tshigs su bcad pa zhes bya ba la /
translated: The chapter on the analysis of the generation of the resolve.

original: byang chub kyi sems kyi mtshan nyid nas byang chub kyi sems la phyen du yod pa'i rab tu dbye ba'i 'chad de /
analyzed: byang chub kyi sems kyi mtshan nyid nas byang chub kyi sems la phyen du yod pa'i rab tu dbye ba'i 'chad de /
translated: The chapter on the analysis of the generation of the resolve is explained from the characteristics of the resolve for enlightenment up to the analysis of the resolve for enlightenment.

original: byang chub kyi sems la phyen mos pa'i sems bskyed pa dang lhag pa'i bsam pa rnam par dag pa'i sems bskyed pa dang / rnam par smin pa'i sems bskyed pa dang / sgrib pa spangs pa'i sems bskyed pa dang phyen rnam pa bzhi yod do zhes bstan pa'i phyir tshigs su bcad pa rtsom mo //
analyzed: byang chub kyi sems la phyen mos pa'i sems bskyed pa dang lhag pa'i bsam pa rnam par dag pa'i sems bskyed pa dang / rnam par smin pa'i sems bskyed pa dang / sgrib pa spangs pa'i sems bskyed pa dang phyen rnam pa bzhi yod do zhes bstan pa'i phyir tshigs su bcad pa rtsom mo //
translated: The chapter is composed in order to demonstrate that the resolve for enlightenment is of four kinds: the resolve for enlightenment that is a mere aspiration, the resolve for enlightenment that is a pure superior intention, the resolve for enlightenment that is a maturation, and the resolve for enlightenment that is the abandonment of obscuration.

original: sems bskyed de ni mos pa dang // zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: sems bskyed de ni mos pa dang // zhes bya ba la /
translated: That resolve is aspiration,

original: mos bas spyod pa'i sa drod dang / spyi bo dang / bzod pa dang 'jig rten gyi chos kyi mchog gi tshe na sems bskyed pa ni theg pa chen po'i chos zab cing rgya che ba rtogs nas sems bskyed pa ni ma @52b yin gyi theg pa chen po'i chos zab cing rgya che ba la dang pa'i sgo nasüîΩsems bskyed bas na /
analyzed: mos bas spyod pa'i sa drod dang / spyi bo dang / bzod pa dang 'jig rten gyi chos kyi mchog gi tshe na sems bskyed pa ni theg pa chen po'i chos zab cing rgya che ba rtogs nas sems bskyed pa ni ma @52b yin gyi theg pa chen po'i chos zab cing rgya che ba la dang pa'i sgo nas sems bskyed bas na /
translated: It is the generation of the Thought by way of faith in the profound and extensive Dharma of the Great Vehicle.

original: mos pa'i sems bskyed pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: mos pa'i sems bskyed pa zhes bya'o //
translated: Therefore, it is called the generation of the Thought of faith.

original: lhag pa'i bsam pa dag pa gzhan //üîΩzhes bya ba la /
analyzed: lhag pa'i bsam pa dag pa gzhan // zhes bya ba la /
translated: The other is the pure superior intention.

original: gzhan gyi sgra ni sa dang po yan chad sa bdun pa man chad kyi sa la bya ste /
analyzed: gzhan gyi sgra ni sa dang po yan chad sa bdun pa man chad kyi sa la bya ste /
translated: The word ‚Äúother‚Äù refers to the stages from the first stage up to the seventh stage.

original: sa bdun po de dag gi sems pa la ni lhag pa'i bsam pa dag pa'i sems bskyed pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: sa bdun po de dag gi sems pa la ni lhag pa'i bsam pa dag pa'i sems bskyed pa zhes bya'o //
translated: The generation of the Thought in those seven stages is called the generation of the Thought of pure superior intention.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: gang bdag yin pa de bzhin gzhan gang yin pa de bdag ces gzhan du mnyam pa nyid kyi sems thob pas bdag dang gzhan gyi don phun sum tshogs pa 'thob par bya ba'i phyir lhag pa'i bsam pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: gang bdag yin pa de bzhin gzhan gang yin pa de bdag ces gzhan du mnyam pa nyid kyi sems thob pas bdag dang gzhan gyi don phun sum tshogs pa 'thob par bya ba'i phyir lhag pa'i bsam pa zhes bya'o //
translated: The mind that is the same with regard to self and other, thinking What is self is just what is other, is called superior intention because it is for the sake of attaining the perfection of one's own and others' goals through attaining the sameness of mind.

original: gzung pa dang 'dzin pa'i dri ma dang bral bar bya ba'i phyir dag pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: gzung pa dang 'dzin pa'i dri ma dang bral bar bya ba'i phyir dag pa zhes bya'o //
translated: It is called purity because it is free from the stains of subject and object.

original: rnam par smin pa'i sa 'dod de //üîΩzhes bya ba la /
analyzed: rnam par smin pa'i sa 'dod de // zhes bya ba la /
translated: The stage of maturation is asserted.

original: sa brgyad pa dang / sa dgu pa dang / bcu par byang chub tu sems bskyed pa la rnam par smin pa'i byang chub kyi sems zhes bya ste /
analyzed: sa brgyad pa dang / sa dgu pa dang / bcu par byang chub tu sems bskyed pa la rnam par smin pa'i byang chub kyi sems zhes bya ste /
translated: The generation of the mind of enlightenment on the eighth, ninth, and tenth stages is called the matured mind of enlightenment.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: sa de dag la rnam par mi rtog pa'i ye shes lhun gyis grub pa thob pas /üîΩsbyin pa la sogs pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa rnams la yang /
analyzed: sa de dag la rnam par mi rtog pa'i ye shes lhun gyis grub pa thob pas / sbyin pa la sogs pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa rnams la yang /
translated: Because on those stages, the effortless, spontaneous attainment of nonconceptual wisdom

original: brtsal 'bad med par lhun gyis grub par spyod pas na /
analyzed: brtsal 'bad med par lhun gyis grub par spyod pas na /
translated: is the effortless, spontaneous practice of the perfections such as generosity.

original: rnam par smin pa'i sems bskyed pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: rnam par smin pa'i sems bskyed pa zhes bya'o //
translated: This is called the ‚Äúarousing of the mind of evolutionary development.‚Äù

original: de bzhin sgrib ba spangs pa'o //
analyzed: de bzhin sgrib ba spangs pa'o //
translated: Likewise, the obscurations are abandoned.

original: zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la /
translated: This is the second verse.

original: sangs rgyas kyis kun tu 'od kyi dus na zad pa dang / mi skye ba'i mtshan nyid kyi byang chub kyi sems skyes pa la ni sgrib pa med pa'i sems skyes pa zhes bya ste /
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyis kun tu 'od kyi dus na zad pa dang / mi skye ba'i mtshan nyid kyi byang chub kyi sems skyes pa la ni sgrib pa med pa'i sems skyes pa zhes bya ste /
translated: At the time of the universal light of Buddhahood, the arousing of the mind of enlightenment, which has the character of exhaustion and non-production, is called the ‚Äúarousing of the mind of non-obscuration.‚Äù

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: de'i tshe byang chub kyi sems de ni nyon mongs pa'i sgrib pa dang / shes bya'i sgrib pa ma lus par spangs pa'i mtshan nyid yin pa'i phyir ro ;
analyzed: de'i tshe byang chub kyi sems de ni nyon mongs pa'i sgrib pa dang / shes bya'i sgrib pa ma lus par spangs pa'i mtshan nyid yin pa'i phyir ro ;
translated: Because at that time, that mind of enlightenment has the character of the complete abandonment of the afflictive and the objective obscurations.

original: / de bas na 'phags pa ga ya'i rtse mo'i mdo las kyang /
analyzed: / de bas na 'phags pa ga ya'i rtse mo'i mdo las kyang /
translated: Therefore, the noble Peak of the Virtues says,

analyzed: lha'i bu gzhan yang sems bskyed pa dang po ni rgyu las yang dag par 'byung ba'o //
translated: ‚ÄúMoreover, son of the gods, the first arousing of the mind is the arising from the cause.

original: sems bskyed pa gnyis pa ni ye shes las yang dag par 'byung ba'o //
analyzed: sems bskyed pa gnyis pa ni ye shes las yang dag par 'byung ba'o //
translated: The second arousing of the mind is the arising from intuition.

original: sems bskyed pa gsum pa ni spong ba las yang dag par 'byung ba'o ;
analyzed: sems bskyed pa gsum pa ni spong ba las yang dag par 'byung ba'o ;

original: ces bya ba la /
analyzed: ces bya ba la /
translated: The

original: byang chub kyi sems rnam pa bzhi'i rtsa ba gang zhen zhes dris pa dang / de'i lan du byang chub kyi sems rnam pa bzhi'i rtsa ba ni snying rje yin par 'dod pa'i phyir ro zhes snying rjes sems can gyi sdug bsngal bsal bar bya'o snyam du sems pa ste /
analyzed: byang chub kyi sems rnam pa bzhi'i rtsa ba gang zhen zhes dris pa dang / de'i lan du byang chub kyi sems rnam pa bzhi'i rtsa ba ni snying rje yin par 'dod pa'i phyir ro zhes snying rjes sems can gyi sdug bsngal bsal bar bya'o snyam du sems pa ste /
translated: The answer is: The root of the four kinds of enlightenment mind is held to be compassion.

original: des sems can thams cad bsdus nas gnas so //
analyzed: des sems can thams cad bsdus nas gnas so //
translated: Having gathered all sentient beings, it abides.

original: gal te snying rje rtsa bar gyur pa med na ni sems can rnams kyi don du byang chub kyi sems rnams kyang mi skyed kyi nyan thos bzhin du mya ngan las 'das par 'jug par 'gyur te /
analyzed: gal te snying rje rtsa bar gyur pa med na ni sems can rnams kyi don du byang chub kyi sems rnams kyang mi skyed kyi nyan thos bzhin du mya ngan las 'das par 'jug par 'gyur te /
translated: If there were no root in the form of compassion, then the enlightenment minds would not be generated for the sake of sentient beings, and they would enter nirvana like the Sravakas.

original: de bas na rtsa ba ni snying rje'o //
analyzed: de bas na rtsa ba ni snying rje'o //

analyzed: zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: Always intending to benefit sentient beings.

original: 'khor ba'i mtha'i bar du sems can thams cad zang zing rnam pa sna tshogs kyis phan btags te /
analyzed: 'khor ba'i mtha'i bar du sems can thams cad zang zing rnam pa sna tshogs kyis phan btags te /
translated: Until the end of cyclic existence, they benefit all sentient beings with various material things.

original: tshe 'dir mi dge ba las bzlog cing dge ba la gzhag pa dang / tshe rabs gzhan du mya ngan las 'das pa la 'god do snyam du sems pa ni byang chub kyi sems de dag gi bsam ba'o //

original: de'i ye shes ni theg pa chen po'i ye shes te /

original: rnam par mi rtog pa'i ye shes la bya'o //
analyzed: rnam par mi rtog pa'i ye shes la bya'o //
