original: mos pas spyod pa'i sa la gnas nas dang po ji ltar thob par bya zhes bya ba dang / sa bcu ba thob pa dang / sangs rgyas kyi sa ji @53b ltar thob par bya zhes 'dod pa ni byang chub kyi sems de dag gi theg pa yin te /
analyzed: mos pas spyod pa'i sa la gnas nas dang po ji ltar thob par bya zhes bya ba dang / sa bcu ba thob pa dang / sangs rgyas kyi sa ji @53b ltar thob par bya zhes 'dod pa ni byang chub kyi sems de dag gi theg pa yin te /
translated: The desire for the higher is the vehicle of those spirits of enlightenment.

original: 'dod pa des sa gong nas gong du 'phar ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'dod pa des sa gong nas gong du 'phar ba'i phyir ro //
translated: The desire for the higher is the vehicle of those spirits of enlightenment.üîΩThe desire for the

original: byang chub kyi sems de dag gi rten gang zhe na /üîΩde'i phyir / sdom pa rgya chen de yi rten //
analyzed: byang chub kyi sems de dag gi rten gang zhe na / de'i phyir / sdom pa rgya chen de yi rten //
translated: What is the basis of those thoughts of enlightenment?üîΩTherefore he says:

original: zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: The basis of those is the vast vow.

original: byang chub sems dpa'i sdom pa dang / sdom pa'i tshul khrims dang / sems can don byed pa'i tshul khrims dang / dge ba sdud pa'i tshul khrims ni byang chub kyi sems de dag gi rten yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i sdom pa dang / sdom pa'i tshul khrims dang / sems can don byed pa'i tshul khrims dang / dge ba sdud pa'i tshul khrims ni byang chub kyi sems de dag gi rten yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that the vow of the bodhisattva, the morality of the vow, the morality of working for the benefit of sentient beings, and the morality of gathering virtuous natures are the basis of those thoughts of enlightenment.

original: byang chub kyi sems de dag gi bar du gcod pa gang zhe na /
analyzed: byang chub kyi sems de dag gi bar du gcod pa gang zhe na /
translated: What is the obstruction to those thoughts of enlightenment?üîΩTherefore he says:

original: de'i phyir mi mthun pa'i phyogs rnams skye ba la bar du gcod pa'o zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: de'i phyir mi mthun pa'i phyogs rnams skye ba la bar du gcod pa'o zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: Obstruction is the arising of adverse factors.

original: byang chub kyi sems de ni bdag dang gzhan la phan par sems pa yin /
analyzed: byang chub kyi sems de ni bdag dang gzhan la phan par sems pa yin /
translated: The thought of enlightenment is the thought of benefit for oneself and others.

original: sems de dang mi mthun pa ni bdag 'ba' zhig mya ngan las 'das par 'gro bar sems pa'i sems nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas kyi sems la bya ste /
analyzed: sems de dang mi mthun pa ni bdag 'ba' zhig mya ngan las 'das par 'gro bar sems pa'i sems nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas kyi sems la bya ste /
translated: The thought adverse to that is the thought of the ≈õrƒÅvaka and pratyekabuddha, which is the thought of going to nirvƒÅ·πáa for oneself alone.

original: theg pa chung du'i sems bskyed par gyur pa nyams su blangs te ma spangs na byang chub kyi sems mi 'byung bas de ni bar du gcod pa yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: theg pa chung du'i sems bskyed par gyur pa nyams su blangs te ma spangs na byang chub kyi sems mi 'byung bas de ni bar du gcod pa yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: If one does not abandon the practice of generating the thought of the Lesser Vehicle, the thought of enlightenment does not arise. Therefore, it is said that this is an obstacle.

original: byang chub de dag gi sems kyi rang bzhin gang zhe na /üîΩde'i phyir / bsod nams ye shes rang bzhin te //
analyzed: byang chub de dag gi sems kyi rang bzhin gang zhe na / de'i phyir / bsod nams ye shes rang bzhin te //
translated: What is the nature of the thought of enlightenment?üîΩTherefore, it is said:

original: zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: It has the nature of merit and intuition.

original: byang chub kyi sems ni rnam pa gnyis te ;
analyzed: byang chub kyi sems ni rnam pa gnyis te ;
translated: The thought of enlightenment is twofold:

original: snying rje'i mtshan nyid dang / shes rab kyi mtshan nyid do //
analyzed: snying rje'i mtshan nyid dang / shes rab kyi mtshan nyid do //
translated: the nature of compassion and the nature of wisdom.

original: de la snying rje'i mtshan nyid ni sems can thams cad mya ngan las 'da'o snyam du sems pa ste /
analyzed: de la snying rje'i mtshan nyid ni sems can thams cad mya ngan las 'da'o snyam du sems pa ste /
translated: Among them, the nature of compassion is the thought, ‚ÄúI will lead all sentient beings to nirvana.‚Äù

original: de ni bsod nams kyi rang bzhin no //
analyzed: de ni bsod nams kyi rang bzhin no //
translated: That has the nature of merit.

original: shes rab kyi mtshan nyid ni chos thams cad stong pa yin pas sems can gang yang mya ngan las 'das pa med do snyam du sems pa ste /
analyzed: shes rab kyi mtshan nyid ni chos thams cad stong pa yin pas sems can gang yang mya ngan las 'das pa med do snyam du sems pa ste /
translated: The nature of wisdom is the thought, ‚ÄúSince all things are empty, there are no sentient beings at all to lead to nirvana.‚Äù

original: de ni ye shes kyi rang bzhin no //
analyzed: de ni ye shes kyi rang bzhin no //
translated: That has the nature of intuition.

original: byang chub kyi sems de dag gi legs pa gang zhe na /üîΩde'i phyir / dge ba 'phel ba legs pa'o //
analyzed: byang chub kyi sems de dag gi legs pa gang zhe na / de'i phyir / dge ba 'phel ba legs pa'o //
translated: What is the excellence of those thoughts of enlightenment?üîΩTherefore he says:

original: zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: The increase of virtue is excellence.

original: byang chub kyi sems bskyed pa las nam mkha'i khams ji tsam pa dang / sems can gyi khams ji tsam pa dang / 'jig rten gyi khams ji tsam pa de tsam gyi bsod nams 'phel bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: byang chub kyi sems bskyed pa las nam mkha'i khams ji tsam pa dang / sems can gyi khams ji tsam pa dang / 'jig rten gyi khams ji tsam pa de tsam gyi bsod nams 'phel bar 'gyur ro //
translated: From the generation of the thought of enlightenment there is an increase of merit to the extent of the realm of space, to the extent of the realm of sentient beings, to the extent of the realm of the world.

original: de ni byang chub kyi sems kyi legs pa yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: de ni byang chub kyi sems kyi legs pa yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: This is the excellence of the thought of enlightenment.

original: byang chub kyi sems de dag gi 'khor ba las ji ltar 'byung zhe na /
analyzed: byang chub kyi sems de dag gi 'khor ba las ji ltar 'byung zhe na /
translated: How does that thought of enlightenment bring about the deliverance from cyclic existence?üîΩTherefore he says:

original: de'i phyir / rtag tu pha rol phyin pa sbyar //
analyzed: de'i phyir / rtag tu pha rol phyin pa sbyar //
translated: Always applying the perfections,

original: @54a * // de ni 'byung bar brjod pa'o //üîΩzhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: @54a * // de ni 'byung bar brjod pa'o //üîΩzhes bya ba smos te /
translated: that is said to be deliverance.

original: khams gsum nas 'byung ba dang / bla na med pa'i byang chub thob par bya ba'i phyir pha rol tu phyin pa drug la spyad cing sbyor na 'khor ba las 'byung bar 'gyur bas na 'byung bar byed pa ni pha rol tu phyin pa drug yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: khams gsum nas 'byung ba dang / bla na med pa'i byang chub thob par bya ba'i phyir pha rol tu phyin pa drug la spyad cing sbyor na 'khor ba las 'byung bar 'gyur bas na 'byung bar byed pa ni pha rol tu phyin pa drug yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The six perfections are the means of deliverance from the three realms, because one practices and applies oneself to the six perfections in order to attain the unsurpassed enlightenment.

original: byang chub kyi sems de dag gi mthar thug pa gang zhe na /
analyzed: byang chub kyi sems de dag gi mthar thug pa gang zhe na /
translated: What is the culmination of those enlightenments?üîΩTherefore, it is said:

original: de'i phyir / so so rang gi sbyor ba yis //
analyzed: de'i phyir / so so rang gi sbyor ba yis //
translated: By one's own application,

original: de ni sa yi mthar thug ste //
analyzed: de ni sa yi mthar thug ste //
translated: that is the culmination of the stages.

original: zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: That is said.

original: sa bcu re re nas rdzogs par thob pa la sa'i mthar thug pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: sa bcu re re nas rdzogs par thob pa la sa'i mthar thug pa zhes bya'o //
translated: The culmination of the stages is called the culmination of each stage, from the first to the tenth.

original: de ltar sa'i mthar thug par 'gyur ba yang sa dang po la spyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa la sbyar te /
analyzed: de ltar sa'i mthar thug par 'gyur ba yang sa dang po la spyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa la sbyar te /
translated: Thus, the culmination of the stages is also the application to the perfection of giving on the first stage.

original: sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa rdzogs nas sa dang po mthar phyin pa zhes bya ba nas /
analyzed: sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa rdzogs nas sa dang po mthar phyin pa zhes bya ba nas /
translated: After completing the perfection of giving, it is called the culmination of the first stage, up to

original: sa bcu pa ye shes kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la sbyar te /
analyzed: sa bcu pa ye shes kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la sbyar te /
translated: The tenth is applied to the perfection of knowledge on the tenth stage.

original: ye shes kyi pha rol tu phyin pa rdzogs pa dang / sa bcu pa mthar phyin pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: ye shes kyi pha rol tu phyin pa rdzogs pa dang / sa bcu pa mthar phyin pa zhes bya'o //
translated: The perfection of knowledge is complete, and the tenth stage is completed.

original: byang chub sems dpa'i sems bskyed pa gdon mi za bar rig par bya'o zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i sems bskyed pa gdon mi za bar rig par bya'o zhes bya ba la /
translated: The bodhisattva's generation of the thought should be known as inevitable.

original: rnam pa bcu gcig dris pa las de bzhin du lan btab pa de ni byang chub sems dpa'i sems bskyed pa rnam pa bzhi gdon mi za ba yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: rnam pa bcu gcig dris pa las de bzhin du lan btab pa de ni byang chub sems dpa'i sems bskyed pa rnam pa bzhi gdon mi za ba yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The eleven aspects are asked about, and the answer is given accordingly. This is the meaning of the bodhisattva's generation of the thought being inevitable in four aspects.

original: brda'i dam bca' bar sems bskyed pa tshigs su bcad pa zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: brda'i dam bca' bar sems bskyed pa tshigs su bcad pa zhes bya ba la /
translated: The generation of the thought of the pledge of the conventional is in verses.

original: byang chub tu sems bskyed pa rnam pa gnyis yod do //
analyzed: byang chub tu sems bskyed pa rnam pa gnyis yod do //
translated: There are two kinds of generation of the thought of enlightenment.

original: brda'i dam bca' bar sems bskyed pa dang / don dam ba'i byang chub kyi sems so //
analyzed: brda'i dam bca' bar sems bskyed pa dang / don dam ba'i byang chub kyi sems so //
translated: The generation of the thought of the pledge of the conventional and the ultimate generation of the thought of enlightenment.

original: de la brda'i dam bca' bar byang chub tu sems bskyed pa ni so so'i skye bo'i dus na sems bskyed pas na mos pas spyod pa'i sa 'jig rten chos mchog man chad kyi tshe sems bskyed pa la bya ste /
analyzed: de la brda'i dam bca' bar byang chub tu sems bskyed pa ni so so'i skye bo'i dus na sems bskyed pas na mos pas spyod pa'i sa 'jig rten chos mchog man chad kyi tshe sems bskyed pa la bya ste /
translated: The generation of the resolve for enlightenment in the pledge of symbol is the generation of the resolve at the time of the stage of devoted conduct, prior to the supreme mundane state, because one generates the resolve as an ordinary being.

original: de yang dge ba'i bshes gnyen gyis byang chub tu sems bskyed na bdag dang gzhan gyi don phun sum tshogs par 'gyur pas sems bskyed pa'i rigs zhes bskul ba'am /
analyzed: de yang dge ba'i bshes gnyen gyis byang chub tu sems bskyed na bdag dang gzhan gyi don phun sum tshogs par 'gyur pas sems bskyed pa'i rigs zhes bskul ba'am /
translated: Moreover, if one generates the resolve for enlightenment through a spiritual friend, one is urged, ‚ÄúYou should generate the resolve because you will be endowed with the aims of self and other.‚Äù

original: bdag nyid kyi dge ba'i rtsa ba'i mthus byang chub tu sems bskyed pa ste /
analyzed: bdag nyid kyi dge ba'i rtsa ba'i mthus byang chub tu sems bskyed pa ste /
translated: Or, one generates the resolve for enlightenment through the power of ones own roots of virtue.

original: de yang mkhan po dang slob dpon la sogs pas sems bskyed pa'i tshig ji skad brjod pa bzhin du tshig byung ba na sems bskyed pa ni brda'i dam bca' bar sems bskyed pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de yang mkhan po dang slob dpon la sogs pas sems bskyed pa'i tshig ji skad brjod pa bzhin du tshig byung ba na sems bskyed pa ni brda'i dam bca' bar sems bskyed pa zhes bya'o //
translated: Moreover, when one generates the resolve by the words of the preceptor, the master, etc., just as they are spoken, it is called the generation of the resolve in the pledge of symbol.

original: de la don dam pa'i byang chub kyi sems ni sa dang po yan chad kyi dus nas skye'o //
analyzed: de la don dam pa'i byang chub kyi sems ni sa dang po yan chad kyi dus nas skye'o //
translated: The ultimate generation of the resolve for enlightenment arises from the first stage on.

original: grogs stobs rgyu stobs rtsa @54b ba'i stobs //
analyzed: grogs stobs rgyu stobs rtsa @54b ba'i stobs //
translated: The power of friends, the power of cause, the power of root,

original: thos pa'i stobs dang thos goms stobs //
analyzed: thos pa'i stobs dang thos goms stobs //
translated: The power of hearing, the power of familiarization with hearing,

original: brtan dang mi brtan skye bar gsungs //
analyzed: brtan dang mi brtan skye bar gsungs //
translated: The power of stability, and the power of instability are taught.

original: sems bskyed gzhan gyis bstan pa'o //üîΩzhes bya ba la /
analyzed: sems bskyed gzhan gyis bstan pa'o // zhes bya ba la /
translated: The generation of the Thought is taught by others.

original: grogs stobs zhes bya ba'i tshig dang / sems bskyed gzhan gyis bstan pa zhes bya ba'i tshig gnyis su sbyar te /üîΩsems bskyed pa gang mkhan po'am slob dpon nam /
analyzed: grogs stobs zhes bya ba'i tshig dang / sems bskyed gzhan gyis bstan pa zhes bya ba'i tshig gnyis su sbyar te / sems bskyed pa gang mkhan po'am slob dpon nam /
translated: The two phrases ‚Äúthe power of friends‚Äù and ‚Äúthe generation of the Thought is taught by others‚Äù are to be applied.üîΩIf one generates the Thought of enlightenment through a preceptor or an ƒÅcƒÅrya or a spiritual friend, since there is the appearance of great benefit and excellence, it is the type of Thought that should be generated.

original: dge ba'i bshes gnyen la la zhig gis byang chub tu sems bskyed na phan pa dang legs pa rgya chen po 'byung bas sems bskyed pa'i rigs so zhes bya ba'i chos bstan pa las byang chub tu sems bskyed pa ni grogs kyi stobs kyis sems bskyed pa zhes
analyzed: dge ba'i bshes gnyen la la zhig gis byang chub tu sems bskyed na phan pa dang legs pa rgya chen po 'byung bas sems bskyed pa'i rigs so zhes bya ba'i chos bstan pa las byang chub tu sems bskyed pa ni grogs kyi stobs kyis sems bskyed pa zhes
translated: The generation of the Thought of enlightenment from the teaching of the Dharma, ‚ÄúIt is right to generate the Thought of enlightenment,‚Äù is the generation of the Thought by the power of friends.

original: bya'o // byang chub sems dpa'i rigs yod pas rigs kyi mthus shugs kyis bskul nas byang chub tu sems bskyed pa ni rgyu'i stobs kyis sems bskyed pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: bya'o // byang chub sems dpa'i rigs yod pas rigs kyi mthus shugs kyis bskul nas byang chub tu sems bskyed pa ni rgyu'i stobs kyis sems bskyed pa zhes bya'o //
translated: The power of cause is the generation of the Thought by the force of the family, i.e. by the family's power, when one has the Bodhisattva family.

original: rgyu dang rigs dag ni don gcig go //
analyzed: rgyu dang rigs dag ni don gcig go //
translated: Cause and family are synonymous.

original: tshe rabs snga ma la theg pa chen po'i chos don zab cing rgya che ba rtogs par 'gyur ba dang ; byang chub tu sems bskyed par 'gyur ba'i dge ba'i rtsa ba dang / bsod nams kyi tshogs bsags pas rigs brtas par gyur nas byung chub tu sems bskyed pa ni rtsa ba'i stobs kyis sems bskyed pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: tshe rabs snga ma la theg pa chen po'i chos don zab cing rgya che ba rtogs par 'gyur ba dang ; byang chub tu sems bskyed par 'gyur ba'i dge ba'i rtsa ba dang / bsod nams kyi tshogs bsags pas rigs brtas par gyur nas byung chub tu sems bskyed pa ni rtsa ba'i stobs kyis sems bskyed pa zhes bya'o //
translated: The power of root is the generation of the Thought when the family has been developed by the accumulation of the roots of virtue and the accumulation of merit in previous lives, which will lead to the understanding of the profound and extensive meaning of the Mahayana Dharma and to the generation of the Thought of Enlightenment.

original: tshe rabs snga ma la theg pa chen po'i chos nyan pa dang / bsam pa dang / bsgom pa bya ste /
analyzed: tshe rabs snga ma la theg pa chen po'i chos nyan pa dang / bsam pa dang / bsgom pa bya ste /
translated: In previous lives, one has listened to the Mahayana Dharma, reflected on it, and meditated on it.

original: ye shes kyi tshogs bsags pas tshe 'dir byang chub tu sems bskyed pa ni thos pa'i stobs kyis sems bskyed pa zhes bya ste /
analyzed: ye shes kyi tshogs bsags pas tshe 'dir byang chub tu sems bskyed pa ni thos pa'i stobs kyis sems bskyed pa zhes bya ste /
translated: The generation of the Thought of Enlightenment in this life through the accumulation of the collection of intuition is called the generation of the Thought by the power of hearing.

original: yang na de bzhin gshegs pas lang kar gshegs pa la sogs pa'i mdo sde de dang de dag bshad pa na lha dang mi la sogs pa'i 'gro ba mang po byang chub tu sems bskyed pa ni thos pa'i stobs kyis sems bskyed pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: yang na de bzhin gshegs pas lang kar gshegs pa la sogs pa'i mdo sde de dang de dag bshad pa na lha dang mi la sogs pa'i 'gro ba mang po byang chub tu sems bskyed pa ni thos pa'i stobs kyis sems bskyed pa zhes bya'o //
translated: Or, when the Tathagata explains this or that sutra, such as the Lanka vatara, many beings, gods, men, etc., generate the Thought of Enlightenment; this is called the generation of the Thought by the power of hearing.

original: tshe 'di la dge ba'i bshes gnyen mang po las chos thos pa yang lan grangs mang du mnyan te /
analyzed: tshe 'di la dge ba'i bshes gnyen mang po las chos thos pa yang lan grangs mang du mnyan te /
translated: Also, in this life, one hears the Dharma from many spiritual benefactors, and one hears it many times.

original: chos dang don shes kyis mthong nas sems bskyed pa ni thos ba goms pa'i stobs kyis sems bskyed pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: chos dang don shes kyis mthong nas sems bskyed pa ni thos ba goms pa'i stobs kyis sems bskyed pa zhes bya'o //
translated: Having seen the Dharma and its meaning, one generates the Thought; this is called the generation of the Thought by the power of cultivation of hearing.

original: de ltar brda'i dam bcas par sems bskyed pa rnam pa lnga las grogs kyis sems bskyed pa ni mi brtan pa'i mtshan nyid du skye bar gsungs pa ste /
analyzed: de ltar brda'i dam bcas par sems bskyed pa rnam pa lnga las grogs kyis sems bskyed pa ni mi brtan pa'i mtshan nyid du skye bar gsungs pa ste /
translated: Thus, from among the five kinds of generation of the Thought which is a verbal promise, it is said that the generation of the Thought by the power of friends is born with the characteristic of instability.

original: phyi nas de la ldog pa yod pa'i phyir ro //üîΩrgyu'i stobs dang thos pa'i stobs dang thos bgoms pa'i stobs kyis sems bskyed pa ni brtan pa'i mtshan nyid du @55a * //
analyzed: phyi nas de la ldog pa yod pa'i phyir ro // rgyu'i stobs dang thos pa'i stobs dang thos bgoms pa'i stobs kyis sems bskyed pa ni brtan pa'i mtshan nyid du @55a * //
translated: because it can be turned back later.

original: gsungs pa ste /
analyzed: gsungs pa ste /
translated: The generation of the Thought by the power of cause, by the power of hearing, and by the power of cultivation of hearing is said to be of the nature of stability.

original: de dag la slar ldog pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de dag la slar ldog pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it cannot be turned back in those.

original: gzhan gyis bstan pa la sems bskyed pa ni gzhan gyis go bar byas pa las brdas yi dam 'dzin pa zhes bya'o zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: gzhan gyis bstan pa la sems bskyed pa ni gzhan gyis go bar byas pa las brdas yi dam 'dzin pa zhes bya'o zhes bya ba la /
translated: The generation of the Thought by the teaching of another is called the generation of the Thought by the holding of the vow through the sign of the other's understanding.

original: mkhan po 'am slob dpon nam dge ba'i bshes gnyen 'ba' zhig gis 'di snyam du sems la /
analyzed: mkhan po 'am slob dpon nam dge ba'i bshes gnyen 'ba' zhig gis 'di snyam du sems la /
translated: The teacher, the master, or the spiritual friend alone thinks,

original: tshig tu 'di skad brjod cig ces bsgo ste /
analyzed: tshig tu 'di skad brjod cig ces bsgo ste /
translated: Speak thus!

original: go bar byas pas 'di bzhin du brjod na byang chub tu sems bskyed pa ni brdas yi dam 'dzin pa'i sems bskyed pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: go bar byas pas 'di bzhin du brjod na byang chub tu sems bskyed pa ni brdas yi dam 'dzin pa'i sems bskyed pa zhes bya'o //
translated: and by the understanding, if one speaks in this way, the generation of the Thought of enlightenment is called the generation of the Thought by the holding of the vow through the sign.

original: de'i rigs rgyas bas zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: de'i rigs rgyas bas zhes bya ba la /
translated: By the development of its lineage.

original: theg pa chen po rtogs pa'i dge ba'i rtsa ba dang bsod nams bsags pas byang chub kyi rigs brtas par gyur nas byang chub tu sems bskyed pa ni rtsa ba'i stobs kyis sems bskyed pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: theg pa chen po rtogs pa'i dge ba'i rtsa ba dang bsod nams bsags pas byang chub kyi rigs brtas par gyur nas byang chub tu sems bskyed pa ni rtsa ba'i stobs kyis sems bskyed pa zhes bya'o //
translated: When the family of enlightenment has been strengthened by the accumulation of the roots of virtue and merit that are the realizations of the Great Vehicle, and the mind of enlightenment has been generated, this is called the generation of the mind of enlightenment by the power of the root.

original: don dam pa'i sems bskyed tshigs su bcad bzhes bya ba la /
analyzed: don dam pa'i sems bskyed tshigs su bcad bzhes bya ba la /
translated: The ultimate generation of the mind of enlightenment is in verses.

original: gang gi tshe gang zag dang chos la bdag med par rtogs nas chos kyi dbyings thams cad du 'gro ba'i mtshan nyid du khong du chud de gzung ba dang 'dzin pa gnyis spangs nas gzung ba la yang mi rtog /'dzin pa la yang rnam par mi rtog pa'i
analyzed: gang gi tshe gang zag dang chos la bdag med par rtogs nas chos kyi dbyings thams cad du 'gro ba'i mtshan nyid du khong du chud de gzung ba dang 'dzin pa gnyis spangs nas gzung ba la yang mi rtog /'dzin pa la yang rnam par mi rtog pa'i
translated: When one has realized the selflessness of persons and of phenomena, and has understood the nature of the realm of totality, and has abandoned the duality of object and subject, and the wisdom that does not conceive of an object and does not conceive of a subject has arisen,

original: ye shes skyes pas na don dam pa'i byang chub tu sems bskyed pa zhes bya ste /
analyzed: ye shes skyes pas na don dam pa'i byang chub tu sems bskyed pa zhes bya ste /
translated: this is called the generation of the ultimate mind of enlightenment.

original: de yangs dang bo thob pa'i tshe na don dam pa'i byang chub kyi sems skye'o //
analyzed: de yangs dang bo thob pa'i tshe na don dam pa'i byang chub kyi sems skye'o //
translated: When one first attains that, the ultimate mind of enlightenment is generated.

original: don dam pa'i byang chub kyi sems de rgyu dang yon tan dang rang bzhin la sogs pa'i tshigs su bcad pa bdun pa bstan to zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: don dam pa'i byang chub kyi sems de rgyu dang yon tan dang rang bzhin la sogs pa'i tshigs su bcad pa bdun pa bstan to zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The seven verses on the ultimate thought of awakening explain the cause, the qualities, the nature, and so on of the ultimate thought of awakening.

original: rnam par mi rtog pa'i ye shes de la ci'i phyir don dam ba'i byang chub kyi sems zhes bya zhe na /
analyzed: rnam par mi rtog pa'i ye shes de la ci'i phyir don dam ba'i byang chub kyi sems zhes bya zhe na /
translated: Why is that nonconceptual wisdom called the ultimate thought of awakening?

original: lung dam pa la mnos pa dang / rgyu dam pa bsgrub pa dang / rang bzhin dam pa khong du chud par bya ba'i phyir don dam pa'i byang chub kyi sems zhes bya'o zhes bstan par 'dod nas /
analyzed: lung dam pa la mnos pa dang / rgyu dam pa bsgrub pa dang / rang bzhin dam pa khong du chud par bya ba'i phyir don dam pa'i byang chub kyi sems zhes bya'o zhes bstan par 'dod nas /
translated: In order to show that it is called the ultimate thought of awakening because it is the commitment to the ultimate scripture, the accomplishment of the ultimate cause, and the realization of the ultimate nature,üîΩhe says:

original: rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas rab bsnyen byas //
analyzed: rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas rab bsnyen byas //
translated: Having served well the perfect buddhas,

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa tshigs su bcad ba gcig smos te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa tshigs su bcad ba gcig smos te /
translated: and so on, one verse.

original: shes bya thams cad thugs su chud pas na rdzogs zhes bya ba la de yang phyin ci ma log par thugs su chud nas sangs rgyas zhes bya'o //
analyzed: shes bya thams cad thugs su chud pas na rdzogs zhes bya ba la de yang phyin ci ma log par thugs su chud nas sangs rgyas zhes bya'o //
translated: Because he has realized all objects of knowledge, he is called perfect. Moreover, having realized them without error, he is called a buddha.

original: mos pas spyod pa'i sar bskal pa grangs med pa gcig tu de bzhin gshegs pa rnams la gdugs dang rgyal mtshan dang / me tog dang bdug pa la sogs pa'i mchod pa dang de bzhin gshegs pa de dag gi thad nas dam pa'i chos nyan @55b pa rnams bsams pa rnams bsgoms par byas pa ni /
analyzed: mos pas spyod pa'i sar bskal pa grangs med pa gcig tu de bzhin gshegs pa rnams la gdugs dang rgyal mtshan dang / me tog dang bdug pa la sogs pa'i mchod pa dang de bzhin gshegs pa de dag gi thad nas dam pa'i chos nyan @55b pa rnams bsams pa rnams bsgoms par byas pa ni /
translated: and he contemplated the holy Dharma in the presence of those Tathagatas.

original: rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas rab bsnyen bya //
analyzed: rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas rab bsnyen bya //
translated: He served well the perfect Buddhas.

original: zhes smos te 'dis ni lung dam pa mnos bar bstan to //
analyzed: zhes smos te 'dis ni lung dam pa mnos bar bstan to //
translated: This shows that he received the holy scriptures.

original: bsod nams ye shes tshogs rab bsags //
analyzed: bsod nams ye shes tshogs rab bsags //
translated: He accumulated the collections of merit and knowledge.

original: zhes bya ba la pha rol tu phyin pa drug las /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la pha rol tu phyin pa drug las /
translated: Among the six perfections,

original: sbyin pa dang tshul khrims dang bzod pa gsum ni bsod nams kyi tshogs so //
analyzed: sbyin pa dang tshul khrims dang bzod pa gsum ni bsod nams kyi tshogs so //
translated: the three of giving, morality, and patience are the collection of merit.üîΩThe two of meditation and wisdom are the collection of knowledge.üîΩAnd effort is in both collections.

original: bsam gtan dang shes rab gnyis ni ye shes kyi tshogs la brtson 'grus gnyis ka'i tshogs te de gnyis kyang bsgrubs zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: bsam gtan dang shes rab gnyis ni ye shes kyi tshogs la brtson 'grus gnyis ka'i tshogs te de gnyis kyang bsgrubs zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: He also accomplished those two.

original: yang na de bzhin gshegs pa rnams la gdugs dang rgyal mtshan la sogs pas mchod pa ni bsod nams kyi tshogs la dam pa'i chos mnyan pa dang bsam pa la sogs pa byas pa ni ye shes kyi tshogs te de gnyis kyang bsgrubs zhes bya ba'i don to
analyzed: yang na de bzhin gshegs pa rnams la gdugs dang rgyal mtshan la sogs pas mchod pa ni bsod nams kyi tshogs la dam pa'i chos mnyan pa dang bsam pa la sogs pa byas pa ni ye shes kyi tshogs te de gnyis kyang bsgrubs zhes bya ba'i don to
translated: Or else, worship of the Tathagatas with parasols, banners, etc. is the accumulation of merit, and listening to the holy Dharma, reflecting on it, etc. is the accumulation of knowledge. The meaning is that he has accomplished those two.

original: // 'dis ni rgyu dam ba bsgrub pa bstan to //
analyzed: // 'dis ni rgyu dam ba bsgrub pa bstan to //
translated: This shows the accomplishment of the highest cause.

original: chos la mi rtog ye shes bskyed //üîΩde phyir de ni dam pa'o //
analyzed: chos la mi rtog ye shes bskyed // de phyir de ni dam pa'o //
translated: The generation of nonconceptual intuition

original: zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la /
translated: with regard to things is the highest.

original: de ltar rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas la yang rab bsnyen byas bsod nams dang ye shes kyi tshogs bsags pas chos rnams la rnam par mi rtog pa'i ye shes te /
analyzed: de ltar rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas la yang rab bsnyen byas bsod nams dang ye shes kyi tshogs bsags pas chos rnams la rnam par mi rtog pa'i ye shes te /
translated: Thus, by attending well on the perfect buddhas and by accumulating the stores of merit and knowledge, he generates nonconceptual intuition with regard to things.

original: 'dis ni rang bzhin dam pa khong du chud par bstan to //
analyzed: 'dis ni rang bzhin dam pa khong du chud par bstan to //
translated: This shows the realization of the highest nature.

original: de la chos ni phung po dang khams dang skye mched la sogs pa bstan pa dang gsung rab yan lag bcu gnyis la bya ste /
analyzed: de la chos ni phung po dang khams dang skye mched la sogs pa bstan pa dang gsung rab yan lag bcu gnyis la bya ste /
translated: Therein, things are the aggregates, media, elements, etc., which are taught, and the twelve branches of the scriptures.

original: de dag la gzung ba'i mtshan nyid la yang mi rtog /
analyzed: de dag la gzung ba'i mtshan nyid la yang mi rtog /
translated: It is also not conceptual in terms of the characteristics of the object.

original: 'dzin pa'i mtshan nyid du yang mi rtog rtag par yang mi rtog mi rtag par yang mi rtog pa ni /
analyzed: 'dzin pa'i mtshan nyid du yang mi rtog rtag par yang mi rtog mi rtag par yang mi rtog pa ni /
translated: It is also not conceptual in terms of the characteristics of the subject. It is not conceptual in terms of permanence or impermanence.

original: chos la mi rtog pa'i ye shes skyes ba zhes bya ste /
analyzed: chos la mi rtog pa'i ye shes skyes ba zhes bya ste /
translated: This is called the arising of the nonconceptual wisdom with regard to phenomena.

original: don du rnam par mi rtog pa'i ye shes thob pa la bya'o //
analyzed: don du rnam par mi rtog pa'i ye shes thob pa la bya'o //
translated: In fact, it is the attainment of nonconceptual wisdom.

original: de ltar lung dam pa dang rgyud dam par bsgrubs pas na rang bzhin dam pa rtogs pa'i phyir rnam par mi rtog pa'i ye shes de la don dam pa'i byang chub kyi sems zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de ltar lung dam pa dang rgyud dam par bsgrubs pas na rang bzhin dam pa rtogs pa'i phyir rnam par mi rtog pa'i ye shes de la don dam pa'i byang chub kyi sems zhes bya'o //
translated: Since it is established as the supreme scripture and the supreme tantra in that way, that nonconceptual wisdom is called the ultimate mind of enlightenment because it realizes the supreme nature.

original: don dam pa'i byang chub kyi sems des dang po'i tshe thob nas dga' ba'i mchog skye bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: don dam pa'i byang chub kyi sems des dang po'i tshe thob nas dga' ba'i mchog skye bar 'gyur te /
translated: When one first attains that ultimate mind of enlightenment, the supreme joy arises.

original: der dga' ba'i mchog skyes pas sa dang po yang ming du sa rab tu dga' ba zhes btags so //
analyzed: der dga' ba'i mchog skyes pas sa dang po yang ming du sa rab tu dga' ba zhes btags so //
translated: Since the supreme joy arises there, the first stage is also designated by the name ‚ÄúVery Joyful.‚Äù

original: ci'i phyir de'i tshe dga' ba skye zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir de'i tshe dga' ba skye zhe na /
translated: Why does joy arise at that time?üîΩTherefore:

original: de'i phyir / chos dang sems can rnams dang ni //
analyzed: de'i phyir / chos dang sems can rnams dang ni //
translated: With regard to phenomena and sentient beings,

original: de ye bya ba dam pa dang // sangs rgyas dang yang sems mnyam nyid //üîΩde ni de yi dga' ba'i mchog //
analyzed: de ye bya ba dam pa dang // sangs rgyas dang yang sems mnyam nyid // de ni de yi dga' ba'i mchog //
translated: That is the supreme sacred action,üîΩand the equality of mind with the buddhas.üîΩüîΩThat is the supreme joy of that.üîΩ

original: ces bshad de /
analyzed: ces bshad de /
translated: That is the supreme joy of the bodhisattva.

original: sa dang po rnam par mi rtog pa'i ye shes thob pa'i tshe /üîΩchos @56a * //
analyzed: sa dang po rnam par mi rtog pa'i ye shes thob pa'i tshe / chos @56a * //
translated: The bodhisattva who has attained the first stage, the Joyous, has attained the four equalities:üîΩequality of mind with regard to all phenomena,üîΩequality of mind with regard to all sentient beings,

original: thams cad la sems mnyam pa rnyed pa dang / sems can thams cad la sems mnyam pa rnyed pa dang / de'i bya ba dam pa la sems mnyam pa rnyed pa dang / sangs rgyas dang yang sems mnyam pa rnyed do //
analyzed: thams cad la sems mnyam pa rnyed pa dang / sems can thams cad la sems mnyam pa rnyed pa dang / de'i bya ba dam pa la sems mnyam pa rnyed pa dang / sangs rgyas dang yang sems mnyam pa rnyed do //
translated: equality of mind with regard to the highest goal, and equality of mind with regard to the buddhas.

original: mnyam pa bzhi rnyed pas brgya byin dang tshangs pa la sogs pa 'jig rten gyi 'byor pa rnyed de dga' ba dang / 'phags pa nyan thos pas 'jig rten las 'das pa'i 'byor pa rnyed de dga' ba bas byang chub sems dpa'i dga' ba'i mchog rnyed pas nas yang rab tu dga' ba zhes bya'o //
analyzed: mnyam pa bzhi rnyed pas brgya byin dang tshangs pa la sogs pa 'jig rten gyi 'byor pa rnyed de dga' ba dang / 'phags pa nyan thos pas 'jig rten las 'das pa'i 'byor pa rnyed de dga' ba bas byang chub sems dpa'i dga' ba'i mchog rnyed pas nas yang rab tu dga' ba zhes bya'o //
translated: Having attained the four equalities, the bodhisattva has attained the worldly excellence of Indra, Brahma, and so on, and is joyful. And he is more joyful than the noble disciples who have attained supramundane excellence. Therefore, the first stage is called the Joyous.

original: de la phung po lnga ji ltar rang bzhin gyis stong pa yin pa de bzhin du khams dang skye mched rnams kyang rang bzhin gyis stong pa yin zhes chos la bdag med pa khong du chud pas sems mnyam pa nyid rnyed pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de la phung po lnga ji ltar rang bzhin gyis stong pa yin pa de bzhin du khams dang skye mched rnams kyang rang bzhin gyis stong pa yin zhes chos la bdag med pa khong du chud pas sems mnyam pa nyid rnyed pa zhes bya'o //
translated: Just as the five aggregates are empty of intrinsic nature, so too are the elements and sense bases empty of intrinsic nature. This is called ‚Äúattaining the sameness of mind‚Äù through comprehending the selflessness of phenomena.

original: ji ltar bdag gang yin pa sems can gzhan yang de bzhin no //
analyzed: ji ltar bdag gang yin pa sems can gzhan yang de bzhin no //
translated: Just as the self is, so too are other sentient beings.

original: gzhan gang yin pa bdag kyang de yin zhes bdag dang gzhan mtshungs par khong du chud pas sems can rnams la sems mnyam pa nyid rnyed pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: gzhan gang yin pa bdag kyang de yin zhes bdag dang gzhan mtshungs par khong du chud pas sems can rnams la sems mnyam pa nyid rnyed pa zhes bya'o //
translated: Just as others are, so too is the self. This is called ‚Äúattaining the sameness of mind toward sentient beings‚Äù through comprehending the sameness of self and others.

original: de'i bya ba zhes bya ba ni sems can rnams kyi don bya ba ste /
analyzed: de'i bya ba zhes bya ba ni sems can rnams kyi don bya ba ste /
translated: ‚ÄúIts activity‚Äù is the activity for the welfare of sentient beings.

original: sems can gyi nyon mongs pa dang / sdug bsngal sel bar byed pa ni de'i bya ba dam pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: sems can gyi nyon mongs pa dang / sdug bsngal sel bar byed pa ni de'i bya ba dam pa zhes bya'o //
translated: The removal of the afflictions and suffering of sentient beings is called ‚Äúits sublime activity.‚Äù

original: ji ltar bdag gi kun 'byung gi mtshan nyid nyon mongs pa dang / sdug bsngal gyi mtshan nyid skye rga na 'chi spang bar bya ba de bzhin du sems can rnams kyi kun 'byung gi mtshan nyid nyon mongs pa dang / sdug bsngal gyi mtshan nyid skye rga na 'chi spang bar bya'o snyam du sems pas de'i bya ba dam pa la sems mnyam pa nyid rnyed pa zhes bya ste /
analyzed: ji ltar bdag gi kun 'byung gi mtshan nyid nyon mongs pa dang / sdug bsngal gyi mtshan nyid skye rga na 'chi spang bar bya ba de bzhin du sems can rnams kyi kun 'byung gi mtshan nyid nyon mongs pa dang / sdug bsngal gyi mtshan nyid skye rga na 'chi spang bar bya'o snyam du sems pas de'i bya ba dam pa la sems mnyam pa nyid rnyed pa zhes bya ste /
translated: Just as I have eliminated the characteristics of the origin of suffering, which are the afflictions, and the characteristics of suffering, which are birth, aging, sickness, and death, in the same way I will eliminate the characteristics of the origin of suffering, which are the afflictions, and the characteristics of suffering, which are birth, aging, sickness, and death, of all sentient beings.üîΩThis is called ‚Äúfinding the same attitude as the highest aim of beings.‚ÄùüîΩThis is also mentioned in the sutra: ‚ÄúOn the first bodhisattva level, called ‚Äòjoyful,‚Äô one attains the highest goal for the sake of sentient beings and one is filled with joy.‚Äù

original: de'ang sa bcu'i sa dang po'i nang nas sems can gyi don rab tu thob par bya ba rjes su dran cing rab tu dga' ba yin zhes bya ba dang / bdag ni sems can thams cad kyi gnas su gyur to zhes rab tu dga' ba bskyed do zhes gsungs pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: de'ang sa bcu'i sa dang po'i nang nas sems can gyi don rab tu thob par bya ba rjes su dran cing rab tu dga' ba yin zhes bya ba dang / bdag ni sems can thams cad kyi gnas su gyur to zhes rab tu dga' ba bskyed do zhes gsungs pa lta bu'o //
translated: And: ‚ÄúOne generates joy, thinking, ‚ÄòI have become a refuge for all sentient beings.‚Äô‚Äù

original: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyi chos kyi sku gang yin pa dang / bdag gis rtogs pa'i chos kyi dbyings kyi chos sku gang yin pa gnyis su tha dad pa med par khong du chud pas sangs rgyas dang sems mnyam pa rnyed pa zhes bya ste /
analyzed: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyi chos kyi sku gang yin pa dang / bdag gis rtogs pa'i chos kyi dbyings kyi chos sku gang yin pa gnyis su tha dad pa med par khong du chud pas sangs rgyas dang sems mnyam pa rnyed pa zhes bya ste /
translated: Since one realizes that the dharmakaya of the Bhagavan Buddhas and the dharmadhatu of one's own realization are not different, one is said to have attained the equality of mind with the Buddha.

original: de bas na sa bcu'i mdo las kyang bdag ni sangs rgyas kyi sa dang nye bar gyur to zhes rab tu dga' ba bskyed do zhes bya ba dang / bdag gis de bzhin gshegs @56b pa thams cad mthong bar 'gyur ba dang nye bar gyur to zhes rab tu dga' ba bskyed do //
analyzed: de bas na sa bcu'i mdo las kyang bdag ni sangs rgyas kyi sa dang nye bar gyur to zhes rab tu dga' ba bskyed do zhes bya ba dang / bdag gis de bzhin gshegs @56b pa thams cad mthong bar 'gyur ba dang nye bar gyur to zhes rab tu dga' ba bskyed do //
translated: Therefore, in the Dashabhumika Sutra it says, One generates the utmost joy, thinking, 'I have come close to the stage of the Buddha.' And it says, One generates the utmost joy, thinking, 'I have come close to seeing all the Tathagatas.'

original: bdag ni de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi yul la yang dag par 'byung ngo zhes rab tu dga' ba bskyed do zhes gsungs pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: bdag ni de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi yul la yang dag par 'byung ngo zhes rab tu dga' ba bskyed do zhes gsungs pa lta bu'o //
translated: One generates the utmost joy, thinking, 'I have entered the domain of all the Tathagatas.'

original: don dam pa'i byang chub kyi sems de don rnam pa drug dang ldan par bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: don dam pa'i byang chub kyi sems de don rnam pa drug dang ldan par bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to demonstrate that ultimate bodhichitta has six aspects, the text says:

original: skye ba rgya che de la spro //
analyzed: skye ba rgya che de la spro //
translated: Its birth is vast, and it is joyful.

original: bsam pa yang ni rnam par dag / lhag ma dag la mkhas pa dang // 'byung ba nyid du shes par bya //üîΩzhes bshad do //
analyzed: bsam pa yang ni rnam par dag / lhag ma dag la mkhas pa dang // 'byung ba nyid du shes par bya // zhes bshad do //
translated: Its intention is also pure, and it is skilled in the rest, and it is known to be the emergence.

original: don rnam pa drug ni skye ba'i don dang / rgya che ba'i don dang / spro ba'i don dang / bsam pa rnam par dag pa'i don dang lhag ma la mkhas pa'i don dang ; 'byung ba nyid kyi don to //
analyzed: don rnam pa drug ni skye ba'i don dang / rgya che ba'i don dang / spro ba'i don dang / bsam pa rnam par dag pa'i don dang lhag ma la mkhas pa'i don dang ; 'byung ba nyid kyi don to //
translated: The meaning of the six categories is the meaning of birth, the meaning of vastness, the meaning of joy, the meaning of pure intention, the meaning of skill in the rest, and the meaning of emergence.

original: byang chub kyi sems de gnas gang nas skye ba bstan pa ni skye ba'i don to //
analyzed: byang chub kyi sems de gnas gang nas skye ba bstan pa ni skye ba'i don to //
translated: The teaching on the place of birth of that thought of awakening is the meaning of birth.

original: nyan thos dag ni bdag gi don du sems bskyed kyi byang chub sems dpa' rnams ni bdag dang gzhan gnyi ga'i don du sems bskyed pas rgya che ba'i don dang ldan no //
analyzed: nyan thos dag ni bdag gi don du sems bskyed kyi byang chub sems dpa' rnams ni bdag dang gzhan gnyi ga'i don du sems bskyed pas rgya che ba'i don dang ldan no //
translated: The meaning of vastness is that the thought of awakening of the bodhisattvas is vast because it is generated for the sake of both oneself and others, while the thought of awakening of the ≈õrƒÅvakas is generated for the sake of oneself alone.

original: nyan thos dag ni bdag gi don bya bar spro'o //
analyzed: nyan thos dag ni bdag gi don bya bar spro'o //
translated: The meaning of joy is that the ≈õrƒÅvakas are joyful in working for their own benefit,üîΩbut the bodhisattvas are joyful in working for the benefit of others.

original: byang chub sems dpa' rnams ni bdag gzhan gnyi ga'i don bya bar spro bas spro ba'i don dang ldan no //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' rnams ni bdag gzhan gnyi ga'i don bya bar spro bas spro ba'i don dang ldan no //
translated: Bodhisattvas are enthusiastic about working for the benefit of both themselves and others, so they have the meaning of enthusiasm.

original: nyan thos rnams ni nyon mongs pa'i sgrib pa dag nas rang gi byang chub kyi 'bras bu thob pa tsam du zad kyi byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi sa ni nyon mongs pa dang shes bya'i sgrib pa gnyis dag nas bla na med pa'i byang chub thob par
analyzed: nyan thos rnams ni nyon mongs pa'i sgrib pa dag nas rang gi byang chub kyi 'bras bu thob pa tsam du zad kyi byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi sa ni nyon mongs pa dang shes bya'i sgrib pa gnyis dag nas bla na med pa'i byang chub thob par
translated: The listeners, having purified the obscurations of defilement, obtain the result of their enlightenment, but the bodhisattvas' levels are obtained by purifying both the obscurations of defilement and of the knowable and attaining unsurpassable enlightenment.

original: shes pas na bsam pa rnam par dag pa'i don dang ldan no //
analyzed: shes pas na bsam pa rnam par dag pa'i don dang ldan no //
translated: So they have the meaning of a completely pure intention.

original: nyan thos dag ni rgyun du zhugs pa thob pa dang / lan cig phyir 'ong ba dang / phyir mi 'ong ba dang / dgra bcom pa'i sa la mkhas pa tsam du zad de byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyis dang po thob pa dang / sa gnyis pa yan chad sa bcu pa man chad kyi sa'i rang bzhin dang yon tan la mkhas pa dang /
analyzed: nyan thos dag ni rgyun du zhugs pa thob pa dang / lan cig phyir 'ong ba dang / phyir mi 'ong ba dang / dgra bcom pa'i sa la mkhas pa tsam du zad de byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyis dang po thob pa dang / sa gnyis pa yan chad sa bcu pa man chad kyi sa'i rang bzhin dang yon tan la mkhas pa dang /

analyzed: sa gong ma rnams ji ltar thob par bya ba'i thabs la mkhas pas na lhag ma dag la mkhas pa'i don dang ldan no //

original: sa dang po yang ji ltar 'dor bar 'gyur zhe nas dang po la sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa yongs su rdzogs pa dang de bzhin gshegs pa brgya'i zhal lta ba la sogs pa yon tan brgya phrag brgya byed pa yang yid la byed la /

original: de dag thams cad kyang sems tsam du zad @57a * //
analyzed: de dag thams cad kyang sems tsam du zad @57a * //
translated: However, one also thinks that all of these are merely mind.

original: de rnam par rtog pa las skyes so zhes rtog cing sems tsam du rtog pa de yang spangs te rnam bar mi rtog pa la gnas pas sa dang po bor nas sa gnyis pa la 'jug par 'gyur bar shes par bya'o //
analyzed: de rnam par rtog pa las skyes so zhes rtog cing sems tsam du rtog pa de yang spangs te rnam bar mi rtog pa la gnas pas sa dang po bor nas sa gnyis pa la 'jug par 'gyur bar shes par bya'o //
translated: One should understand that by abandoning that and by dwelling in nonconceptuality, one leaves behind the first level and enters the second level.

original: skye ba'i don rgya cher bstan pa'i phyir /

analyzed: sa bon gyi bye brag dang / ma'i bye brag dang / mngal gyi bye brag dang / ma ma'i bye brag go //

analyzed: de la theg pa chen po'i chos zab cing rgya che ba la mos shing dad pa las byang chub kyi sems bskyed pas na chos la mos pa ni sa bon no //

analyzed: ma mchog pha rol phyin mchog skyes // zhes bya ba la /

analyzed: pha rol tu phyin pa'i mchog ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ste /
translated: The supreme perfection is the perfection of wisdom.

original: chos thams cad stong par rtogs pa'i shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la don dam pa'i byang chub kyi sems skyes pas ma ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'o //

analyzed: de bas na 'phags pa dri ma med par grags pa'i mdo las kyang /
translated: Therefore, the Noble S≈´tra of the Pure Fame says,

analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyis ni //
translated: ‚ÄúThe bodhisattvas

original: thabs la mkhas pa pha yin te //üîΩma ni shes rab pha rol phyin //
analyzed: thabs la mkhas pa pha yin te // ma ni shes rab pha rol phyin //

analyzed: zhes gsungs so //

original: ting nge 'dzin gyi rgyal po'i mdo las kyang //
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin gyi rgyal po'i mdo las kyang //
translated: And the King of SamƒÅdhi S≈´tra says,

analyzed: mkha' mnyam rdul bral gzugs mchog 'chang //
translated: ‚ÄúHolding the supreme form, equal to space, free from dust,

analyzed: sku med mtshan bral shes rab sras //

analyzed: rab zab yon tan rgya mtsho'i thugs rje can //
translated: the compassionate one, the ocean of qualities, very profound,

analyzed: dpe med bdag gi spyi bor phyag zhog cig / ces gsungs so //
translated: place your hand on the top of my incomparable head!‚Äù

original: bsam gtan bde ba'i mngal du ste //üîΩzhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: bsam gtan bde ba'i mngal du ste // zhes bya ba ste /
translated: The womb of the bliss of meditative concentration

original: dper na mkhris pa dang bad kan la sogs pa'i nad med pa'i mngal de bde ba bzhin du rnam par rtog pa'i gnod pa thams cad spangs pa'i bsam gtan de yang byang chub sems kyi mngal bde ba yin te /
analyzed: dper na mkhris pa dang bad kan la sogs pa'i nad med pa'i mngal de bde ba bzhin du rnam par rtog pa'i gnod pa thams cad spangs pa'i bsam gtan de yang byang chub sems kyi mngal bde ba yin te /
translated: Just as a womb is comfortable when free from the illnesses of bile, phlegm, and so on, so too, meditative concentration, which is free from all the harms of conceptuality, is the comfortable womb of bodhicitta.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: sems rtse gcig pa'i mtshan nyid kyis bsam gtan yod pa dang yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du shes pa'i shes rab skyes pas bsam gtan ni mngal lta bur bshad do //

analyzed: snying rje skyed pa ma ma'o //

analyzed: byed pa srung bar byed pas na snying rje chen po ni ma ma'o //

translated: The bodhisattva who is on the bodhisattva ground The Joyful One accomplishes and formulates these great aspirations, great perseverance and great accomplishments.

original: 'di ltar sangs rgyas thams cad ma lus par lhag ma med pa mtha' dag la mchod cing rim gro'i phyir rnam pa'i mchog thams cad dang ldan pa mos pa rgya chen pos rnam par dag pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //

translated: Thus, in order to make offerings and render service to all the buddhas without exception, without remainder, he formulates the aspiration to make offerings to all the buddhas with the highest forms of offering, with vast interest and with complete purity.

original: spro ba'i don rgya cher bstan pa'i phyir //
analyzed: spro ba'i don rgya cher bstan pa'i phyir //
