original: dper na sa chen po la brten nas rtsa dang shing dang sman dang 'bru rnam pa sna tshogs skye ba de bzhin du dang por sems bskyed pa de la brten nas kyang bsam pa dang sbyor ba la sogs pa dang pha rol tu phyin pa dang /
analyzed: dper na sa chen po la brten nas rtsa dang shing dang sman dang 'bru rnam pa sna tshogs skye ba de bzhin du dang por sems bskyed pa de la brten nas kyang bsam pa dang sbyor ba la sogs pa dang pha rol tu phyin pa dang /
translated: Just as various kinds of grass, trees, medicinal herbs, and crops grow on the great earth, so too, on the basis of the first generation of the thought of awakening, the attitude, application, and so on, the perfections,üîΩthe factors of awakening, the powers, the fearlessnesses, the unique qualities of a buddha, and so on, arise.

original: byang chub kyi phyogs dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos kyi stobs dang / mi 'jigs pa dang / ma 'dres pa la sogs pa 'byung bas na dang po sems bskyed pa ni sa dang mtshungs par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: byang chub kyi phyogs dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos kyi stobs dang / mi 'jigs pa dang / ma 'dres pa la sogs pa 'byung bas na dang po sems bskyed pa ni sa dang mtshungs par rig par bya'o //
translated: The first generation of the thought of awakening should be understood as being like the earth.

original: gzhan yang gser gyi mchog dang 'dra //üîΩzhes bya ba la /
analyzed: gzhan yang gser gyi mchog dang 'dra // zhes bya ba la /
translated: Moreover, it is like the best of gold.

original: gzhan gyi sgras ni bsam pa la snyegs te bsam pa dang ldan pa'i byang chub kyi sems ni gser gyi mchog dang 'dra bar rig par bya ste /
analyzed: gzhan gyi sgras ni bsam pa la snyegs te bsam pa dang ldan pa'i byang chub kyi sems ni gser gyi mchog dang 'dra bar rig par bya ste /
translated: The word moreover refers to the attitude. The thought of awakening that is endowed with the attitude is like the best of gold.

original: ci'i phyir zhe @58b na ;
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe @58b na ;
translated: Why is that?

original: dper na gser gyi mchog bsregs pa dang / gcod pa dang ba dar ba la sogs pa rnam pa mang pos brtags na yang kha dog dang rang bzhin la 'gyur ba med pa de bzhin du /
analyzed: dper na gser gyi mchog bsregs pa dang / gcod pa dang ba dar ba la sogs pa rnam pa mang pos brtags na yang kha dog dang rang bzhin la 'gyur ba med pa de bzhin du /
translated: For example, even though gold is examined in many ways, such as by burning, cutting, and rubbing, its color and nature do not change.üîΩLikewise, the thought of awakening that is endowed with the intention to bring about the benefit and happiness of sentient beings never changes in any way.

original: sems can rnams la phan pa dang bde bar bya bar sems pa'i bsam pa dang ldan pa'i byang chub kyi sems la yang nam ji ltar yang 'gyur ba med pas na bsam pa dang ldan pa'i byang chub kyi sems ni gser mchog dang 'dra'o //
analyzed: sems can rnams la phan pa dang bde bar bya bar sems pa'i bsam pa dang ldan pa'i byang chub kyi sems la yang nam ji ltar yang 'gyur ba med pas na bsam pa dang ldan pa'i byang chub kyi sems ni gser mchog dang 'dra'o //
translated: Therefore, the thought of awakening that is endowed with the intention is like the finest gold.

original: yar gyi zla ba tshes pa bzhin //üîΩzhes bya ba la /
analyzed: yar gyi zla ba tshes pa bzhin // zhes bya ba la /
translated: Like the waxing moon.üîΩThe thought of awakening that is endowed with application is like the waxing moon. For example, from the first day of the lunar month until the full moon, the moon grows larger and larger.

original: sbyor ba dang ldan pa'i byang chub kyi sems ni yar gyi zla ba tshes pa dang 'dra ste dper na zla ba tshes gcig nas nya'i bar du yang zheng je che je cher skye ba de bzhin du pha rol tu phyin pa la sbyor zhing spyod pa'i sbyor
analyzed: sbyor ba dang ldan pa'i byang chub kyi sems ni yar gyi zla ba tshes pa dang 'dra ste dper na zla ba tshes gcig nas nya'i bar du yang zheng je che je cher skye ba de bzhin du pha rol tu phyin pa la sbyor zhing spyod pa'i sbyor
translated: Likewise, the application that is the practice of the perfections grows larger and larger.

original: ba'i shugs kyis phul na bsod nams dang ye shes kyi tshogs dang pha rol tu phyin pa 'phel zhing rgyas par 'gyur bas na sbyor ba dang ldan pa'i byang chub kyi sems ni zla ba tshes pa dang 'dra'o //
analyzed: ba'i shugs kyis phul na bsod nams dang ye shes kyi tshogs dang pha rol tu phyin pa 'phel zhing rgyas par 'gyur bas na sbyor ba dang ldan pa'i byang chub kyi sems ni zla ba tshes pa dang 'dra'o //
translated: Therefore, the thought of awakening endowed with application is like the waxing moon.

original: gzhan yang / me dang 'dra bar shes par bya //üîΩzhes bya ba la /
analyzed: gzhan yang / me dang 'dra bar shes par bya // zhes bya ba la /
translated: Moreover, it should be understood as being like fire.

original: gzhan gyi sgras ni lhag pa'i bsam pa la snyegs te lhag pa'i bsam pa dang ldan pa'i byang chub kyi sems ni me dang 'dra bar shes par bya ste /
analyzed: gzhan gyi sgras ni lhag pa'i bsam pa la snyegs te lhag pa'i bsam pa dang ldan pa'i byang chub kyi sems ni me dang 'dra bar shes par bya ste /
translated: The word ‚Äúother‚Äù refers to superior intention. The thought of awakening endowed with superior intention should be understood as being like fire.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?üîΩFor example, no matter how much fuel is added to a fire, the flames and light become greater and greater.

original: dper na mer shing ji tsam ji tsam du bsnan pa me lce dang 'od kyang de tsam de tsam du cher 'gyur ba de bzhin du lhag pa'i bsam pa zhes bya ba ni mos pas spyod pa'i sa drod la gnas na gong ma'i rtse mo thob par bya'o
analyzed: dper na mer shing ji tsam ji tsam du bsnan pa me lce dang 'od kyang de tsam de tsam du cher 'gyur ba de bzhin du lhag pa'i bsam pa zhes bya ba ni mos pas spyod pa'i sa drod la gnas na gong ma'i rtse mo thob par bya'o
translated: In the same way, when one who is abiding in the heat of the stage of devoted engagement has superior intention, one should attain the peak of the stage of devoted conduct.

original: snyam du sems nas sa bcu la gnas nas sangs rgyas kyis thob par bya'o snyam du sems pa la bya ste /
analyzed: snyam du sems nas sa bcu la gnas nas sangs rgyas kyis thob par bya'o snyam du sems pa la bya ste /
translated: The thought of the bodhisattva who is endowed with superior intention should be known as like fire,

original: sems des yon tan gong ma khyad par can rnams mngon sum du byed pas na lhag pa'i bsam pa dang ldan pa'i byang chub kyi sems ni me dang 'dra bar shes par bya'o //
analyzed: sems des yon tan gong ma khyad par can rnams mngon sum du byed pas na lhag pa'i bsam pa dang ldan pa'i byang chub kyi sems ni me dang 'dra bar shes par bya'o //
translated: because that thought manifests the special qualities of the higher stages.

original: gter bzhin du shes par bya ste zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: gter bzhin du shes par bya ste zhes bya ba la /
translated: It should be known as like a treasure.

original: sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa dang ldan pa'i sems ni gter chen po dang 'dra bar shes par bya ste /
analyzed: sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa dang ldan pa'i sems ni gter chen po dang 'dra bar shes par bya ste /
translated: The thought endowed with the perfection of generosity should be known as like a great treasure,üîΩbecause it is the source of the enjoyment of all beings.

original: gter chen po ni mdo las dung dang padmo dang / padmo chen po la sogs pa rnam pa bzhi yod do zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: gter chen po ni mdo las dung dang padmo dang / padmo chen po la sogs pa rnam pa bzhi yod do zhes gsungs so //
translated: The S≈´tra says that there are four kinds of great treasures: conch, lotus, great lotus, and so on.

original: gter de dag nas yo byad phyung ste bza' ba dang bgo ba la sogs pa sems can la byin na sems can rnams tshim par byed la /
analyzed: gter de dag nas yo byad phyung ste bza' ba dang bgo ba la sogs pa sems can la byin na sems can rnams tshim par byed la /
translated: When the necessities are extracted from those treasures and given to beings for food, clothing, and so on, those beings are satisfied.

original: yo byad ji snyed cig phyung na yang gter de zad par mi 'gyur bde bzhin du sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pas @59a * //üîΩchos dang zang zing la sogs pa'i longs spyod kyis byang chub sems dpa' rnams sems can mtha' med pa rnams tshim par byed la /
analyzed: yo byad ji snyed cig phyung na yang gter de zad par mi 'gyur bde bzhin du sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pas @59a * // chos dang zang zing la sogs pa'i longs spyod kyis byang chub sems dpa' rnams sems can mtha' med pa rnams tshim par byed la /
translated: Just as a treasure does not get used up no matter how much wealth is taken from it, in the same way, the transcendent perfection of generosity satisfies all sentient beings with enjoyments of Dharma and material things and yet the bodhisattvas' generosity is never exhausted, even in the expanse of nirvana without residual aggregates.

original: byang chub sems dpa'i sbyin pa de phung po lhag ma ma lus pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa'i dbyings su yang zad par mi 'gyur bas na sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa dang ldan pa'i sems bskyed pa ni gter chen po dang 'dra'o //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i sbyin pa de phung po lhag ma ma lus pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa'i dbyings su yang zad par mi 'gyur bas na sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa dang ldan pa'i sems bskyed pa ni gter chen po dang 'dra'o //
translated: The transcendent perfection of generosity is therefore like a great treasure.

original: gzhan ni rin chen 'byung gnas bzhin //üîΩzhes bya ba la /
analyzed: gzhan ni rin chen 'byung gnas bzhin // zhes bya ba la /
translated: The other is like a mine of jewels.

original: gzhan gyi sgras ni tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la snyegs te /
analyzed: gzhan gyi sgras ni tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la snyegs te /
translated: The other refers to the transcendent perfection of discipline.

original: tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang ldan pa'i byang chub kyi sems ni rin po che'i 'byung gnas dang 'dra ste /
analyzed: tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang ldan pa'i byang chub kyi sems ni rin po che'i 'byung gnas dang 'dra ste /
translated: The transcendent perfection of discipline is like a mine of jewels because it is the source of all the qualities of the higher realms and definite excellence.

original: dper na rin po che rnam pa sna tshogs 'byung ba'i 'byung khungs nas rin po che dpag tu med pa sna tshogs 'byung ba de bzhin du /
analyzed: dper na rin po che rnam pa sna tshogs 'byung ba'i 'byung khungs nas rin po che dpag tu med pa sna tshogs 'byung ba de bzhin du /
translated: Just as from a mine of various jewels, various jewels are produced in an immeasurable way,

original: byang chub sems dpa'i tshul khrims dang ldan pa'i sems bskyed pa la yang sa dang pha rol tu phyin pa dang byang chub kyi phyogs dang stobs dang mi 'jigs pa la sogs pa'i chos rin po che dpag tu med pa 'byung bas na tshul khrims dang ldan pa'i
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i tshul khrims dang ldan pa'i sems bskyed pa la yang sa dang pha rol tu phyin pa dang byang chub kyi phyogs dang stobs dang mi 'jigs pa la sogs pa'i chos rin po che dpag tu med pa 'byung bas na tshul khrims dang ldan pa'i
translated: so too from the bodhisattva's generation of the thought endowed with morality, various jewels of dharmas such as the perfections, the elements leading to enlightenment, the powers, the fearlessnesses, etc. are produced in an immeasurable way.

original: byang chub kyi sems ni rin po che'i 'byung gnas dang 'dra'o //
analyzed: byang chub kyi sems ni rin po che'i 'byung gnas dang 'dra'o //
translated: Thus, the thought of enlightenment endowed with morality is like a mine of jewels.

original: gzhan dag rgya mtsho 'dra ba ste //üîΩzhes bya ba la /
analyzed: gzhan dag rgya mtsho 'dra ba ste // zhes bya ba la /
translated: The others are like the ocean.

original: gzhan gyi sgras ni bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa la bya ste /
analyzed: gzhan gyi sgras ni bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa la bya ste /
translated: The word others refers to the perfection of patience.

original: bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa dang ldan pa'i byang chub kyi sems ni rgya mtsho dang 'dra bar shes par bya ste /
analyzed: bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa dang ldan pa'i byang chub kyi sems ni rgya mtsho dang 'dra bar shes par bya ste /
translated: The thought of enlightenment endowed with the perfection of patience should be understood as being like the ocean.

original: dper na rgya mtsho gru dang / nya dang / chu srin la sogs pas dkrugs na yang rnyog ma can du mi 'gyur ba de bzhin du byang chub sems dpa'i bzod pa dang ldan pa'i sems la yang grang ba dang tshab dang bkres pa dang skom pa gzhan gyis gnod par bya ba la sogs pas dkrugs kyang
analyzed: dper na rgya mtsho gru dang / nya dang / chu srin la sogs pas dkrugs na yang rnyog ma can du mi 'gyur ba de bzhin du byang chub sems dpa'i bzod pa dang ldan pa'i sems la yang grang ba dang tshab dang bkres pa dang skom pa gzhan gyis gnod par bya ba la sogs pas dkrugs kyang
translated: Likewise, even if the mind of a bodhisattva endowed with patience is churned by others who harm it with cold, heat, hunger, thirst and so on,üîΩthe turbidity of anger does not arise.

original: zhe sdang gi rnyog ma mi ldang bas na bzod pa dang ldan pa'i byang chub kyi sems ni rgya mtsho dang 'dra'o //
analyzed: zhe sdang gi rnyog ma mi ldang bas na bzod pa dang ldan pa'i byang chub kyi sems ni rgya mtsho dang 'dra'o //
translated: The mind of a bodhisattva endowed with patience is like the ocean.

original: rdo rje dang 'dra zhes bya ba la brtson 'grus dang ldan pa'i byang chub kyi sems ni rdo rje dang 'dra ste ji ltar zhe na /
analyzed: rdo rje dang 'dra zhes bya ba la brtson 'grus dang ldan pa'i byang chub kyi sems ni rdo rje dang 'dra ste ji ltar zhe na /
translated: It is like a vajra.

original: dper na rdo rje la cis kyang mi tshugs pa de bzhin du byang chub sems dpa'i brtson 'grus dang ldan pa'i sems la yang le lo'i mtshon gyis mi tshugs pas na brtson 'grus dang ldan pa'i byang chub kyi sems ni rdo rje dang 'dra ba'o //
analyzed: dper na rdo rje la cis kyang mi tshugs pa de bzhin du byang chub sems dpa'i brtson 'grus dang ldan pa'i sems la yang le lo'i mtshon gyis mi tshugs pas na brtson 'grus dang ldan pa'i byang chub kyi sems ni rdo rje dang 'dra ba'o //
translated: The thought of the bodhisattva who has perseverance is like a diamond.

original: ri rab dang 'dra zhes bya ba la bsam gtan dang ldan pa'i byang chub kyi sems ni ri rab dang 'dra bar @59b shes par bya ste /
analyzed: ri rab dang 'dra zhes bya ba la bsam gtan dang ldan pa'i byang chub kyi sems ni ri rab dang 'dra bar @59b shes par bya ste /
translated: The thought of the bodhisattva who has meditative concentration should be known as like Mount Meru.

original: ji ltar zhe na /üîΩri'i rgyal bo ri rab phyogs bzhi'i rlung gang gis kyang mi bskyod pa de bzhin du byang chub sems dpa'i ting nge 'dzin rtse gcig pa'i ting nge 'dzin dang ldan pa'i sems la g-yeng ba'i rnam par rtog pa'i rlung gis mi bskyod pas na bsam gtan dang ldan
analyzed: ji ltar zhe na / ri'i rgyal bo ri rab phyogs bzhi'i rlung gang gis kyang mi bskyod pa de bzhin du byang chub sems dpa'i ting nge 'dzin rtse gcig pa'i ting nge 'dzin dang ldan pa'i sems la g-yeng ba'i rnam par rtog pa'i rlung gis mi bskyod pas na bsam gtan dang ldan
translated: How so?üîΩJust as Mount Meru, the king of mountains, is not shaken by any of the winds in the four cosmic quarters, in the same way, the thought of the bodhisattva who has meditative concentration, who has one-pointed concentration, is not shaken by the winds of distraction, by discursive thought.

original: pa'i sems bskyed pa ni ri rab dang 'dra ba'o //
analyzed: pa'i sems bskyed pa ni ri rab dang 'dra ba'o //
translated: The thought of the bodhisattva who has meditative concentration is like Mount Meru.

original: rtsi yi rgyal po 'dra ba dang // zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: rtsi yi rgyal po 'dra ba dang // zhes bya ba la /
translated: Like the king of medicines.

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang ldan pa'i byang chub kyi sems ni rtsi'i rgyal po dang 'dra bar shes par bya ste /
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang ldan pa'i byang chub kyi sems ni rtsi'i rgyal po dang 'dra bar shes par bya ste /
translated: The thought of awakening endowed with the perfection of wisdom should be known as like the king of medicines.

original: ji ltar zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar zhe na /
translated: How so?

original: dper na rtsi'i rgyal po mthong ba dang / bsnams pa dang myangs pa dang reg pas kyang /
analyzed: dper na rtsi'i rgyal po mthong ba dang / bsnams pa dang myangs pa dang reg pas kyang /
translated: For example, the king of medicines, by being seen, smelled, tasted, or touched,

original: bad kan dang / mkhris pa dang / rlung las gyur pa'i nad thams cad zhi bar byed pa de bzhin du /
analyzed: bad kan dang / mkhris pa dang / rlung las gyur pa'i nad thams cad zhi bar byed pa de bzhin du /
translated: alleviates all illnesses arising from bile, phlegm, and wind.

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa yang mnyan pa dang bsam pa dang / bsgoms pa'i sgo nas nyon mongs pa dang / shes bya'i sgrib pa'i nad thams cad zhi bar byed pas na /
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa yang mnyan pa dang bsam pa dang / bsgoms pa'i sgo nas nyon mongs pa dang / shes bya'i sgrib pa'i nad thams cad zhi bar byed pas na /
translated: In the same way, the perfection of wisdom, by being heard, contemplated, and meditated upon, alleviates all illnesses of the afflictive obstructions and the obstructions to omniscience.

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang ldan pa'i sems ni sman gyi rgyal po dang 'dra'o //üîΩmdza' chen bzhin du gzhan rig bya //
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang ldan pa'i sems ni sman gyi rgyal po dang 'dra'o // mdza' chen bzhin du gzhan rig bya //
translated: Thus, the thought of awakening endowed with the perfection of wisdom is like the king of medicines.

original: zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la /
translated: Like a great friend, it should be known as benefiting others.

original: tshad med pa bzhi dang ldan pa'i byang chub kyi sems ni mdza' bo chen po dang 'dra bar rig par bya ste /
analyzed: tshad med pa bzhi dang ldan pa'i byang chub kyi sems ni mdza' bo chen po dang 'dra bar rig par bya ste /
translated: The thought of awakening endowed with the four immeasurables should be known as being like a great friend.

original: ji ltar zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar zhe na /
translated: How so?

original: dper na mdza' bo chen po dus gsum du yang grogs byed de /
analyzed: dper na mdza' bo chen po dus gsum du yang grogs byed de /
translated: For example, a great friend helps in three times:

original: bde ba'i tshe yang grogs byed la /
analyzed: bde ba'i tshe yang grogs byed la /
translated: he helps when one is happy,

original: sdug bsngal gyi tshe yang grogs byed de /
analyzed: sdug bsngal gyi tshe yang grogs byed de /
translated: he helps when one is suffering,üîΩand he helps when one is neither happy nor suffering.üîΩIn the same way, the thought of awakening endowed with the four immeasurables never abandons sentient beings at any time.

original: bde ba yang ma yin sdug bsngal yang ma yin pa'i tshe na yang grogs byed pa de bzhin du tshad med pa bzhi dang ldan pa'i byang chub kyi sems kyis kyang dus thams cad du sems can yal bar mi 'dor te bde ba'i dus na yang sems can
analyzed: bde ba yang ma yin sdug bsngal yang ma yin pa'i tshe na yang grogs byed pa de bzhin du tshad med pa bzhi dang ldan pa'i byang chub kyi sems kyis kyang dus thams cad du sems can yal bar mi 'dor te bde ba'i dus na yang sems can
translated: When they are happy, sentient beings are not abandoned.

original: mi 'dor / sdug bsngal gyi dus na yang sems can mi 'dor /
analyzed: mi 'dor / sdug bsngal gyi dus na yang sems can mi 'dor /
translated: When they are suffering, sentient beings are not abandoned.

original: bde ba dang sdug bsngal gnyi ga'i dus na yang sems can mi 'dor ro //
analyzed: bde ba dang sdug bsngal gnyi ga'i dus na yang sems can mi 'dor ro //
translated: When they are neither happy nor suffering, sentient beings are not abandoned.

original: ji ltar zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar zhe na /
translated: How so?

original: snying rjes ni sdug bsngal gyi dus na sems mi 'dor te /
analyzed: snying rjes ni sdug bsngal gyi dus na sems mi 'dor te /
translated: Through compassion, one does not abandon sentient beings when they are suffering.

original: sems can sdug bsngal las 'byin par byed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sems can sdug bsngal las 'byin par byed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it causes sentient beings to be freed from suffering.

original: byams pas ni bde ba'i dus na yang sems can mi 'dor te sems can bde ba la 'jog par byed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: byams pas ni bde ba'i dus na yang sems can mi 'dor te sems can bde ba la 'jog par byed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Loving kindness does not abandon sentient beings even when they are happy, because it causes sentient beings to be established in happiness.

original: dga' bas ni gang bde ba'i dus na sems can mi 'dor te /
analyzed: dga' bas ni gang bde ba'i dus na sems can mi 'dor te /
translated: Sympathetic joy does not abandon sentient beings when they are happy,

original: sems can rnams rtag tu bde ba dang ldan par dga' ba'i phyir ro //üîΩbtang snyoms kyis ni bde ba @60a * //
analyzed: sems can rnams rtag tu bde ba dang ldan par dga' ba'i phyir ro // btang snyoms kyis ni bde ba @60a * //
translated: because it delights in sentient beings always being happy.

original: dang sdug bsngal gnyi ga'i dus na sems can mi 'dor te /
analyzed: dang sdug bsngal gnyi ga'i dus na sems can mi 'dor te /
translated: Equanimity does not abandon sentient beings when they are both happy and suffering.

original: ji ltar zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar zhe na /
translated: How so?

original: sems can bde ba byung ba rnams 'dod chags dang ldan par ma gyur cig ces sems pa dang / sdug bsngal gyi dus na zhe sdang dang ldan par ma gyur cig ces sems pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sems can bde ba byung ba rnams 'dod chags dang ldan par ma gyur cig ces sems pa dang / sdug bsngal gyi dus na zhe sdang dang ldan par ma gyur cig ces sems pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is because it thinks, ‚ÄúMay those sentient beings who are happy not be endowed with attachment,‚Äù and it thinks, ‚ÄúMay those who are suffering not be endowed with aversion.‚Äù

original: yid bzhin nor bu 'dra ba dang // zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: yid bzhin nor bu 'dra ba dang // zhes bya ba la /
translated: It is like a wish-fulfilling gem.

original: mngon par shes pa lnga dang ldan pa'i byang chub kyi sems ni yid bzhin gyi nor bu dang 'dra bar shes par bya ste /
analyzed: mngon par shes pa lnga dang ldan pa'i byang chub kyi sems ni yid bzhin gyi nor bu dang 'dra bar shes par bya ste /
translated: The thought of awakening endowed with the five kinds of preternatural knowledge should be understood as being like a wish-fulfilling gem.

original: dper na yid bzhin gyi nor bu las bza' ba dang bgo ba la sogs pa'i yo byad ci bsam pa rnams 'byung ba de bzhin du 'grub pa dang 'dra bar rdzu 'phrul mngon par shes pa dang / rdzu 'phrul gyi mig dang / rdzu 'phrul gyi rna ba dang /
analyzed: dper na yid bzhin gyi nor bu las bza' ba dang bgo ba la sogs pa'i yo byad ci bsam pa rnams 'byung ba de bzhin du 'grub pa dang 'dra bar rdzu 'phrul mngon par shes pa dang / rdzu 'phrul gyi mig dang / rdzu 'phrul gyi rna ba dang /
translated: Just as all the necessities of life such as food and clothing come from a wish-fulfilling gem, in the same way, through the preternatural knowledge of performing miracles, the preternatural knowledge of the divine eye, the preternatural knowledge of the divine ear,

original: gzhan gyi sems shes pa dang / sngon gyi gnas rjes su dran pa dang / 'chi 'pho shes pas kyang lus rnam pa sna tshogs su sprul pa dang / sems can gyi gzugs mthong bar byas pa dang / sgra thos par bya ba dang / sems shes par bya ba dang /
analyzed: gzhan gyi sems shes pa dang / sngon gyi gnas rjes su dran pa dang / 'chi 'pho shes pas kyang lus rnam pa sna tshogs su sprul pa dang / sems can gyi gzugs mthong bar byas pa dang / sgra thos par bya ba dang / sems shes par bya ba dang /
translated: the knowledge of others' minds, the recollection of past lives and the knowledge of death and transmigration, bodhisattvas emanate various kinds of bodies, they make sentient beings see their forms, they make them hear sounds, they make them understand their minds, they make them remember past lives and they make them understand death and transmigration.

original: sngon gyi dus shes par bya ba dang / phyi ma'i dus shes par bya ba la sogs pa ci dang ci bsam pa de bzhin du 'grub pas mngon par shes pa lnga dang ldan pa'i byang chub kyi sems ni yid bzhin gyi nor bu dang 'dra'o //üîΩnyi ma 'dra bar gzhan rig bya//
analyzed: sngon gyi dus shes par bya ba dang / phyi ma'i dus shes par bya ba la sogs pa ci dang ci bsam pa de bzhin du 'grub pas mngon par shes pa lnga dang ldan pa'i byang chub kyi sems ni yid bzhin gyi nor bu dang 'dra'o // nyi ma 'dra bar gzhan rig bya//
translated: The Thought of Enlightenment endowed with the five superknowledges is like a wish-granting gem, since it accomplishes whatever is wished for, such as knowing the past and knowing the future.

original: zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la /
translated: One should know the other as like the sun.

original: gzhan gyi sgra bsdu ba'i dngos po bzhi dang sbyar te /
analyzed: gzhan gyi sgra bsdu ba'i dngos po bzhi dang sbyar te /
translated: This is to be applied to the four things that gather others.

original: bsdu ba'i dngos po bzhi dang ldan pa'i byang chub kyi sems ni nyi ma dang 'dra bar rig par bya ste /
analyzed: bsdu ba'i dngos po bzhi dang ldan pa'i byang chub kyi sems ni nyi ma dang 'dra bar rig par bya ste /
translated: The Thought of Enlightenment endowed with the four things that gather others should be known as like the sun.

original: dper na nyi mas lo tog rnam pa sna tshogs smin par byed pa de bzhin du /
analyzed: dper na nyi mas lo tog rnam pa sna tshogs smin par byed pa de bzhin du /
translated: For example, just as the sun ripens the various crops,

original: sbyin pa dang / ngag snyan pa dang / don spyod pa dang / don mthun pas kyang sems can rnams bsdus nas smin par byed de /
analyzed: sbyin pa dang / ngag snyan pa dang / don spyod pa dang / don mthun pas kyang sems can rnams bsdus nas smin par byed de /
translated: so also, by means of giving, speaking pleasantly, meaningful activity, and conformity, one gathers sentient beings and brings them to maturity.

original: ji ltar zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar zhe na /
translated: How is it so?

original: ser sna can rnams ni sbyin pas bsdus nas dge ba la bkod /
analyzed: ser sna can rnams ni sbyin pas bsdus nas dge ba la bkod /
translated: The stingy are gathered by giving and are established in virtue.

original: zhe sdang can rnams ni ngag snyan pas bsdus nas dge ba la bkod /üîΩgti mug can rnams ni don spyod pas bsdus nas dge ba la bkod /
analyzed: zhe sdang can rnams ni ngag snyan pas bsdus nas dge ba la bkod / gti mug can rnams ni don spyod pas bsdus nas dge ba la bkod /
translated: Those with hatred are gathered by sweet speech and then established in virtue.üîΩThose with delusion are gathered by meaningful activity and then established in virtue.

original: nga rgyal can rnams ni don mthun pas bsdus nas dge ba la bkod pas na bsdu ba'i dngos po dang 'dra ba'i byang chub kyi sems ni nyi ma dang 'dra ba'o //
analyzed: nga rgyal can rnams ni don mthun pas bsdus nas dge ba la bkod pas na bsdu ba'i dngos po dang 'dra ba'i byang chub kyi sems ni nyi ma dang 'dra ba'o //
translated: Those with pride are gathered by consistency of behavior and then established in virtue.üîΩLike the four means of gathering

original: dri za'i dbyangs dang 'dra ba dang // zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: dri za'i dbyangs dang 'dra ba dang // zhes bya ba la /
translated: Like the gandharva's songüîΩFor example, when beings hear the sweet, gentle, melodious song of the gandharvas, it gives rise to mental joy and happiness.

original: dper na dri za dbyangs snyan pa snyan cing 'jam pa sems can rnams kyis thos na sems dga' pa dang @60b bde ba skye ba de bzhin du chos so so yang dag par rig pa dang / don so so yang dag par rig pa dang /
analyzed: dper na dri za dbyangs snyan pa snyan cing 'jam pa sems can rnams kyis thos na sems dga' pa dang @60b bde ba skye ba de bzhin du chos so so yang dag par rig pa dang / don so so yang dag par rig pa dang /
translated: In the same way, the knowledge of phenomena, the knowledge of meaning,

original: nges pa'i tshig so so yang dag par rig pa dang / spobs pa so so yang dag par rig pa bzhis sems can rnams la chos dang don gang 'dod pa de dag so so'i skad kyis chos bshad nas dga' ba dang sim par 'gyur bas na so so yang dag par rig pa bzhi dang ldan pa'i sems ni dri
analyzed: nges pa'i tshig so so yang dag par rig pa dang / spobs pa so so yang dag par rig pa bzhis sems can rnams la chos dang don gang 'dod pa de dag so so'i skad kyis chos bshad nas dga' ba dang sim par 'gyur bas na so so yang dag par rig pa bzhi dang ldan pa'i sems ni dri
translated: The four kinds of perfect knowledge are the perfect knowledge of meaning, of phenomena, of expression and of confidence.üîΩ

original: za'i dbyangs dang 'dra'o //
analyzed: za'i dbyangs dang 'dra'o //
translated: The four kinds of analytical knowledges are the analytical knowledge of meaning, of the teachings, of languages, and of intrepid readiness. The bodhisattvas mind endowed with these four kinds of analytical knowledge is like a raincloud, because it delights and refreshes sentient beings by teaching the Dharma in each of their languages, whatever Dharma and meaning they desire.

original: rgyal po lta bur gzhan zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: rgyal po lta bur gzhan zhes bya ba la /
translated: Like a king, it is the support of others.

original: gzhan gyi sgras ni so sor brten pa bzhi la bya ste /
analyzed: gzhan gyi sgras ni so sor brten pa bzhi la bya ste /
translated: The word others refers to the four kinds of reliance.

original: so sor brten pa bzhi dang ldan pa'i byang chub kyi sems ni rgyal po lta bur shes par bya ste /
analyzed: so sor brten pa bzhi dang ldan pa'i byang chub kyi sems ni rgyal po lta bur shes par bya ste /
translated: The bodhisattvas mind endowed with the four kinds of reliance should be known as being like a king.

original: ji ltar zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar zhe na /
translated: How so?

original: rgyal po ni chud za ba'i rgyu yang byed /üîΩchud mi za ba'i rgyu yang byed de /
analyzed: rgyal po ni chud za ba'i rgyu yang byed / chud mi za ba'i rgyu yang byed de /
translated: A king is the cause of loss and the cause of nonloss.

original: gal te bsten legs na ni srid dang longs spyod la sogs pa sbyin par byed pas chud mi za ba'i rgyu byed do //
analyzed: gal te bsten legs na ni srid dang longs spyod la sogs pa sbyin par byed pas chud mi za ba'i rgyu byed do //
translated: If one relies on him well, he is the cause of nonloss, for he bestows wealth, property and so on.

original: bsten nyes na ni srid dang srog la babs pas chud za ba'i rgyu byed do //
analyzed: bsten nyes na ni srid dang srog la babs pas chud za ba'i rgyu byed do //
translated: If it is wrongly relied upon, it becomes the cause of loss, since it endangers both life and property.

original: de bzhin du gang zag dang / ye ge dang / drang ba'i don gyi mdo dang / rnam par shes pa la brten na ni chud za ba'i rgyur 'gyur /
analyzed: de bzhin du gang zag dang / ye ge dang / drang ba'i don gyi mdo dang / rnam par shes pa la brten na ni chud za ba'i rgyur 'gyur /
translated: Similarly, if one relies on the individual, the letter, the interpretable sutras, and consciousness, it becomes the cause of loss.

original: chos dang don dang nges pa'i don gyi mdo dang ye shes la brten na ni chud mi za ba'i rgyur 'gyur bas so //
analyzed: chos dang don dang nges pa'i don gyi mdo dang ye shes la brten na ni chud mi za ba'i rgyur 'gyur bas so //
translated: If one relies on the Dharma, the meaning, the definitive sutras, and intuition, it becomes the cause of no loss.

original: bang mdzod dang 'dra zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: bang mdzod dang 'dra zhes bya ba la /
translated: It is like a treasury.

original: bsod nams dang ye shes kyi tshogs dang 'dra ba'i byang chub kyi sems ni bang mdzod dang 'dra ste /
analyzed: bsod nams dang ye shes kyi tshogs dang 'dra ba'i byang chub kyi sems ni bang mdzod dang 'dra ste /
translated: The spirit of enlightenment, which is like a treasury of the collections of merit and intuition, is like a treasury.

original: ji ltar zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar zhe na /
translated: How so?

original: bang mdzod kyi nang na 'bru dang nor la sogs pa rnam pa mang po yod pa de bzhin du bsod nams kyi tshogs dang ldan pa'i byang chub kyi sems la yang bsod nams kyi tshogs dpag tu med pa yod pa dang / ye shes kyi tshogs dang ldan pa'i byang chub kyi sems la yang ye shes kyi tshogs dpag tu med pa yod pa'i phyir bang mdzod dang 'dra ba'o //
analyzed: bang mdzod kyi nang na 'bru dang nor la sogs pa rnam pa mang po yod pa de bzhin du bsod nams kyi tshogs dang ldan pa'i byang chub kyi sems la yang bsod nams kyi tshogs dpag tu med pa yod pa dang / ye shes kyi tshogs dang ldan pa'i byang chub kyi sems la yang ye shes kyi tshogs dpag tu med pa yod pa'i phyir bang mdzod dang 'dra ba'o //
translated: Just as the treasury contains many kinds of things, grain, gold, etc., in the same way, the thought of enlightenment endowed with the equipment of merit has immeasurable equipment of merit, and the thought of enlightenment endowed with the equipment of intuition has immeasurable equipment of intuition.

original: lam po che zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: lam po che zhes bya ba la /
translated: The great road.

original: byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos sum cu rtsa bdun dang ldan pa'i byang chub kyi sems ni lam chen po dang 'dra ste /
analyzed: byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos sum cu rtsa bdun dang ldan pa'i byang chub kyi sems ni lam chen po dang 'dra ste /
translated: The thought of enlightenment endowed with the thirty-seven aids to enlightenment is like a great road,

original: ji ltar zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar zhe na /
translated: because,

original: lam po cher dus gsum gyi sems can rnams kyang 'gro la rgyal po dang blon po dang 'bangs la sogs pa yang 'gro'o //
analyzed: lam po cher dus gsum gyi sems can rnams kyang 'gro la rgyal po dang blon po dang 'bangs la sogs pa yang 'gro'o //
translated: just as on a great road beings of the three times go, and also kings, ministers, and subjects, etc., go,

original: de bzhin du 'das pa'i de bzhin gshegs pa dang nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas rnams kyang lam 'di nas mya ngan las 'das par gshegs /
analyzed: de bzhin du 'das pa'i de bzhin gshegs pa dang nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas rnams kyang lam 'di nas mya ngan las 'das par gshegs /
translated: Likewise, the past Tathagatas, Sravakas, and Pratyekabuddhas have gone to Nirvana by this path;

original: da ltar gyi de bzhin gshegs pa dang @61a * //
analyzed: da ltar gyi de bzhin gshegs pa dang @61a * //
translated: the present Tathagatas,

original: nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas rnams kyang lam 'di nas mya ngan las 'das par gshegs /
analyzed: nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas rnams kyang lam 'di nas mya ngan las 'das par gshegs /
translated: Sravakas, and Pratyekabuddhas are going to Nirvana by this path;

original: ma 'ongs pa'i de bzhin gshegs pa dang nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas rnams kyang lam 'di nas mya ngan las 'das pa'i gnas su gshegs par 'gyur bas na lam po che dang 'dra ba'o //üîΩde dang 'dra bar de bzhin gzhan //
analyzed: ma 'ongs pa'i de bzhin gshegs pa dang nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas rnams kyang lam 'di nas mya ngan las 'das pa'i gnas su gshegs par 'gyur bas na lam po che dang 'dra ba'o // de dang 'dra bar de bzhin gzhan //
translated: and the future Tathagatas, Sravakas, and Pratyekabuddhas will go to the state of Nirvana by this path.

original: zhes bya ba la /üîΩgong du skyes pa dag dpe dang sbyar te bshad pa de dang 'dra bar de bzhin du 'og nas 'byung ba'i sems bskyed pa rnams kyang dpe dang sbyar te bshad do zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: zhes bya ba la / gong du skyes pa dag dpe dang sbyar te bshad pa de dang 'dra bar de bzhin du 'og nas 'byung ba'i sems bskyed pa rnams kyang dpe dang sbyar te bshad do zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: In the same way, the others are like that.

original: theg pa 'dra bar rnam rig bya //
analyzed: theg pa 'dra bar rnam rig bya //
translated: The meaning is that, just as the higher ones have been explained with examples, the following productions of the Thought will be explained with examples.

original: zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la /
translated: üîΩüîΩ

original: zhi gnas dang lhag mthong dang ldan pa'i byang chub kyi sems ni theg pa dang 'dra bar rig par bya ste /üîΩdper na rta dang glang po dang shing rta la sogs pa'i theg pas khur khal rnams khyer nas gang la 'gro bar bya ba'i gnas su phyin par 'gro ba de bzhin du zhi gnas dang lhag mthong zung du 'brel ba dang ldan pa'i sems kyis kyang bdag dang
analyzed: zhi gnas dang lhag mthong dang ldan pa'i byang chub kyi sems ni theg pa dang 'dra bar rig par bya ste / dper na rta dang glang po dang shing rta la sogs pa'i theg pas khur khal rnams khyer nas gang la 'gro bar bya ba'i gnas su phyin par 'gro ba de bzhin du zhi gnas dang lhag mthong zung du 'brel ba dang ldan pa'i sems kyis kyang bdag dang
translated: The thought of enlightenment endowed with calm and higher vision is to be known as like a vehicle.üîΩFor example, a vehicle such as a horse, elephant, or chariot, carries a load and goes to the place where one wants to go.

original: gzhan gyi don gyi khur bde bar khyer nas mya ngan las 'das pa'i gnas su 'gro bar byed pa'i phyir theg pa dang 'dra'o //üîΩbkod ma 'dra bar sems skyes nas //
analyzed: gzhan gyi don gyi khur bde bar khyer nas mya ngan las 'das pa'i gnas su 'gro bar byed pa'i phyir theg pa dang 'dra'o // bkod ma 'dra bar sems skyes nas //
translated: In the same way, the thought endowed with the union of calm and higher vision, carries the load of the benefit of self and other, and goes to the place of nirvana.

original: zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la /
translated: The thought of enlightenment is like a fountain.

original: bkod ma ni chu mig gi khyad par la bya ste /
analyzed: bkod ma ni chu mig gi khyad par la bya ste /
translated: A fountain is a special spring.

original: gzungs dang spobs pa dang ldan pa'i byang chub kyi sems ni chu mig khyad par can dang 'dra ste /
analyzed: gzungs dang spobs pa dang ldan pa'i byang chub kyi sems ni chu mig khyad par can dang 'dra ste /
translated: The thought of enlightenment endowed with retention and eloquence is like a special spring.

original: ji ltar zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar zhe na /
translated: How so?

original: dper na chu mig khyad par can gyis sngon 'byung ba'i chu dag kyang lteng ka nas 'dzin cing /üîΩsngon ma byung ba'i chu yang rgyun mi 'chad par 'byung bar byed pa de bzhin du gzungs kyis ni sngon thos pa'i chos dang don mi brjed par byed la /
analyzed: dper na chu mig khyad par can gyis sngon 'byung ba'i chu dag kyang lteng ka nas 'dzin cing / sngon ma byung ba'i chu yang rgyun mi 'chad par 'byung bar byed pa de bzhin du gzungs kyis ni sngon thos pa'i chos dang don mi brjed par byed la /
translated: For example, a special spring not only holds the water that previously existed in the pond, it also causes water that did not exist previously to arise uninterruptedly.üîΩSimilarly, the power of memory causes one not to forget the Dharma and its meaning that one has previously heard,üîΩand the power of eloquence causes one to realize the Dharma and its meaning that one has not previously heard.

original: spobs pas ni sngon ma thos pa'i chos dang don rtogs par byed cing bskal par bshad na yang spobs pa zad par mi 'gyur bas bkod ma dang 'dra'o //
analyzed: spobs pas ni sngon ma thos pa'i chos dang don rtogs par byed cing bskal par bshad na yang spobs pa zad par mi 'gyur bas bkod ma dang 'dra'o //
translated: Even if one explains for an eon, one's eloquence will not be exhausted, so it is like a fountain.

original: dga' ba'i sgra dang mtshungs pa dang // zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: dga' ba'i sgra dang mtshungs pa dang // zhes bya ba la /
translated: It is similar to the sound of joy.

original: chos kyi mdo bzhi dang ldan pa'i byang chub kyi sems ni dga' ba'i sgra dang 'dra ste /
analyzed: chos kyi mdo bzhi dang ldan pa'i byang chub kyi sems ni dga' ba'i sgra dang 'dra ste /
translated: The thought of awakening endowed with the four summaries of the Dharma is like the sound of joy.

original: ji ltar zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar zhe na /
translated: How is that?

original: sems can la la zhig nye du dang nor rdzas la sogs pa dang bral ba mi dga' zhing gnas pa las /
analyzed: sems can la la zhig nye du dang nor rdzas la sogs pa dang bral ba mi dga' zhing gnas pa las /
translated: Some sentient beings are unhappy and remain so due to being separated from relatives, wealth, and so on.

original: 'ga' zhig gis nye du dang nor rdzas la sogs pa dang phrad par 'gyur ro zhes gtam snyan pa smras nas sems dga' ba skye ba de bzhin du mya ngan las 'das pa dang thar pa thob par 'dod pa rnams kyis 'dus @61b byas thams cad mi rtag
analyzed: 'ga' zhig gis nye du dang nor rdzas la sogs pa dang phrad par 'gyur ro zhes gtam snyan pa smras nas sems dga' ba skye ba de bzhin du mya ngan las 'das pa dang thar pa thob par 'dod pa rnams kyis 'dus @61b byas thams cad mi rtag
translated: Some people, having heard pleasant news that they will meet with relatives, wealth, and so on, give rise to a joyful mind.üîΩLikewise, those who desire to attain nirvana and liberation, having heard the sound of the four summaries of the Dharma‚Äîall conditioned things are impermanent, all contaminated things are suffering, all phenomena are devoid of self, and nirvana is peace‚Äîare satisfied by the nectar of the Dharma and give rise to a joyful mind.

original: pa dang / zag pa dang bcas pa thams cad sdug bsngal ba dang / chos thams cad bdag med pa dang / zhi ba dang mya ngan las 'das pa'o zhes bya ba'i sgra thos nas bdud rtsis tshim par byas pa de bzhin du sems dga' ba skye bas na chos kyi mdo bzhi ni dga' ba'i sgra dang mtshungs so //
analyzed: pa dang / zag pa dang bcas pa thams cad sdug bsngal ba dang / chos thams cad bdag med pa dang / zhi ba dang mya ngan las 'das pa'o zhes bya ba'i sgra thos nas bdud rtsis tshim par byas pa de bzhin du sems dga' ba skye bas na chos kyi mdo bzhi ni dga' ba'i sgra dang mtshungs so //
translated: Thus the four summaries of the Dharma are similar to the sound of joy.

original: klung chen rgyun dang 'dra ba'o //üîΩzhes bya ba la /
analyzed: klung chen rgyun dang 'dra ba'o // zhes bya ba la /
translated: It is like the flow of a great river.

original: bgrod pa gcig pa'i lam dang ldan pa'i byang chub kyi sems ni chu bo'i rgyun dang 'dra ste /
analyzed: bgrod pa gcig pa'i lam dang ldan pa'i byang chub kyi sems ni chu bo'i rgyun dang 'dra ste /
translated: The bodhicitta endowed with the path of single progress is like the flow of a river.

original: ji ltar zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar zhe na /
translated: How so?

original: dper na chu bo yang 'bad rtsol med par rang bzhin gyis lhun gyis grub pa bzhin du sa brgyad pa'i dus na mi skye ba'i chos la bzod pa thob ste /
analyzed: dper na chu bo yang 'bad rtsol med par rang bzhin gyis lhun gyis grub pa bzhin du sa brgyad pa'i dus na mi skye ba'i chos la bzod pa thob ste /
translated: Just as a river flows effortlessly and spontaneously, so on the eighth level, one gains patient acceptance of the fact that phenomena are not produced.

original: rnam par mi rtog pa'i ye shes lhun gyis grub pas bdag nyid kyis sangs rgyas kyi chos yongs su smin par bya ba dang / sems can yongs su smin par bya ba la 'bad rtsol med par rang bzhin gyis lhun gyis grub par byed pas na chu bo'i klung dang 'dra'o //
analyzed: rnam par mi rtog pa'i ye shes lhun gyis grub pas bdag nyid kyis sangs rgyas kyi chos yongs su smin par bya ba dang / sems can yongs su smin par bya ba la 'bad rtsol med par rang bzhin gyis lhun gyis grub par byed pas na chu bo'i klung dang 'dra'o //
translated: And because one has spontaneously accomplished nonconceptual gnosis, one naturally and effortlessly brings to maturity the qualities of buddhahood and brings sentient beings to maturity.

original: rgyal sras rnams kyis sems bskyed pa //
analyzed: rgyal sras rnams kyis sems bskyed pa //
translated: The bodhisattvas' development of bodhicitta

original: sprin dang 'dra bar rab bstan te //
analyzed: sprin dang 'dra bar rab bstan te //
translated: is taught to be like a cloud.üîΩThe bodhisattvas' development of bodhicittaüîΩis taught to be like a cloud.üîΩThe bodhisattvas' development of bodhicitta,

original: zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la /
translated: which is endowed with the means,üîΩis taught to be like a cloud.

original: thabs dang ldan pa'i sras rnams kyi byang chub kyi sems ni sprin dang 'dra bar bstan te /
analyzed: thabs dang ldan pa'i sras rnams kyi byang chub kyi sems ni sprin dang 'dra bar bstan te /
translated: The bodhisattvas' development of bodhicitta, which is endowed with the means, is taught to be like a cloud.

analyzed: gong du bshad pa ltar dpe rnam pa nyi shu rtsa gnyis kyi tshul gyis na byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi byang chub kyi sems de yon tan gyis phyug pa yin te de bas na dad pa dang dga' ba'i sems kyis byang chub kyi sems de bskyed par

analyzed: dper na chu klung 'bad rtsol med par rang gi ngang gis 'bab pa de bzhin du bgrod pa gcig pa'i dus na yang rnam par mi rtog pa lhun gyis grub pas bdag dang gzhan gyi don la 'bad rtsol med par byed do zhes bya ba'i don to //

analyzed: sa brgyad pa thob pa'i tshe chos thams cad ma skyes pa'o zhes mi skye ba'i chos la bzod pa thob ste /

analyzed: de'i tshe rnam par mi rtog pa'i ye shes lhun gyis grub pa rnyed pas bgrod pa gcig pa zhes bya'o //

analyzed: zhi ba mya ngan las 'das pa 'ba' zhig tu 'gro bar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i don to // de la pha rol gyi don ni pha rol la phan par bya ba ste /

analyzed: sems bskyed pa dang bsngags bas ngan 'gro dang yongs su skyo bas mi 'jigs pa'i phyir tshigs su bcad pa zhes bya ba la /

translated: Immediately upon the birth of the spirit of enlightenment, the wise

analyzed: sa dang por don dam pa'i byang chub kyi sems de skyes nas /

translated: as soon as one sees the expanse of reality as having the nature of extending everywhere, one restrains the minds of infinite sentient beings throughout the whole of space from committing negative actions such as killing and stealing through one‚Äôs body, speech and mind.
