translated: Wherever the ultimate thought of awakening has just arisen, the mind is restrained from the performance of limitless evil deeds. This is taught in brief. The meaning of that restraint is taught in detail in one verse.

original: nam zhig lus dang srog la mi lta zhing //üîΩzhes bya ba la /
analyzed: nam zhig lus dang srog la mi lta zhing // zhes bya ba la /
translated: When will I, not caring for my body or life,

original: byang chub sems dpa' rnams ni bdag pas ches sems can pha rol po gces shing phongs par 'dzin te /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' rnams ni bdag pas ches sems can pha rol po gces shing phongs par 'dzin te /
translated: The bodhisattvas hold as dear and valuable other sentient beings, who are not themselves, more than themselves.

original: @63b sems can gyi don zhib tu gyur nas lus la yang mi lta ste lus gtong ba dang srog la yang mi lta ste srog kyang 'dor ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: @63b sems can gyi don zhib tu gyur nas lus la yang mi lta ste lus gtong ba dang srog la yang mi lta ste srog kyang 'dor ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: Having become skilled in the aims of sentient beings, he does not even care about his body, and so he gives up his body, and he does not even care about his life, and so he gives up his life.

original: gzhan gyi don phyir rab tu ngal med na //
analyzed: gzhan gyi don phyir rab tu ngal med na //
translated: For the sake of others, he is not at all weary

original: zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la /
translated: üîΩüîΩ

original: gzhan yang sems can mi dge ba las bzlog cing dge ba la gnas pa dang / bla na med pa'i byang chub thob par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: gzhan yang sems can mi dge ba las bzlog cing dge ba la gnas pa dang / bla na med pa'i byang chub thob par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: Moreover, in order to turn sentient beings away from non-virtue and to establish them in virtue, and in order to cause them to attain unsurpassed enlightenment,

original: bskal pa grangs med par mgo dang rkang lag la sogs pa gtong ba'i dus su sdug bsngal gyis kyang skyo ba med do zhes bya ba'i don to //üîΩde lta bu dag gzhan gyis gnod byas pas //
analyzed: bskal pa grangs med par mgo dang rkang lag la sogs pa gtong ba'i dus su sdug bsngal gyis kyang skyo ba med do zhes bya ba'i don to // de lta bu dag gzhan gyis gnod byas pas //
translated: he is not discouraged by suffering even when he gives up his head, arms, legs, and so forth for countless eons.üîΩHow could one like him engage in faulty actions

original: nyes pa byas pa'i las la ga la 'jug //üîΩces bya ba la ;
analyzed: nyes pa byas pa'i las la ga la 'jug //üîΩces bya ba la ;
translated: because of being harmed by others?

original: de ltar gzhan gyi don du lus dang srog la yang mi lta zhing sdug bsngal rnam pa sna tshogs nyams su len pa de sems can gzhan gyis byang chub sems dpa' de la srog gcod pa la sogs pa'i nyes pa byas pas de'i lan du srog gcod pa
analyzed: de ltar gzhan gyi don du lus dang srog la yang mi lta zhing sdug bsngal rnam pa sna tshogs nyams su len pa de sems can gzhan gyis byang chub sems dpa' de la srog gcod pa la sogs pa'i nyes pa byas pas de'i lan du srog gcod pa
translated: Thus, for the sake of others, he does not even care about his body and life, and he practices various kinds of suffering.üîΩWhat is the point of his being harmed in return by other sentient beings, by their committing the sin of killing him, etc.,

original: la sogs pa'i nyes pa byed pa dang / bdag gi don dang sems can gzhan la srog gcod pa la sogs pa'i nyes pa byed pa la gang zhig 'jug ste /
analyzed: la sogs pa'i nyes pa byed pa dang / bdag gi don dang sems can gzhan la srog gcod pa la sogs pa'i nyes pa byed pa la gang zhig 'jug ste /
translated: or of his engaging in the sin of killing, etc., for the sake of other sentient beings?

original: cung zad kyang mi 'jug go zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: cung zad kyang mi 'jug go zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: There is no point at all.

original: sems mi ldog par tshigs su bcad pa gnyis so zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: sems mi ldog par tshigs su bcad pa gnyis so zhes bya ba la /
translated: Two verses on the irreversibility of the bodhisattva.

original: gal te byang chub sems dpa' de lus dang srog la yang mi lta bar sems can gyi don byed du zin kyang skabs su byang chub kyi sems las bzlog go snyam du sems pa la /
analyzed: gal te byang chub sems dpa' de lus dang srog la yang mi lta bar sems can gyi don byed du zin kyang skabs su byang chub kyi sems las bzlog go snyam du sems pa la /
translated: If the bodhisattva, in working for the welfare of sentient beings, does not even care about his body and life, it might be thought that he could be turned away from the thought of enlightenment.

original: byang chub sems dpa' rnams ni ye shes kyi tshogs dang / bsod nams kyi tshogs kyis brtan pas byang chub kyi sems las bzlog mi srid do zhes bstan pa'i phyir tshigs su bcad pa gnyis smos so //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' rnams ni ye shes kyi tshogs dang / bsod nams kyi tshogs kyis brtan pas byang chub kyi sems las bzlog mi srid do zhes bstan pa'i phyir tshigs su bcad pa gnyis smos so //
translated: Two verses to show that the bodhisattvas cannot be turned away from the Thought of Enlightenment, because they are stabilized by the accumulation of merit and the accumulation of knowledge.

original: des ni chos kun sgyu ma lta bur brtags //üîΩzhes bya ba la /
analyzed: des ni chos kun sgyu ma lta bur brtags // zhes bya ba la /
translated: He examines all things as like an illusion.

original: byang chub sems dpa'i ye shes kyi tshogs kyis phyi dang nang gi chos thams cad sgyu ma dang smig rgyu dang / rmi lam lta bur rang bzhin gyis stong par mthong ngo zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i ye shes kyi tshogs kyis phyi dang nang gi chos thams cad sgyu ma dang smig rgyu dang / rmi lam lta bur rang bzhin gyis stong par mthong ngo zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that the bodhisattva, by the accumulation of knowledge, sees all internal and external things as empty of intrinsic nature, like an illusion, a mirage, a dream.

original: skye ba skyed mos tshal du 'gro ba bzhin ;üîΩ/ zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: skye ba skyed mos tshal du 'gro ba bzhin ; / zhes bya ba la /
translated: His birth is like going to a pleasure garden.

original: dper na skyed mos tshal ngan pa nas bzang por 'gro bas na /
analyzed: dper na skyed mos tshal ngan pa nas bzang por 'gro bas na /
translated: For example, when one goes from a bad pleasure garden to a good one,

original: mngon par lhag par dga' ba skye ba de bzhin du /
analyzed: mngon par lhag par dga' ba skye ba de bzhin du /
translated: one experiences a great joy.

original: byang chub sems dpa' rnams bsod nams kyi tshogs dang ldan pas mi la sogs pa'i gnas nas shi 'phos te mi'i longs spyod btang nas lha la @64a * //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' rnams bsod nams kyi tshogs dang ldan pas mi la sogs pa'i gnas nas shi 'phos te mi'i longs spyod btang nas lha la @64a * //
translated: Bodhisattvas, who possess the accumulation of merit, die in the abodes of humans and so on and, having given up human resources, are reborn in the desire realm as gods.üîΩ

original: sogs pa'i gnas len pas na skyed mos tshal ngan pa bor nas bzang po len pa bzhin du dga' ba'i mchog skye'o zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: sogs pa'i gnas len pas na skyed mos tshal ngan pa bor nas bzang po len pa bzhin du dga' ba'i mchog skye'o zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: Since bodhisattvas possess the aggregate of merit, they die in the abodes of humans and so on, and having given up the enjoyments of humans, they take up the abodes of gods and so on. Therefore, they are like those who give up a bad garden and take up a good one. The meaning of the verse is that they generate the highest joy.

original: 'byor pa'i dus dang zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: 'byor pa'i dus dang zhes bya ba la /
translated: At the time of prosperity and at the time of decline, they are not afraid.

original: byang chub sems dpa' lha'i gnas su skyes na brgya byin dang tshangs pa la sogs pa lha'i bdag por 'gyur ba dang / mi'i nang du skyes na 'khor los sgyur ba'i rgyal po la sogs pa mi'i bdag por 'gyur ba ni 'byor pa'i dus zhes bya'o //üîΩrgud pa'i dus na yang zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' lha'i gnas su skyes na brgya byin dang tshangs pa la sogs pa lha'i bdag por 'gyur ba dang / mi'i nang du skyes na 'khor los sgyur ba'i rgyal po la sogs pa mi'i bdag por 'gyur ba ni 'byor pa'i dus zhes bya'o // rgud pa'i dus na yang zhes bya ba la /
translated: At the time of prosperity refers to when bodhisattvas are born in the abodes of gods, they become the lords of gods such as Indra and Brahma, and when they are born among humans, they become the lords of humans such as universal monarchs.

original: longs spyod btang nas 'chi ba'i dus la bab pa ni rgud pa'i dus zhes bya'o //
analyzed: longs spyod btang nas 'chi ba'i dus la bab pa ni rgud pa'i dus zhes bya'o //
translated: At the time of decline refers to when they give up their enjoyments and die.

original: nyon mongs sdug bsngal dag gis mi 'jigs so //
analyzed: nyon mongs sdug bsngal dag gis mi 'jigs so //
translated: They are not afraid of afflictions and suffering.

original: zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la /
translated: As such,

original: byang chub kyi sems ldog pa ni yang na 'dod chags la sogs pa'i nyon mongs pas bcings par dogs pas byang chub kyi sems bor nas mya ngan las 'da' ba'am /
analyzed: byang chub kyi sems ldog pa ni yang na 'dod chags la sogs pa'i nyon mongs pas bcings par dogs pas byang chub kyi sems bor nas mya ngan las 'da' ba'am /
translated: if one were to ask whether the thought of awakening is reversed, then either one would abandon the thought of awakening and attain nirvana out of fear of being bound by afflictions such as attachment,

original: yang na skye ba dang rgas pa la sogs pa'i sdug bsngal gyis 'jigs nas byang chub kyi sems 'dor grang na /
analyzed: yang na skye ba dang rgas pa la sogs pa'i sdug bsngal gyis 'jigs nas byang chub kyi sems 'dor grang na /
translated: or else one would abandon the thought of awakening out of fear of the suffering of birth, aging, and so on.üîΩHowever, due to the wisdom of the bodhisattva, there is no fear of the suffering of birth and aging and so on.

original: byang chub sems dpa'i ye shes kyi mthong bas skye ba dang rga ba'i sdug bsngal gyi 'jigs pa med la sogs pa'i 'byor pa'i dus na yang 'dod chags la sogs pa'i nyon mongs pas mi gos pa'i phyir /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i ye shes kyi mthong bas skye ba dang rga ba'i sdug bsngal gyi 'jigs pa med la sogs pa'i 'byor pa'i dus na yang 'dod chags la sogs pa'i nyon mongs pas mi gos pa'i phyir /
translated: Even when one is endowed with the time of afflictions, one is not sullied by afflictions such as attachment.

original: nyon mongs pas mi 'jigs la /
analyzed: nyon mongs pas mi 'jigs la /
translated: Therefore one has no fear of afflictions.

original: byang chub sems dpa'i bsod nams kyi tshogs kyis tshe gcig tu 'chi zhing skye ba len pas na skyed mos tshal gcig nas gcig tu 'pho ba 'dra bar mthong bas skye ba dang rga ba'i sdug bsngal gyi 'jigs pa med pas byang chub kyi sems ga la ldog
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i bsod nams kyi tshogs kyis tshe gcig tu 'chi zhing skye ba len pas na skyed mos tshal gcig nas gcig tu 'pho ba 'dra bar mthong bas skye ba dang rga ba'i sdug bsngal gyi 'jigs pa med pas byang chub kyi sems ga la ldog
translated: Since the bodhisattva's accumulation of merit takes birth and dies in a single lifetime, it is seen to be like moving from one pleasure grove to another. Therefore, since there is no fear of the suffering of birth and aging, how could the thought of awakening turn back?

original: ste mi ldog go zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: ste mi ldog go zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: It does not turn back, is the meaning.

original: skye bas na skyed mos tshal dang 'dra'o zhes bstan pa'i don rgyas par bshad pa'i phyir /
analyzed: skye bas na skyed mos tshal dang 'dra'o zhes bstan pa'i don rgyas par bshad pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to explain in detail the meaning of the statement that birth is like a pleasure grove, it is said:

original: rang gi yon tan sems can phan par dga' //
analyzed: rang gi yon tan sems can phan par dga' //
translated: One's own qualities, delighting in benefiting sentient beings,

original: bsam bzhin skye dang rdzu 'phrul rnam par 'phrul //
analyzed: bsam bzhin skye dang rdzu 'phrul rnam par 'phrul //
translated: Intentional birth, miraculous emanations,

original: rgyan dang zas dang sa mchog rnam bzhi ste //
analyzed: rgyan dang zas dang sa mchog rnam bzhi ste //
translated: The four supreme ornaments, food, and places,

original: rtsed mo dga' ba'i snying rje med la med //üîΩces smos te /
analyzed: rtsed mo dga' ba'i snying rje med la med // ces smos te /
translated: Are not for those without compassion who delight in play.

original: sems can dag skyed mos tshal du 'gro bas na rnam pa bzhi byed de /
analyzed: sems can dag skyed mos tshal du 'gro bas na rnam pa bzhi byed de /
translated: Sentient beings go to pleasure groves, so they perform the four activities.

original: lus bkrus nas rgyan la sogs pas brgyan par byed pa dang / sa gzhi bde ba dag tu gnas par byed pa dang / glu gar la sogs pa rtsed mo rnam pa sna tshogs byed pa ste /
analyzed: lus bkrus nas rgyan la sogs pas brgyan par byed pa dang / sa gzhi bde ba dag tu gnas par byed pa dang / glu gar la sogs pa rtsed mo rnam pa sna tshogs byed pa ste /
translated: He bathes his body and adorns it with ornaments, etc. He stays in pleasant places on the ground. He plays various games, singing, dancing, etc.

original: de lta bu skyed mos tshal du ni sems 'jug cing ldog pa med do //
analyzed: de lta bu skyed mos tshal du ni sems 'jug cing ldog pa med do //
translated: Thus, his mind enters the garden and does not turn back.

original: de bzhin @64b du byang chub sems dpa' tshe gcig nas gcig gis skyed mos tshal du rgyu bas na sbyin pa dang tshul khrims dang ting nge 'dzin dang gzungs dang shes rab kyi rgyan la sogs pa rang gi yon tan gyi rgyan yin no //
analyzed: de bzhin @64b du byang chub sems dpa' tshe gcig nas gcig gis skyed mos tshal du rgyu bas na sbyin pa dang tshul khrims dang ting nge 'dzin dang gzungs dang shes rab kyi rgyan la sogs pa rang gi yon tan gyi rgyan yin no //
translated: In the same way, the bodhisattva, going from life to life, as if in a garden, adorns himself with the ornaments of his own virtues, generosity, morality, concentration, retention, and wisdom.

original: sems can thams cad la phan pa dang bde bar byas pa dga' ba'i sems ni kha zas bzang po lta bu'o //
analyzed: sems can thams cad la phan pa dang bde bar byas pa dga' ba'i sems ni kha zas bzang po lta bu'o //
translated: The mind of joy in benefiting and comforting all beings is like good food.

original: sems can gyi don du lha dang mi la sogs pa'i gnas de dang de dag tu skye bar bya'o zhes bsam bzhin du skye ba ni skyed mos tshal gyi mchog dang 'dra'o //
analyzed: sems can gyi don du lha dang mi la sogs pa'i gnas de dang de dag tu skye bar bya'o zhes bsam bzhin du skye ba ni skyed mos tshal gyi mchog dang 'dra'o //
translated: The intentional birth in this or that place, among gods, humans, etc., for the sake of beings, is like the best of gardens.

original: sems can gyi don du mngon par shes pa lngas rdzu 'phrul rnam pa sna tshogs mdzad pa ni byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi rtsed mo ste yon tan de bzhi dang ldan na byang chub sems las ga la ldog ste mi ldog go zhes bya ba'i don to
analyzed: sems can gyi don du mngon par shes pa lngas rdzu 'phrul rnam pa sna tshogs mdzad pa ni byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi rtsed mo ste yon tan de bzhi dang ldan na byang chub sems las ga la ldog ste mi ldog go zhes bya ba'i don to
translated: If one has these four qualities, how could one turn away from the thought of awakening? One would not turn away.

original: // yon tan de bzhi yang bdag dang gzhan gyi don spangs pa snying rje med pa'i nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas la mi srid de de med do zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: // yon tan de bzhi yang bdag dang gzhan gyi don spangs pa snying rje med pa'i nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas la mi srid de de med do zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: These four qualities are impossible for the disciples and hermit buddhas, who lack compassion for others' welfare and lack it.

original: sdug bsngal gyi 'jigs pa bzlog par tshigs su bcad pa zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: sdug bsngal gyi 'jigs pa bzlog par tshigs su bcad pa zhes bya ba la /
translated: A verse on the avoidance of fear of suffering

original: de ltar byang chub sems dpa' nyon mongs pas 'jigs pa yang med 'chi ba'i sdug bsngal gyi 'jigs pa med du zin kyang 'khor ba na sems can gyi don du mgo dang rkang lag la sogs pa gtong ba'i sdug bsngal gyis 'jigs par 'gyur ro snyam pa la
analyzed: de ltar byang chub sems dpa' nyon mongs pas 'jigs pa yang med 'chi ba'i sdug bsngal gyi 'jigs pa med du zin kyang 'khor ba na sems can gyi don du mgo dang rkang lag la sogs pa gtong ba'i sdug bsngal gyis 'jigs par 'gyur ro snyam pa la
translated: Even though the bodhisattvas have no fear of the afflictions and no fear of the suffering of death, they do fear the suffering of giving away their heads and limbs for the sake of sentient beings in cyclic existence.

original: ; sdug bsngal de yang med par bstan pa'i phyir tshigs su bcad pa rtsom mo zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: ; sdug bsngal de yang med par bstan pa'i phyir tshigs su bcad pa rtsom mo zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: In order to show that that suffering does not exist, he composes the treatise.

original: gzhan phyir brtson ldan snying rje can dag ni //
analyzed: gzhan phyir brtson ldan snying rje can dag ni //
translated: Those who are compassionate and strive for the sake of others

original: de dag mnar med pa yang dga' 'dzin na //üîΩgzhan la brten pa'i sdug bsngal 'byung ba yis //
analyzed: de dag mnar med pa yang dga' 'dzin na // gzhan la brten pa'i sdug bsngal 'byung ba yis //
translated: take delight even in Avici hell.üîΩHow could they fear suffering in existence,

original: srid pa dag na de 'dra ga la skrag//üîΩces bya ba la /
analyzed: srid pa dag na de 'dra ga la skrag// ces bya ba la /
translated: which arises for the sake of others?

original: gzhan gyi phyir zhes bya ba ni sems can gzhan tshe 'dir mi dge ba las bzlog cing dge ba la bzhag pa dang / tshe rabs gzhan du mya ngan las 'das pa dang / thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes la bzhag pa ni gzhan gyi phyir zhes bya'o //
analyzed: gzhan gyi phyir zhes bya ba ni sems can gzhan tshe 'dir mi dge ba las bzlog cing dge ba la bzhag pa dang / tshe rabs gzhan du mya ngan las 'das pa dang / thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes la bzhag pa ni gzhan gyi phyir zhes bya'o //
translated: For the sake of others refers to the fact that one turns others away from evil in this life and establishes them in virtue, and in other lives in nirvana and in the knowledge of a tathƒÅgata.

original: de'i ched du pha rol tu phyin pa drug la spyod pa ni brtson pa dang ldan pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de'i ched du pha rol tu phyin pa drug la spyod pa ni brtson pa dang ldan pa zhes bya'o //
translated: One who practices the six perfections for their sake is called a ‚Äústriving bodhisattva.‚Äù

original: sems can gzhan sdug bsngal bas bdag kyang sdug bsngal bar 'gyur bas na snying rje can zhes bya ste /
analyzed: sems can gzhan sdug bsngal bas bdag kyang sdug bsngal bar 'gyur bas na snying rje can zhes bya ste /
translated: They are called compassionate because they suffer when other sentient beings suffer.

original: byang chub sems dpa' de dag ni sems can gyi don du 'gyur na mnar med pa'i sems can dmyal ba na gnas na yang dga' zhing bde ba ste /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' de dag ni sems can gyi don du 'gyur na mnar med pa'i sems can dmyal ba na gnas na yang dga' zhing bde ba ste /
translated: Those bodhisattvas are happy and joyful even when they are in the Avici hell for the sake of sentient beings.

original: @65a * // skyo ba med na sems can gyi don du 'khor ba na mgo dang rkang lag la sogs pa btang ba tsam gyi sdug bsngal gyis ga la skrag ste mi skrag go zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: @65a * // skyo ba med na sems can gyi don du 'khor ba na mgo dang rkang lag la sogs pa btang ba tsam gyi sdug bsngal gyis ga la skrag ste mi skrag go zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: If they are not discouraged, how could they be afraid of the suffering of giving up their heads, legs, arms, and so on for the sake of sentient beings? They are not afraid.

original: sems can yal bar 'dor du mi rung bar tshigs su bcad pa zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: sems can yal bar 'dor du mi rung bar tshigs su bcad pa zhes bya ba la /
translated: A verse on the inappropriateness of abandoning sentient beings.

original: de ltar byang chub kyi sems las kyang mi ldog pa sdug bsngal gyis mi skrag tu zin kyang byang chub kyi sems dang ldan pa dag sems can gyi don mi byed de yal bar 'dor ro snyam pa la /
analyzed: de ltar byang chub kyi sems las kyang mi ldog pa sdug bsngal gyis mi skrag tu zin kyang byang chub kyi sems dang ldan pa dag sems can gyi don mi byed de yal bar 'dor ro snyam pa la /
translated: Even though they do not turn back from the Thought of Awakening and are not afraid of suffering, those who have the Thought of Awakening do not work for the welfare of sentient beings, but abandon them.

original: byang chub kyi sems dang ldan pa rnams kyis sems can gyi don 'dor du mi rung bar bstan pa'i phyir tshigs su bcad pa rtsom mo zhes bya ba'i don to ;
analyzed: byang chub kyi sems dang ldan pa rnams kyis sems can gyi don 'dor du mi rung bar bstan pa'i phyir tshigs su bcad pa rtsom mo zhes bya ba'i don to ;
translated: The verse is composed in order to show that it is not proper for those who have the Thought of Enlightenment to abandon the aims of sentient beings.

original: / slob dpon thugs rje chen pos rtag tu rten //üîΩzhes bya ba la /
analyzed: / slob dpon thugs rje chen pos rtag tu rten // zhes bya ba la /
translated: The master who always relies on the great compassion

original: 'jig rten na bdag gi don bya ba rnams la gzhan gyis ma bskul bar ma byas na yang ngo tsha zhing khrel ba yin na gzhan gyis bdag gi don byas la gzhan gyis bskul te ma byas na ha cang khrel zhes pa'o //
analyzed: 'jig rten na bdag gi don bya ba rnams la gzhan gyis ma bskul bar ma byas na yang ngo tsha zhing khrel ba yin na gzhan gyis bdag gi don byas la gzhan gyis bskul te ma byas na ha cang khrel zhes pa'o //
translated: In the world, when one does not do what is to be done for oneself without being urged by another, one is ashamed and embarrassed. But when one does what is to be done for another, and does not do it when urged by another, one is very much embarrassed.

original: de lta bu yin pa las slob dpon dang mkhan po mdzangs pa la brten pa rnams ni gdon mi za bar gzhan gyis bskul mi dgos par bdag don byed par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de lta bu yin pa las slob dpon dang mkhan po mdzangs pa la brten pa rnams ni gdon mi za bar gzhan gyis bskul mi dgos par bdag don byed par 'gyur ro //
translated: But those who rely on the wise, the masters and preceptors, will certainly do what is to be done for themselves without being urged by another.

original: de dang 'dra bar byang chub sems dpa' rnams ni sems can sdug bsngal ba rnams la rtag tu don gyis shig ces bskul ba'i snying rje chen po'i slob dpon gyis rgyun du bsten te /
analyzed: de dang 'dra bar byang chub sems dpa' rnams ni sems can sdug bsngal ba rnams la rtag tu don gyis shig ces bskul ba'i snying rje chen po'i slob dpon gyis rgyun du bsten te /
translated: In the same way, the Bodhisattvas are constantly urged by the teacher, great compassion, to work for the sake of suffering beings.

original: sems can gyi don bya bar bskul ma 'debs so zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: sems can gyi don bya bar bskul ma 'debs so zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that they are urged to work for the sake of sentient beings.

original: pha rol sdug bsngal bas ni sems gdungs na //üîΩzhes bya ba la /
analyzed: pha rol sdug bsngal bas ni sems gdungs na // zhes bya ba la /
translated: When their minds are pained by the suffering of others,

original: gzhan yang byang chub sems dpa' rnams la slob dpon snying rje chen pos bsten par ma zad kyi /
analyzed: gzhan yang byang chub sems dpa' rnams la slob dpon snying rje chen pos bsten par ma zad kyi /
translated: Moreover, the Bodhisattvas are not only taught by the teacher, great compassion.

original: sems can gzhan gyi sdug bsngal ba mthong na shin tu bdag nyid sdug bsngal bar 'gyur ba'i rang bzhin can yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: sems can gzhan gyi sdug bsngal ba mthong na shin tu bdag nyid sdug bsngal bar 'gyur ba'i rang bzhin can yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that they are by nature very pained when they see the suffering of other sentient beings.

original: gzhan gyi bya ba nye bar gnas pa la //
analyzed: gzhan gyi bya ba nye bar gnas pa la //
translated: When others are in need of help,

original: gzhan gyis bskul ba shin tu ngo yang tsha //üîΩzhes bya ba la /
analyzed: gzhan gyis bskul ba shin tu ngo yang tsha //üîΩzhes bya ba la /
translated: they are ashamed to be urged by others.

original: de ltar slob dpon snying rje chen pos kyang bsten gzhan sdug bsngal bas kyang bdag sdug bsngal ba'i rang bzhin can yang yin pas de sems can pha rol tu phyin pa drug la gzhag pa'i skabs su bab la /
analyzed: de ltar slob dpon snying rje chen pos kyang bsten gzhan sdug bsngal bas kyang bdag sdug bsngal ba'i rang bzhin can yang yin pas de sems can pha rol tu phyin pa drug la gzhag pa'i skabs su bab la /
translated: Thus, the Master, out of great compassion, has the nature of suffering more than others do, because of the suffering of sentient beings. Therefore, the occasion has arrived for him to establish sentient beings in the six perfections.

original: sems can gyi don byed pa rnams dge ba'i bshes gnyen gyis bskul nas don byed par 'gyur la /
analyzed: sems can gyi don byed pa rnams dge ba'i bshes gnyen gyis bskul nas don byed par 'gyur la /
translated: Those who work for the welfare of sentient beings will work for that welfare when urged by a spiritual teacher.

original: byang chub sems dpa' lhag par ngo tsha bar bya ba yin no @65b zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' lhag par ngo tsha bar bya ba yin no @65b zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: It is a bodhisattva's special shame to be lazy about working for the welfare of sentient beings.

original: le lo la yang yongs su smin pa'i tshigs su bcad pa zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: le lo la yang yongs su smin pa'i tshigs su bcad pa zhes bya ba la /
translated: A verse on laziness

original: byang chub sems dpa' bdag dang gzhan gyi don du byang chub tu sems bskyed nas brtson 'grus smyur te bya dgos kyi /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' bdag dang gzhan gyi don du byang chub tu sems bskyed nas brtson 'grus smyur te bya dgos kyi /
translated: The bodhisattva, having generated the Thought of enlightenment for the sake of self and others, must quickly work diligently.

original: le lo byar mi rung bar bstan pa'i phyir tshigs su bcad pa rtsom mo zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: le lo byar mi rung bar bstan pa'i phyir tshigs su bcad pa rtsom mo zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The verse is begun in order to show that laziness is not appropriate.

original: sems can dag gis khur chen mgos khyer la //
analyzed: sems can dag gis khur chen mgos khyer la //
translated: Sentient beings bear the great burden on their heads.

original: sems can mchog ni dal gyis 'gro mi mdzes //
analyzed: sems can mchog ni dal gyis 'gro mi mdzes //
translated: It is not right for the best of beings to proceed slowly and unattractively.

original: bdag dang gzhan gyi rnam mang bcing bas bcings //
analyzed: bdag dang gzhan gyi rnam mang bcing bas bcings //
translated: Bound by many fetters, of self and others,

original: brgya 'gyur du yang brtson 'grus bya bar rigs //üîΩzhes bya ba la /
analyzed: brgya 'gyur du yang brtson 'grus bya bar rigs // zhes bya ba la /
translated: it is right to exert oneself a hundredfold.

original: 'jig rten na yang khur chen po khyer ba la la ma ring por 'gro ba rnams ma bsgyur bar dal gyis song na gnas der phyin par mi 'gyur ba de bzhin du /
analyzed: 'jig rten na yang khur chen po khyer ba la la ma ring por 'gro ba rnams ma bsgyur bar dal gyis song na gnas der phyin par mi 'gyur ba de bzhin du /
translated: In the world, when someone is carrying a heavy load and is going a long distance, if he proceeds slowly and without changing position, he will not reach his destination.

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems can thams cad bla na med pa'i byang chub tu bsgral lo zhes bya ba'i khur mgos khyer te gces par byas nas byang chub kyi sems bskyed de sangs rgyas kyi sar 'gro dgos pa de pha rol tu phyin pa drug spyod pa la
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems can thams cad bla na med pa'i byang chub tu bsgral lo zhes bya ba'i khur mgos khyer te gces par byas nas byang chub kyi sems bskyed de sangs rgyas kyi sar 'gro dgos pa de pha rol tu phyin pa drug spyod pa la
translated: In the same way, the bodhisattva, thinking, ‚ÄúI will liberate all sentient beings into unsurpassable enlightenment,‚Äù should take up the heavy burden on his head and proceed to the level of buddhahood with the generation of the mind of enlightenment.

original: brtson 'grus dal gyis 'jug par mi rigs te /
analyzed: brtson 'grus dal gyis 'jug par mi rigs te /
translated: It is not right for him to proceed slowly and with little exertion in the practice of the six perfections.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is this?

original: dper na 'phags pa nyan thos lta bu bdag 'ba' zhig gi don du byed la /
analyzed: dper na 'phags pa nyan thos lta bu bdag 'ba' zhig gi don du byed la /
translated: For example, the noble disciples act only for their own benefit.

original: bdag nyid kyis las dang nyon mongs pa dang 'tshe ba'i bcing ba gcod par rtsom pa yang gtsub shing las me 'byung ba bzhin du brtson 'grus bsgyur nas tshe gsum mam /
analyzed: bdag nyid kyis las dang nyon mongs pa dang 'tshe ba'i bcing ba gcod par rtsom pa yang gtsub shing las me 'byung ba bzhin du brtson 'grus bsgyur nas tshe gsum mam /
translated: And when you begin to cut the bonds of karma, afflictions, and violence, you must transform your diligence, as when you create fire by rubbing sticks together.

original: bdun gyis rang gi 'bras bu thob par byed na byang chub sems dpa' bdag dang gzhan gnyi ga'i rgyud la yod pa'i las dang / nyon mongs pa dang 'tshe ba'i bcing bas bcings pa de bsal bar bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: bdun gyis rang gi 'bras bu thob par byed na byang chub sems dpa' bdag dang gzhan gnyi ga'i rgyud la yod pa'i las dang / nyon mongs pa dang 'tshe ba'i bcing bas bcings pa de bsal bar bya ba'i phyir /
translated: The bodhisattva, in order to remove the fetters of karma, affliction and violence that exist in the mindstreams of both self and other, should not engage in laziness.

original: le lo bya bar mi rigs kyi nyan thos pas bskal ba brgya stong du mas bslabs te /
analyzed: le lo bya bar mi rigs kyi nyan thos pas bskal ba brgya stong du mas bslabs te /
translated: It is proper for him to apply diligence, having trained for many hundreds of thousands of eons in the way of the ≈õrƒÅvakas.

original: brtson 'grus rtsom pa'i rigs so zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: brtson 'grus rtsom pa'i rigs so zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that it is proper for him to apply diligence.

original: bcing ba gsum ni mngon pa'i chos mdzod la //
analyzed: bcing ba gsum ni mngon pa'i chos mdzod la //
translated: The three fetters are mentioned in the Treasury of Abhidharma:üîΩThe karmas of the heinous actions,

original: mtshams med pa yi las rnams dang // nyon mongs mi bzad ngan 'gro dang // sgra mi snyan dang 'du shes med ;
analyzed: mtshams med pa yi las rnams dang // nyon mongs mi bzad ngan 'gro dang // sgra mi snyan dang 'du shes med ;
translated: the unbearable afflictions, the lower realms,üîΩUttarakuru, and the mindless states

original: / sgrib pa dag ni gsum du 'dod //
analyzed: / sgrib pa dag ni gsum du 'dod //
translated: are asserted to be the three obstructions.

original: de la mtshams med pa lnga ni las kyis bcings pa'o //
analyzed: de la mtshams med pa lnga ni las kyis bcings pa'o //
translated: The five heinous acts are the fetter of karma.

original: 'dod chags dang zhe sdang chen po ni nyon mongs pas bcings pa'o //
analyzed: 'dod chags dang zhe sdang chen po ni nyon mongs pas bcings pa'o //
translated: Great desire and hatred are the fetter of afflictions.

original: ngan song gsum dang byang gi sgra mi snyan dang 'du shes med pa'i lhar skyes pa ni tshe'i 'ching ba'o //üîΩbyang chub tu sems @66a * //
analyzed: ngan song gsum dang byang gi sgra mi snyan dang 'du shes med pa'i lhar skyes pa ni tshe'i 'ching ba'o // byang chub tu sems @66a * //
translated: Birth in the three lower realms, in the north, or as a god without discrimination is the fetter of life.

original: bskyed pa lhag par bya ba'i skabs rdzogs so /
analyzed: bskyed pa lhag par bya ba'i skabs rdzogs so /
translated: The chapter on generating the supreme bodhicitta is complete.

original: // / sems bskyed pa'i skabs kyi rjes la sgrub pa'i skabs bshad par cis 'brel zhe na /
analyzed: // / sems bskyed pa'i skabs kyi rjes la sgrub pa'i skabs bshad par cis 'brel zhe na /
translated: After the chapter on generating bodhicitta, why is the chapter on practice explained?üîΩAbove it says:

original: gong du / sems can dag gi khur ni mgos khyer la //
analyzed: gong du / sems can dag gi khur ni mgos khyer la //
translated: The burden of sentient beings is carried on the head.

original: sems can mchog ni dal gyis 'gro mi mdzes //
analyzed: sems can mchog ni dal gyis 'gro mi mdzes //
translated: The supreme being does not move slowly, it is not beautiful.

original: bdag dang gzhan gyi rnam mang bcing bas bcings //
analyzed: bdag dang gzhan gyi rnam mang bcing bas bcings //
translated: Bound by the many bonds of self and other,

original: brgya 'gyur du ni brtson 'grus bya ba'i rigs /
analyzed: brgya 'gyur du ni brtson 'grus bya ba'i rigs /
translated: it is fitting to exert a hundredfold effort.

original: zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: Thus it is said.

original: pha rol tu phyin pa la bsgrub pa med na /
analyzed: pha rol tu phyin pa la bsgrub pa med na /
translated: If there is no practice in the perfections,

original: sems bskyed pa tsam gyis bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub mi 'thob ste /
analyzed: sems bskyed pa tsam gyis bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub mi 'thob ste /
translated: Awakening is not attained merely by generating the Thought.

original: de las na sems bskyed pa la gdon mi za bar sgrub pa brtsams dgos so //
analyzed: de las na sems bskyed pa la gdon mi za bar sgrub pa brtsams dgos so //
translated: Therefore, one who has generated the Thought must certainly begin the practice.

original: de'i phyir byang chub sems dpa'i sgrub pa ni gnas chen po ste /
analyzed: de'i phyir byang chub sems dpa'i sgrub pa ni gnas chen po ste /
translated: Hence, the practice of the bodhisattva is a great foundation,

original: byang chub kyi sems la gnas pa'i phyir ro zhes 'og nas kyang bshad do //
analyzed: byang chub kyi sems la gnas pa'i phyir ro zhes 'og nas kyang bshad do //
translated: because it is the foundation of the Thought of Awakening.

original: de lta bas na bla na med pa'i byang chub tu sems bskyed pa la brtan nas sgrub pa la 'jug par bya ste /
analyzed: de lta bas na bla na med pa'i byang chub tu sems bskyed pa la brtan nas sgrub pa la 'jug par bya ste /
translated: Therefore, having generated the Thought of Awakening, one should enter into the practice.

original: sems kyang bskyed ;
analyzed: sems kyang bskyed ;
translated: One should generate the Thought.

original: sgrub ba la gnas nas gdod bdag dang gzhan gyi don 'grub kyi sgrub pa med na mi 'grub pas sems bskyed pa'i rjes la sgrub pa'i skabs bshad par 'brel to //
analyzed: sgrub ba la gnas nas gdod bdag dang gzhan gyi don 'grub kyi sgrub pa med na mi 'grub pas sems bskyed pa'i rjes la sgrub pa'i skabs bshad par 'brel to //
translated: Having entered into the practice, one accomplishes the aims of self and other. Without the practice, one does not accomplish. Therefore, after generating the Thought, the section on the practice is explained.

original: yang na gong du rigs la gnas pas byang chub tu sems bskyed nas byang chub sems dpa'i bslab pa la bslab bar bya'o zhes bshad pa las /
analyzed: yang na gong du rigs la gnas pas byang chub tu sems bskyed nas byang chub sems dpa'i bslab pa la bslab bar bya'o zhes bshad pa las /
translated: Or else, having generated the Thought of Enlightenment by abiding in the lineage as explained above, one should train in the Bodhisattva's precepts.üîΩ

original: da ci la dmigs nas byang chub sems dpa'i bslab pa la slob par byed pa'i bslab ba'i dmigs pa'i khyad par ston to //
analyzed: da ci la dmigs nas byang chub sems dpa'i bslab pa la slob par byed pa'i bslab ba'i dmigs pa'i khyad par ston to //
translated: Or else, it is a teaching of the distinctive objects of observation of the trainings, in terms of which one should train in the trainings of the Bodhisattvas, having generated the Thought of Enlightenment by abiding in the lineage as explained above.

original: bslab ba'i dmigs pa'i khyad par yang rnam pa lnga ste /
analyzed: bslab ba'i dmigs pa'i khyad par yang rnam pa lnga ste /
translated: The distinctive objects of observation of the trainings are fivefold:

original: bdag dang gzhan gyi don dang / de kho na'i don dang / mthu dang / yongs su smin pa dang / bla na med pa'i byang chub bo //
analyzed: bdag dang gzhan gyi don dang / de kho na'i don dang / mthu dang / yongs su smin pa dang / bla na med pa'i byang chub bo //
translated: the benefit of self and other, the meaning of reality, power, complete ripening, and unsurpassed enlightenment.

original: de lnga yang nyan thos la sogs pa las khyad zhugs te /
analyzed: de lnga yang nyan thos la sogs pa las khyad zhugs te /
translated: And these five are distinctive in comparison with the Sravakas, etc.

original: ji ltar zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar zhe na /
translated: How so?

original: nyan thos rnams kyi bslab pa ni bdag gi don la dmigs pa dang / gang zag la bdag med pa'i de kho na'i don yin pa dang / stong gsum gyi stong chen po'i 'jig rten gyi khams gcig tsam gyi nang du rdzu 'phrul byed nus pas mthu chung ba dang /
analyzed: nyan thos rnams kyi bslab pa ni bdag gi don la dmigs pa dang / gang zag la bdag med pa'i de kho na'i don yin pa dang / stong gsum gyi stong chen po'i 'jig rten gyi khams gcig tsam gyi nang du rdzu 'phrul byed nus pas mthu chung ba dang /
translated: The training of the listeners is focused on one's own goal, it is the meaning of the suchness of the individual no self, its power is limited, for it is able to perform miracles only in a single billionfold world system,üîΩit brings one's own self to full maturity and it merely attains the listeners' enlightenment.

original: bdag yongs su smin par byed pa dang / nyan thos kyi byang chub len pa tsam du zad kyi byang chub sems dpa' ni de las kun bzlog pa ste /
analyzed: bdag yongs su smin par byed pa dang / nyan thos kyi byang chub len pa tsam du zad kyi byang chub sems dpa' ni de las kun bzlog pa ste /
translated: The bodhisattva's training is the opposite of that.

original: bdag dang gzhan gyi don la dmigs pa dang / gang zag dang chos la bdag med pa de kho na'i don yin pa dang / rdzu 'phrul yang phyogs bcu'i @66b 'jig rten gyi khams thams cad du 'jug pa dang / bdag dang sems can gnyi ga smin par byed pa dang /
analyzed: bdag dang gzhan gyi don la dmigs pa dang / gang zag dang chos la bdag med pa de kho na'i don yin pa dang / rdzu 'phrul yang phyogs bcu'i @66b 'jig rten gyi khams thams cad du 'jug pa dang / bdag dang sems can gnyi ga smin par byed pa dang /
translated: It is focused on one's own and others' goals, it is the meaning of the suchness of the individual and phenomenal no self, its power is such that it can perform miracles in all the worlds of the ten directions, it brings both oneself and other sentient beings to full maturity and

original: bla na med pa'i byang chub len pas khyad zhugs te /
analyzed: bla na med pa'i byang chub len pas khyad zhugs te /
translated: it attains unsurpassable enlightenment.

original: de la yang bdag dang gzhan gyi don dang / de kho na'i don dang / mthu dang / yongs su smin par byed pa dang / bzhi la ni rgyu'i mtshan nyid lta bur dmigs la /
analyzed: de la yang bdag dang gzhan gyi don dang / de kho na'i don dang / mthu dang / yongs su smin par byed pa dang / bzhi la ni rgyu'i mtshan nyid lta bur dmigs la /
translated: Moreover, the first four are observed as the characteristic of the cause of one's own and others' goals, the goal of reality, power and complete maturation.

original: bla na med pa'i byang chub la ni 'bras bu'i mtshan nyid lta bur dmigs pas /
analyzed: bla na med pa'i byang chub la ni 'bras bu'i mtshan nyid lta bur dmigs pas /
translated: Unsurpassed enlightenment is observed as the characteristic of the result.

original: sems bskyed pa'i rjes la bsgrub pa'i skabs bshad par 'brel to //
analyzed: sems bskyed pa'i rjes la bsgrub pa'i skabs bshad par 'brel to //
translated: Therefore, the explanation of the occasion of practice after generating the enlightenment mind is related.

original: yang na gong du rigs la gnas pas byang chub tu sems bskyed nas byang chub sems dpa'i bslab ba la bslab par bya ste /
analyzed: yang na gong du rigs la gnas pas byang chub tu sems bskyed nas byang chub sems dpa'i bslab ba la bslab par bya ste /
translated: Or, having generated the enlightenment mind through abiding in the lineage above, one should train in the bodhisattva trainings.

original: byang chub sems dpa'i bslab pa yang gang la bslab par bya ba dang / ji ltar bslab par bya ba dang / gang gis bslab par bya ba dang rnam pa gsum mo zhes smos pa las /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i bslab pa yang gang la bslab par bya ba dang / ji ltar bslab par bya ba dang / gang gis bslab par bya ba dang rnam pa gsum mo zhes smos pa las /
translated: The bodhisattva trainings are also threefold: that in which one should train, how one should train and by what one should train.

original: da gang la bslab par bya ba de ston te /
analyzed: da gang la bslab par bya ba de ston te /
translated: Now, that in which one should train is taught.

original: gang la bslab par bya zhe na /
analyzed: gang la bslab par bya zhe na /
translated: What is that in which one should train?

original: bdag dang gzhan gyi don la sogs pa rnam pa lnga la bslab par bya ste /
analyzed: bdag dang gzhan gyi don la sogs pa rnam pa lnga la bslab par bya ste /
translated: One should train in five aspects, such as the benefit for oneself and others.üîΩThe five aspects are taught in order to show that they can be accomplished by those who abide in practice, but not by those who lack practice.

original: rnam pa lnga po de yang sgrub pa la gnas pa rnams kyis 'grub par nus kyi sgrub pa med pa rnams kyis 'grub par mi nus par bstan pa'i phyir sems bskyed pa'i rjes la sgrub pa'i skabs bshad bar 'brel to //üîΩgnas rtsom 'bras bu skye ba che bdag nyid //
analyzed: rnam pa lnga po de yang sgrub pa la gnas pa rnams kyis 'grub par nus kyi sgrub pa med pa rnams kyis 'grub par mi nus par bstan pa'i phyir sems bskyed pa'i rjes la sgrub pa'i skabs bshad bar 'brel to // gnas rtsom 'bras bu skye ba che bdag nyid //
translated: The chapter on practice is connected to the generation of the Thought immediately after.

original: rgyal sras rnams kyi sgrub pa yin par 'dod //üîΩces bya ba la /
analyzed: rgyal sras rnams kyi sgrub pa yin par 'dod // ces bya ba la /
translated: The practice of the Sons of the Victorious One is considered to be the basis, the undertaking, the result, the birth, and the greatness.

original: rgyal ba ni rnam par mi rtog pa'i ye shes dang / chos kyi dbyings la ste /
analyzed: rgyal ba ni rnam par mi rtog pa'i ye shes dang / chos kyi dbyings la ste /
translated: Here, the Victorious One is the non-conceptual exalted wisdom and the basic element of the Dharma.

original: de gnyis rtogs pa las skyes ba rnams ni rgyal ba'i sras zhes bya ste /
analyzed: de gnyis rtogs pa las skyes ba rnams ni rgyal ba'i sras zhes bya ste /
translated: Those who are born from the realization of those two are called ‚ÄúSons of the Victorious One.‚Äù

original: dngos su byang chub sems dpa' la bya'o //
analyzed: dngos su byang chub sems dpa' la bya'o //
translated: This is literally true of the Bodhisattvas.

original: byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi sgrub pa ni bslab pa gsum lta bu'i mtshan nyid yin par 'dod de /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi sgrub pa ni bslab pa gsum lta bu'i mtshan nyid yin par 'dod de /
translated: The practice of the Bodhisattvas is considered to be characterized by the three trainings.

original: gang zhe na /
analyzed: gang zhe na /
translated: What are they?

original: gnas che ba'i bdag nyid dang / rtsom pa che ba'i bdag nyid dang / 'bras bu che ba'i bdag nyid du 'dod do //
analyzed: gnas che ba'i bdag nyid dang / rtsom pa che ba'i bdag nyid dang / 'bras bu che ba'i bdag nyid du 'dod do //
translated: It is held to be great in terms of its basis, great in terms of its undertaking, and great in terms of its result.üîΩIn the first place, when one generates the thought of enlightenment, one generates the thought, ‚ÄúI will liberate all sentient beings into unsurpassed enlightenment.‚Äù

original: de la dang po byang chub tu sems bskyed pa na sems can thams cad bla na med pa'i byang chub tu bsgral bar bya'o zhes sems bskyed pa de las sgrub pa 'byung bas na /
analyzed: de la dang po byang chub tu sems bskyed pa na sems can thams cad bla na med pa'i byang chub tu bsgral bar bya'o zhes sems bskyed pa de las sgrub pa 'byung bas na /
translated: From that, practice arises.

original: sgrub pa de gnas che ba'i bdag nyid do //
analyzed: sgrub pa de gnas che ba'i bdag nyid do //
translated: Thus, that practice is great in terms of its basis.

original: de ltar sems bskyed nas mos pas spyod pa'i sa yan chad /
analyzed: de ltar sems bskyed nas mos pas spyod pa'i sa yan chad /
translated: Having generated the thought of enlightenment in that way, from the stage of engagement through devoted conduct up to the tenth stage,

translated: Endowed with compassion, he does not enter only the sphere of nirvana like the sravakas, but abides in cyclic existence for the sake of sentient beings.

original: @72a * // de ltar mdzad pa'i byang chub sems dpa' des gzhan gyi ched du bsgrubs kyang bdag dang gzhan gnyi ga'i don bsgrubs nas /
analyzed: @72a * // de ltar mdzad pa'i byang chub sems dpa' des gzhan gyi ched du bsgrubs kyang bdag dang gzhan gnyi ga'i don bsgrubs nas /
translated: The bodhisattva who acts in this way, even though he practices for the sake of others, accomplishes the aims of both himself and others.

original: mjug tu bdag nyid mi gnas pa'i mya ngan las 'das ba thob par gyur to zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: mjug tu bdag nyid mi gnas pa'i mya ngan las 'das ba thob par gyur to zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: In conclusion, he attains the nirvana that is not attached to existence. This is the meaning.

original: spyod yul yongs su bsngo bar tshigs su bcad pa zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: spyod yul yongs su bsngo bar tshigs su bcad pa zhes bya ba la /
translated: A verse on the dedication of the field of action

original: byang chub sems dpa' rnams lus dang ngag dang yid kyi sgo nas pha rol tu phyin pa drug bsgrubs pas sems can gyi don byed par yang ma zad kyi /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' rnams lus dang ngag dang yid kyi sgo nas pha rol tu phyin pa drug bsgrubs pas sems can gyi don byed par yang ma zad kyi /
translated: Bodhisattvas not only benefit sentient beings by accomplishing the six perfections through body, speech, and mind.

original: spyod yul yongs su bsngo ba'i sgo nas kyang sems can gyi don byed par ston te /
analyzed: spyod yul yongs su bsngo ba'i sgo nas kyang sems can gyi don byed par ston te /
translated: They also benefit sentient beings by dedicating their spheres of activity.üîΩThe verse is composed in order to teach that one should dedicate to the benefit of sentient beings the activities of the four postures through the body, and the seeing, hearing, etc.

original: spyod yul ni lus kyi sgo nas spyod lam bzhi la spyod ba dang / mig gi dbang po nas yid kyi dbang po'i bar du dbang po drug gis so so'i yul mthong ba dang thos pa la sogs ba byas pa rnams sems can gyi don du bsngo bar bstan pa'i phyir tshigs su bcad pa rtsom mo zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: spyod yul ni lus kyi sgo nas spyod lam bzhi la spyod ba dang / mig gi dbang po nas yid kyi dbang po'i bar du dbang po drug gis so so'i yul mthong ba dang thos pa la sogs ba byas pa rnams sems can gyi don du bsngo bar bstan pa'i phyir tshigs su bcad pa rtsom mo zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: of the six sense faculties, from the eye faculty to the mind faculty.

original: ji lta ji ltar rgyal sras spyod pa'i tshe //
analyzed: ji lta ji ltar rgyal sras spyod pa'i tshe //
translated: Whenever the Victor's spiritual heirüîΩpractices the bodhisattva deeds,

original: zhes bya ba la ji lta ji ltar zhes bya ba ni gang dang gang gi tshe na zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: zhes bya ba la ji lta ji ltar zhes bya ba ni gang dang gang gi tshe na zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: Whenever means at whatever time.

original: rgyal sras spyod pa zhes bya ba ni don gyis grong la sogs par 'jug pa'am /
analyzed: rgyal sras spyod pa zhes bya ba ni don gyis grong la sogs par 'jug pa'am /
translated: The phrase ‚Äúthe activities of the bodhisattva‚Äù refers to the activities of entering a city, etc.,

original: spyod lam bzhis gnas ba la bya'o //üîΩdbang po'i spyod yul sna tshogs 'jug gyur pa //
analyzed: spyod lam bzhis gnas ba la bya'o // dbang po'i spyod yul sna tshogs 'jug gyur pa //
translated: or to the activities of remaining in the four postures.

original: zhes bya ba ni mig gi dbang po nas yid kyi dbang po'i bar du drug go //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni mig gi dbang po nas yid kyi dbang po'i bar du drug go //
translated: The phrase ‚Äúthe various objects of the senses‚Äù refers to the six sense faculties, from the eye faculty up to the mind faculty.

original: de'i spyod yul ni gzugs nas chos kyi bar du drug go //üîΩ'jug pa ni mig gis gzugs mthong ba dang / rna bas sgra thos pa nas yid kyis chos shes pa'i bar du'o //
analyzed: de'i spyod yul ni gzugs nas chos kyi bar du drug go // 'jug pa ni mig gis gzugs mthong ba dang / rna bas sgra thos pa nas yid kyis chos shes pa'i bar du'o //
translated: The objects of those faculties are the six objects, from form up to entities.

original: de lta de ltar rigs pa'i mthun tshig gis //üîΩzhes bya ba la /üîΩde lta de ltar zhes bya ba ni de dang de'i tshe na zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: de lta de ltar rigs pa'i mthun tshig gis // zhes bya ba la / de lta de ltar zhes bya ba ni de dang de'i tshe na zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The engagement of the faculties is the seeing of forms with the eye, the hearing of sounds with the ear, up to the knowing of entities with the mind.üîΩThe phrase ‚Äúin whatever way‚Äù means ‚Äúat that time.‚ÄùüîΩThe phrase ‚Äúin whatever way‚Äù means ‚Äúat that time.‚Äù

original: rigs pa zhes bya ba ni bdag dang gzhan gyi don du 'gyur ba'i tshig smra ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rigs pa zhes bya ba ni bdag dang gzhan gyi don du 'gyur ba'i tshig smra ba'i phyir ro //
translated: The phrase ‚Äúin a manner that is appropriate‚Äù means ‚Äúin a manner that is suitable.‚Äù

original: mthun pa'i tshig ni bdag gis ci dang ci mthong ba dang / sems can gyi don du bsngo ba'i tshig 'brel pa ste /
analyzed: mthun pa'i tshig ni bdag gis ci dang ci mthong ba dang / sems can gyi don du bsngo ba'i tshig 'brel pa ste /
translated: The words of agreement are the words of dedication to the benefit of beings of whatever is seen and whatever is heard.

original: ci dang ci mthong ba dang ci thos pa rnams bdag dang gzhan gyi don byas nas sems can gyi don du bsngo bas na /
analyzed: ci dang ci mthong ba dang ci thos pa rnams bdag dang gzhan gyi don byas nas sems can gyi don du bsngo bas na /
translated: Whatever is seen and whatever is heard, having been done for the benefit of self and other, are dedicated to the benefit of beings.

original: sems can la phan pa'i phyir mngon par 'du byed ces bya'o //üîΩsems can rnams la mi bzod pa dgag ba'i phyir tshigs su bcad pa zhes bya ba byang chub sems dpa' 'khor ba na sems can gyi don byed pa'i tshe phan brtags na yang slar gnod pa byed ba dang / byang chub sems dpa' la brdeg pa dang /
analyzed: sems can la phan pa'i phyir mngon par 'du byed ces bya'o // sems can rnams la mi bzod pa dgag ba'i phyir tshigs su bcad pa zhes bya ba byang chub sems dpa' 'khor ba na sems can gyi don byed pa'i tshe phan brtags na yang slar gnod pa byed ba dang / byang chub sems dpa' la brdeg pa dang /
translated: Therefore, it is said that they are formed for the benefit of beings.üîΩA verse to stop impatience with beings.üîΩWhen bodhisattvas are working for the welfare of beings in cyclic existence, it is not right for them to be impatient with those who, though they are helped, still do harm, who are hostile to the bodhisattvas, and who think of doing them injury, such as by beating them,

original: btsog ba ba @72b la sogs pa'i gnod pa byed par sems pa rnams la mi bzod par bya bar mi rigs kyi /
analyzed: btsog ba ba @72b la sogs pa'i gnod pa byed par sems pa rnams la mi bzod par bya bar mi rigs kyi /
translated: or with those who are impure, etc.

original: dang du blang ba rigs par bstan ba'i phyir tshigs su bcad pa rtsom mo zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: dang du blang ba rigs par bstan ba'i phyir tshigs su bcad pa rtsom mo zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: It is right for them to accept all beings. This is the point of the verse.

original: rtag tu rang dbang med pa'i skyon sems kyis //üîΩskye bos nyes pa blo ldan mi sems te //
analyzed: rtag tu rang dbang med pa'i skyon sems kyis // skye bos nyes pa blo ldan mi sems te //
translated: The wise do not think that the fault is in the beings,

original: zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la /
translated: because they are always without independent control.

original: byang chub sems dpa' shes rab dang snying rjer ldan pa yin te /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' shes rab dang snying rjer ldan pa yin te /
translated: The bodhisattva is endowed with wisdom and compassion.

original: de la shes rab kyis ni sems can gyis byang chub sems dpa' la gnod par byas na yang sems can de dag 'dod chags dang / zhe sdang dang / gti mug gi dbang du song ste /
analyzed: de la shes rab kyis ni sems can gyis byang chub sems dpa' la gnod par byas na yang sems can de dag 'dod chags dang / zhe sdang dang / gti mug gi dbang du song ste /
translated: With wisdom, he understands that when beings harm the bodhisattva, they are under the control of attachment, aversion, and delusion.üîΩThey are always without independent control, and they commit faults such as striking and binding the bodhisattva, not that they commit faults while having independent control.

original: rtag tu yang rang dbang med par byang chub sems dpa' la brdeg pa dang ; bcing ba la sogs pa'i nyes pa byed par sems kyi dbang yod bzhin du nyes ba byed pa ni ma yin no zhes te de ltar thugs su chud pas na nyon mongs pa rnams kyi nyes par dgongs kyi sems can rnams kyi nyes par mi dgongs so zhes
analyzed: rtag tu yang rang dbang med par byang chub sems dpa' la brdeg pa dang ; bcing ba la sogs pa'i nyes pa byed par sems kyi dbang yod bzhin du nyes ba byed pa ni ma yin no zhes te de ltar thugs su chud pas na nyon mongs pa rnams kyi nyes par dgongs kyi sems can rnams kyi nyes par mi dgongs so zhes
translated: Thus, he understands that the fault is in the afflictions, not in the beings.

original: bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: bya ba'i don to //
translated: This is the meaning.

original: mi 'dod bzhin du shes bar byed pa'i skye bo yin pas snying rje 'phel phyir ro //üîΩzhes bya ba la /
analyzed: mi 'dod bzhin du shes bar byed pa'i skye bo yin pas snying rje 'phel phyir ro // zhes bya ba la /
translated: because they are people who understand without wanting to.

original: byang chub sems dpa' rnams ni thugs rje 'phel te /üîΩde bas na dper na g-yul ngag tu bdag dang gzhan gnyi ga la gnod par 'gyur ba'i 'thab mo la 'gro ba dag //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' rnams ni thugs rje 'phel te / de bas na dper na g-yul ngag tu bdag dang gzhan gnyi ga la gnod par 'gyur ba'i 'thab mo la 'gro ba dag //
translated: The bodhisattvas increase their compassion.

original: jo bo dang rgyal po la sogs pa'i dbang gis mi 'dod bzhin du 'gro ba de dang 'dra bar skye bo 'di dag gnod pa byed pa yang /
analyzed: jo bo dang rgyal po la sogs pa'i dbang gis mi 'dod bzhin du 'gro ba de dang 'dra bar skye bo 'di dag gnod pa byed pa yang /
translated: Therefore, just as in a battle both oneself and others are harmed, so in the same way, these people who do harmüîΩare under the sway of attachment, delusion, and hatred, and so they do wrong without wanting to.

original: 'dod chags dang / gti mug dang / zhe sdang gi dbang du gyur pas mi 'dod bzhin du nyes pa byed pa yin no zhes thugs su chud nas de dag la thugs rje'i gnas su dgongs kyi /
analyzed: 'dod chags dang / gti mug dang / zhe sdang gi dbang du gyur pas mi 'dod bzhin du nyes pa byed pa yin no zhes thugs su chud nas de dag la thugs rje'i gnas su dgongs kyi /
translated: Having understood this, they are considered to be the objects of compassion,

original: gnod pa'i lan glan par mi dgongs so zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: gnod pa'i lan glan par mi dgongs so zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: but not as objects of retaliation.

original: 'di yan chad du byang chub sems dpa'i sgrub pa rgya cher bstan to //
analyzed: 'di yan chad du byang chub sems dpa'i sgrub pa rgya cher bstan to //
translated: Up to this point, the practice of the bodhisattvas has been taught extensively.

original: sgrub pa'i che ba nyid kyi tshigs su bcad pa zhes bya ba la /üîΩda ni tshigs bcad gcig gis sgrub pa'i don mdor bsdus nas kyang ston /
analyzed: sgrub pa'i che ba nyid kyi tshigs su bcad pa zhes bya ba la / da ni tshigs bcad gcig gis sgrub pa'i don mdor bsdus nas kyang ston /
translated: The greatness of the practice itself is taught in one verse.

original: byang chub sems dpa'i sgrub pa che ba'i bdag nyid kyang 'chad de /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i sgrub pa che ba'i bdag nyid kyang 'chad de /
translated: Now, in one verse, the meaning of the practice is taught in brief and also the greatness of the bodhisattva's practice is explained.

original: che ba'i bdag nyid ni zil gyis gnon pa'i che ba dang / mya ngan las 'das pa dang / yon tan 'phel ba che ba dang / yongs su mi gtong ba che ba'o //
analyzed: che ba'i bdag nyid ni zil gyis gnon pa'i che ba dang / mya ngan las 'das pa dang / yon tan 'phel ba che ba dang / yongs su mi gtong ba che ba'o //
translated: The greatness is the greatness of supremacy, the greatness of nirvana, the greatness of the increase of virtues, and the greatness of non-abandonment.

original: srid rgyud mtha' dag zil gnon 'gro ba dang // zhes bya bas zil gyis gnon pa'i che ba bstan te /
analyzed: srid rgyud mtha' dag zil gnon 'gro ba dang // zhes bya bas zil gyis gnon pa'i che ba bstan te /
translated: The verse beginning Subjugating the entire stream of existence teaches the greatness of supremacy.

original: srid pa ni khams gsum la bya'o//
analyzed: srid pa ni khams gsum la bya'o//
translated: Existence refers to the three realms.

original: @73a * // rgyud kyi sgras ni 'gro ba sdug bsngal ba la bya ste /
analyzed: @73a * // rgyud kyi sgras ni 'gro ba sdug bsngal ba la bya ste /
translated: Stream refers to the suffering of beings.

original: byang chub sems dpas gnas che ba dang / rtsom pa che ba dang / 'bras bu che ba'i sgrub pa dang / gnas pa dang / khams gsum dang 'gro ba'i sems lnga'i rgyud can thams cad zil gyis gnon na mi gnas pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa'i grong khyer du byed do zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpas gnas che ba dang / rtsom pa che ba dang / 'bras bu che ba'i sgrub pa dang / gnas pa dang / khams gsum dang 'gro ba'i sems lnga'i rgyud can thams cad zil gyis gnon na mi gnas pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa'i grong khyer du byed do zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The bodhisattva, by means of the practice of the great abode, the great undertaking, and the great result, and by means of the five thoughts of the three realms and the world, surpasses all those who have a mindstream, and he makes them go to the city of the nirvƒÅ·πáa that is not a location. This is the meaning.

original: ci'i phyir sems can rnams ni khams gsum na 'dod chags la sogs pa'i nyon mongs pas gsol /
analyzed: ci'i phyir sems can rnams ni khams gsum na 'dod chags la sogs pa'i nyon mongs pas gsol /
translated: Why are sentient beings bound in the three realms by the afflictions of attachment and so forth?

original: byang chub sems dpa' ni khams gsum na gnas kyang /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' ni khams gsum na gnas kyang /
translated: The bodhisattva, although dwelling in the three realms,

original: chos thams cad stong par thugs su chud pas khams gsum gyi nyis bas mi gos pa'i phyir /
analyzed: chos thams cad stong par thugs su chud pas khams gsum gyi nyis bas mi gos pa'i phyir /
translated: is not sullied by the afflictions of the three realms because he has realized that all phenomena are empty.

original: khams gsum zil gyis gnon to zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: khams gsum zil gyis gnon to zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: Therefore, he surpasses the three realms. This is the meaning.

original: sgrub pa 'di ni zhi ba'i mchog tu 'gro //üîΩzhes bya ba la /
analyzed: sgrub pa 'di ni zhi ba'i mchog tu 'gro // zhes bya ba la /
translated: This practice is the supreme going to peace.

original: mya ngan las 'das ba'i che ba bstan te /
analyzed: mya ngan las 'das ba'i che ba bstan te /
translated: Here, the greatness of nirvƒÅ·πáa is taught.

original: sgrub pa 'di zhes bya ba'i sgras ni gnas che ba dang / rtsom pa che ba dang / 'bras bu che ba'i sgrub pa la bya bar snyegs te /
analyzed: sgrub pa 'di zhes bya ba'i sgras ni gnas che ba dang / rtsom pa che ba dang / 'bras bu che ba'i sgrub pa la bya bar snyegs te /
translated: The word ‚Äúpractice‚Äù here is to be understood as referring to the practice of great abode, great undertaking, and great result.

original: sgrub ba de la gnas na ni mi gnas pa'i mya ngan las 'das par 'gro bas na zhi ba'i mchog tu 'gro ba zhes bya'o //
analyzed: sgrub ba de la gnas na ni mi gnas pa'i mya ngan las 'das par 'gro bas na zhi ba'i mchog tu 'gro ba zhes bya'o //
translated: When one abides in that practice, one goes to the supreme peace of nirvana, and so it is called ‚Äúgoing to the supreme peace.‚Äù

original: yon tan rnam pa mang po 'phel byed cing //
analyzed: yon tan rnam pa mang po 'phel byed cing //
translated: It causes the increase of many kinds of virtues.

original: zhes bya bas yon tan 'phel ba'i che ba bstan te /
analyzed: zhes bya bas yon tan 'phel ba'i che ba bstan te /
translated: This shows the greatness of the increase of virtues.

original: sgrub pa de la gnas na stobs dang / mi 'jigs pa dang ; ma 'dres pa la sogs pa'i yon tan thos pas yon tan mang po 'phel bar byed pas zhes bya'o //
analyzed: sgrub pa de la gnas na stobs dang / mi 'jigs pa dang ; ma 'dres pa la sogs pa'i yon tan thos pas yon tan mang po 'phel bar byed pas zhes bya'o //
translated: When one abides in that practice, one hears about the virtues of the powers, the fearlessnesses, the unique qualities, and so forth, and so it is said that it causes the increase of many virtues.

analyzed: snying rje'i bsam pas skye ba rtag tu sdud // ces bya ba la /
translated: With a compassionate attitude, one always embraces birth.

original: sems can yongs su mi btang ba'i che ba bstan te /
analyzed: sems can yongs su mi btang ba'i che ba bstan te /
translated: This shows the greatness of not abandoning sentient beings.

original: sgrub pa de la gnas na snying rje dang ldan pa'i byang chub sems dpa' rnams snying rje'i sems kyis 'khor ba'i mtha'i bar du yang sems can yongs su mi gtong ngo zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: sgrub pa de la gnas na snying rje dang ldan pa'i byang chub sems dpa' rnams snying rje'i sems kyis 'khor ba'i mtha'i bar du yang sems can yongs su mi gtong ngo zhes bya ba'i don to //

original: ji skad du shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa las /
analyzed: ji skad du shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa las /
translated: As the Perfection of Wisdom says,

original: rab 'byor ci ste gzugs dngos por 'gyur zhing dngos po med pa yang ma yin na ni /
analyzed: rab 'byor ci ste gzugs dngos por 'gyur zhing dngos po med pa yang ma yin na ni /
translated: ‚ÄúSubh≈´ti, if form were a thing and not a non-thing,üîΩthis Great Vehicle would not surpass and go beyond the worlds of gods, humans, and anti-gods.‚Äù

original: theg pa chen po 'dis lha dang mi dang lha ma yin du bcas pa'i 'jig rten zil gyis mnan nas 'byung bar mi 'gyur ro zhes bya bas don ni 'di skad ston pa yin te /
analyzed: theg pa chen po 'dis lha dang mi dang lha ma yin du bcas pa'i 'jig rten zil gyis mnan nas 'byung bar mi 'gyur ro zhes bya bas don ni 'di skad ston pa yin te /
translated: This is what is being taught:

original: gal te gzugs la sogs pa'i chos 'di dag ji ltar byis pa'i skye bo rnams kyis brjod cing dbang pos bzung ba de bzhin du yang dag par grub par 'gyur na ni 'di dag yod pa yin @73b gya med pa ma yin par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gal te gzugs la sogs pa'i chos 'di dag ji ltar byis pa'i skye bo rnams kyis brjod cing dbang pos bzung ba de bzhin du yang dag par grub par 'gyur na ni 'di dag yod pa yin @73b gya med pa ma yin par 'gyur ro //

analyzed: de ltar na ni theg ba chen po rnam par mi rtog pa'i ye shes 'dis lha dang bcas pa'i 'jig rten zil gyis mnan cing khams gsum las 'byung bar mi 'gyur ro //
translated: In that case, the Mahayana‚Äôs nonconceptual wisdom would not overpower the world with its gods and would not emerge from the three realms.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why?

analyzed: byis ba dang mkhas pa gnyis la khyad par med pa'i phyir ro //

original: gnyi gas kyang de kho na mthong ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gnyi gas kyang de kho na mthong ba'i phyir ro //

original: de bas na bcom ldan 'das kyis kyang ji ltar byis pa rnams brtags bzhin du dngos po yod par 'gyur ba dang / ji ltar mthong bzhin yod na ni //üîΩthams cad de nyid mthong bar 'gyur //
analyzed: de bas na bcom ldan 'das kyis kyang ji ltar byis pa rnams brtags bzhin du dngos po yod par 'gyur ba dang / ji ltar mthong bzhin yod na ni // thams cad de nyid mthong bar 'gyur //
translated: Therefore, the Lord has said, ‚ÄúIf things existed as they are imagined by the childish, and if they existed as they are seen,

original: zhes gsungs pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: zhes gsungs pa lta bu'o //
translated: then everyone would see them as they are in reality.‚Äù

original: gang gi phyir gzugs la sogs pa'i chos 'di dag byis pa kun du brtags pa'i bdag nyid du rang bzhin yod pa ma yin te /
analyzed: gang gi phyir gzugs la sogs pa'i chos 'di dag byis pa kun du brtags pa'i bdag nyid du rang bzhin yod pa ma yin te /
translated: Because these phenomena such as form do not exist by way of their own nature as they are imagined by the childish.

original: de bas na byang chub sems dpa' rnams de ltar tshul bzhin du zhugs na /
analyzed: de bas na byang chub sems dpa' rnams de ltar tshul bzhin du zhugs na /
translated: Therefore, when bodhisattvas engage in such a way,

analyzed: yon tan mi rtog pa'i ye shes skye bar 'gyur ro //

original: rnam par mi rtog pa'i ye shes ni theg pa chen po ste /
analyzed: rnam par mi rtog pa'i ye shes ni theg pa chen po ste /
translated: Non-conceptual wisdom is the Great Vehicle.
