analyzed: ye shes des lha dang bcas pa'i 'jig rten zil gyis mnan nas khams gsum las 'byung bar 'gyur ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that by that wisdom, having overcome the world with its gods, one goes forth from the three realms.

original: sgrub pa'i skabs bshad pa rdzogs so //
analyzed: sgrub pa'i skabs bshad pa rdzogs so //
translated: The explanation of the chapter on practice is finished.

original: bam po dang po'i 'grel pa rdzogs so /üîΩ// / sgrub pa'i skabs bshad pa'i rjes la /
analyzed: bam po dang po'i 'grel pa rdzogs so / // / sgrub pa'i skabs bshad pa'i rjes la /
translated: The commentary on the first chapter is finished.

original: de kho na'i skabs bshad pa cir 'brel ce na /
analyzed: de kho na'i skabs bshad pa cir 'brel ce na /
translated: What is the connection between the explanation of the chapter on practice and the explanation of the chapter on suchness?

original: gong du bsgrub pa'i rjes la /üîΩsrid rgyu mtha' dag zil gnon 'gro ba dang // sgrub pa 'di ni zhi ba'i mchog tu 'gro //
analyzed: gong du bsgrub pa'i rjes la / srid rgyu mtha' dag zil gnon 'gro ba dang // sgrub pa 'di ni zhi ba'i mchog tu 'gro //
translated: After the practice above,

original: zhes bya ba'i tshigs su bcad pa gcig gis byang chub sems dpa'i sgrub pa la gnas pa rnams bdag nyid chen po bzhi 'thob bo zhes bshad de /
analyzed: zhes bya ba'i tshigs su bcad pa gcig gis byang chub sems dpa'i sgrub pa la gnas pa rnams bdag nyid chen po bzhi 'thob bo zhes bshad de /
translated: in one verse, it explains that those abiding in the bodhisattva's practice attain four greatnesses:üîΩHaving overcome all causes of existence, one goes to the supreme peace of practice.

original: bdag nyid chen po bzhi po de yang sgrub pa la yang gnas la de kho na yang mthong bar 'gyur na gdod 'thob kyi /
analyzed: bdag nyid chen po bzhi po de yang sgrub pa la yang gnas la de kho na yang mthong bar 'gyur na gdod 'thob kyi /
translated: And these four great beings, who are established in practice and who see reality, will attain it.

original: sgrub pa yod kyang de kho na ma mthong ba rnams kyis ni mi 'thob bo //
analyzed: sgrub pa yod kyang de kho na ma mthong ba rnams kyis ni mi 'thob bo //
translated: But those who have practice but do not see reality will not attain it.

original: gong du bdag dang gzhan gyi don bsgrub par bya'o zhes bshad do //
analyzed: gong du bdag dang gzhan gyi don bsgrub par bya'o zhes bshad do //
translated: It was said above that one should accomplish the aims of self and other.

original: bdag dang gzhan gyi don la zhugs pa des kyang bdag nyid nyon mongs pas ma bcings par bya ste /
analyzed: bdag dang gzhan gyi don la zhugs pa des kyang bdag nyid nyon mongs pas ma bcings par bya ste /
translated: And one who is engaged in the aims of self and other should not be bound by the afflictions,

original: bdag bcings nas gzhan grol bar mi nus pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bdag bcings nas gzhan grol bar mi nus pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because one who is bound by the afflictions cannot liberate others.

original: de la nyin mongs pa las thar bar bya ba'i thabs ni de kho na mthong ba ste /
analyzed: de la nyin mongs pa las thar bar bya ba'i thabs ni de kho na mthong ba ste /
translated: The method for liberation from the afflictions is the vision of reality.

original: de bas na bsgrub pa'i skabs kyi rjes la /
analyzed: de bas na bsgrub pa'i skabs kyi rjes la /
translated: Therefore, after the section on practice,

original: nyon mongs pas mi gos pa'i thabs des /
analyzed: nyon mongs pas mi gos pa'i thabs des /
translated: the method for not being soiled by the afflictions

original: de kho na'i skabs bshad par 'brel @74a * //
analyzed: de kho na'i skabs bshad par 'brel @74a * //
translated: is explained in the section on reality.

original: lo ; / yang na dang po nyid du gtsug gi lus su gzhag pa ni rigs la gnas pa'i byang chub sems dpas byang chub tu sems bskyed nas byang chub sems dpa'i bslab pa la bslab par bya'o zhes glengs pa la byang chub sems dpa'i bslab pa gang zhe na
analyzed: lo ; / yang na dang po nyid du gtsug gi lus su gzhag pa ni rigs la gnas pa'i byang chub sems dpas byang chub tu sems bskyed nas byang chub sems dpa'i bslab pa la bslab par bya'o zhes glengs pa la byang chub sems dpa'i bslab pa gang zhe na
translated: What are the bodhisattva trainings?

original: / de'ang rnam pa gsum ste ;
analyzed: / de'ang rnam pa gsum ste ;
translated: They are also threefold:

original: gang la bslab par bya ba dang / ji ltar bslab par bya ba dang / gang gis bslab par bya ba'o //
analyzed: gang la bslab par bya ba dang / ji ltar bslab par bya ba dang / gang gis bslab par bya ba'o //
translated: what is to be trained in, how to train and by what means to train.

original: gang la bslab par bya ba rnam pa bdun te /
analyzed: gang la bslab par bya ba rnam pa bdun te /
translated: What is to be trained in is sevenfold:

original: bdag gi don sgrub pa dang / gzhan gyi don sgrub pa dang / de kho na'i don dang / mthu'i don dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos yongs su smin par bya ba dang / sems can yongs su smin par bya ba dang / bla na med pa'i byang chub bo zhes smos pa las /
analyzed: bdag gi don sgrub pa dang / gzhan gyi don sgrub pa dang / de kho na'i don dang / mthu'i don dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos yongs su smin par bya ba dang / sems can yongs su smin par bya ba dang / bla na med pa'i byang chub bo zhes smos pa las /
translated: accomplishing one's own purpose, accomplishing the purpose of others, the purpose of suchness, the purpose of power, ripening the qualities of a buddha, ripening sentient beings and unsurpassed enlightenment.

original: bdag dang gzhan gyi don sgrub pa'i 'og tu de kho na'i don smos bas na sgrub ba'i rjes la de kho na'i don bshad par 'brel to //
analyzed: bdag dang gzhan gyi don sgrub pa'i 'og tu de kho na'i don smos bas na sgrub ba'i rjes la de kho na'i don bshad par 'brel to //
translated: Since the topic of reality is mentioned after the topic of accomplishing the aims of self and other, the connection is that the topic of reality is explained after the topic of accomplishment.

original: don dam ba'i mtshan nyid kyi tshigs su bcad pa zhes bya ba la /üîΩdon dam pa rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: don dam ba'i mtshan nyid kyi tshigs su bcad pa zhes bya ba la / don dam pa rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: A verse on the definition of the ultimate.

original: de bzhin nyid chos kyi dbyings rnam par dag pa dang gnyis su med pa'i rnam par mi rtog pa'i ye shes so //
analyzed: de bzhin nyid chos kyi dbyings rnam par dag pa dang gnyis su med pa'i rnam par mi rtog pa'i ye shes so //
translated: The ultimate is twofold: the reality of thusness, the pure realm of the Dharma, and the nonconceptual intuition that is nondual with it.

original: de bzhin nyid la ci'i phyir don dam ba zhes bya zhe na /üîΩ'phags pa'i lam bsgoms pa'i 'bras bu yin bas don zhes bya la /
analyzed: de bzhin nyid la ci'i phyir don dam ba zhes bya zhe na / 'phags pa'i lam bsgoms pa'i 'bras bu yin bas don zhes bya la /
translated: Why is thusness called the ultimate?

original: chos thams cad du gyur pas dam pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: chos thams cad du gyur pas dam pa zhes bya'o //
translated: It is called the ultimate because it is the goal of the noble path, and it is called the ultimate because it is the consummation of all things.

original: yang na don dam pa zhes bya ba ni yul la bya ste /
analyzed: yang na don dam pa zhes bya ba ni yul la bya ste /
translated: Or, the ultimate is the object,

original: rnam par mi rtog pa'i ye shes dam pa'i yul yin pas don dam pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: rnam par mi rtog pa'i ye shes dam pa'i yul yin pas don dam pa zhes bya'o //
translated: because it is the object of the holy nonconceptual intuition.

original: de bzhin nyid kyi mtshan nyid kyi don dam pa'i mtshan nyid bshad pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de bzhin nyid kyi mtshan nyid kyi don dam pa'i mtshan nyid bshad pa'i phyir /
translated: To explain the definition of the ultimate in terms of thusness,

original: yod min med min de bzhin gzhan ma yin //
analyzed: yod min med min de bzhin gzhan ma yin //
translated: Not existent, not nonexistent, and not otherwise.

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
translated: And so on.

original: rnam par mi rtog pa'i ye shes gnyis su med pa'i ye shes ni phyis 'chad do //
analyzed: rnam par mi rtog pa'i ye shes gnyis su med pa'i ye shes ni phyis 'chad do //
translated: Nonconceptual wisdom and nondual wisdom will be explained later.

original: de la gnyis dang bral zhing gnyis su med pa'i don ni don dam pa'i mtshan nyid de yang gnyis su med ba rnam pa lngas don dam pa'i mtshan nyid bstan to //
analyzed: de la gnyis dang bral zhing gnyis su med pa'i don ni don dam pa'i mtshan nyid de yang gnyis su med ba rnam pa lngas don dam pa'i mtshan nyid bstan to //
translated: Therein, the characteristic of the ultimate is the meaning of freedom from duality and nonduality. That is taught as the characteristic of the ultimate through five aspects of nonduality.

original: de la don dam pa yongs su grub ba'i mtshan nyid de kun du brtags pa dang / gzhan gyi dbang gi mtshan nyid lta bur yod ba ma yin pas na yod min zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de la don dam pa yongs su grub ba'i mtshan nyid de kun du brtags pa dang / gzhan gyi dbang gi mtshan nyid lta bur yod ba ma yin pas na yod min zhes bya'o //
translated: Therein, the characteristic of the ultimate, which is the perfected, does not exist like the characteristic of the imagined and the dependent, and thus it is said to be ‚Äúnot existent.‚Äù

original: don dam pa de yongs su grub pa'i ngo bo ni med pa ma yin pas na med min zhes bya'o //
analyzed: don dam pa de yongs su grub pa'i ngo bo ni med pa ma yin pas na med min zhes bya'o //
translated: The ultimate, which is the nature of the perfected, is not nonexistent, and thus it is said to be ‚Äúnot nonexistent.‚Äù

original: 'dis ni gnyis su med ba'i don gcig bstan to //
analyzed: 'dis ni gnyis su med ba'i don gcig bstan to //
translated: This teaches the meaning of nonduality as one.

original: de bzhin gzhan ma yin zhes bya bar sbyar @74b te ;
analyzed: de bzhin gzhan ma yin zhes bya bar sbyar @74b te ;
translated: ‚ÄúAnd not otherwise‚Äù is to be supplied.

original: gcig pa ma yin bas de bzhin ma yin la /
analyzed: gcig pa ma yin bas de bzhin ma yin la /
translated: It is not the same, and thus it is not thus.

original: tha dad pa ma yin pas gzhan med pa'o //
analyzed: tha dad pa ma yin pas gzhan med pa'o //
translated: Since they are not different, there is no other.

original: de la yongs su grub pa dang / kun brtags dang gzhan gyi dbang du mtshan nyid gcig pa ma yin bas de bzhin ma yin pa zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: de la yongs su grub pa dang / kun brtags dang gzhan gyi dbang du mtshan nyid gcig pa ma yin bas de bzhin ma yin pa zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: Since the perfected nature and the imagined and dependent natures are not the same in character, they are not the same.

original: ji ltar zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar zhe na /
translated: How so?

original: yongs su brtags pa'i rang bzhin ni yod pa ma yin pa phyin ci log tu snang ba yin la /
analyzed: yongs su brtags pa'i rang bzhin ni yod pa ma yin pa phyin ci log tu snang ba yin la /
translated: The imagined nature is a non existent error that appears.

original: yongs su grub pa'i rang bzhin ni bden pa yang dag pa phyin ci ma log pa yin pas kun brtags dang rang bzhin gcig pa ma yin no //
analyzed: yongs su grub pa'i rang bzhin ni bden pa yang dag pa phyin ci ma log pa yin pas kun brtags dang rang bzhin gcig pa ma yin no //
translated: The perfected nature is a true reality that is not an error, so the imagined and perfected natures are not the same.

original: gzhan gyi dbang gi rang bzhin yang kun brtags kyi chos kyi rten du gyur pa ste /
analyzed: gzhan gyi dbang gi rang bzhin yang kun brtags kyi chos kyi rten du gyur pa ste /
translated: The dependent nature is the basis of the imagined nature.

original: rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba'i kun nas nyon mongs pa'i ngo bo yin la yongs su grub ba kun brtags kyi chos kyi rten du ma gyur la /
analyzed: rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba'i kun nas nyon mongs pa'i ngo bo yin la yongs su grub ba kun brtags kyi chos kyi rten du ma gyur la /
translated: It is the reality of the dependent origination of the afflictions, but the perfected nature is not the basis of the imagined nature.

original: rten 'brel te byung ba ma yin pa rnam par byang ba'i chos yin bas gzhan dbang dang yang rang bzhin gcig pa ma yin no //
analyzed: rten 'brel te byung ba ma yin pa rnam par byang ba'i chos yin bas gzhan dbang dang yang rang bzhin gcig pa ma yin no //
translated: It is not the same nature as the relative because it is a phenomenon of purification, which is not a dependent origination.

original: kun du brtags pa dang / gzhan gyi dbang gnyis dang yongs su grub pa tha dad pa yang ma yin pas na gzhan ma yin pa zhes bya ste /
analyzed: kun du brtags pa dang / gzhan gyi dbang gnyis dang yongs su grub pa tha dad pa yang ma yin pas na gzhan ma yin pa zhes bya ste /
translated: It is not different from the imagined and the relative, and therefore it is said to be non-different.

original: ji ltar zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar zhe na /
translated: How is that?

original: gzhan gyi dbang gi rang bzhin la gzung 'dzin du kun du brtags pa dang bral ba nyid la yongs su grub pa'i rang bzhin zhes bya bar zad kyi de la ma gtogs par yongs su grub ba'i rang bzhin logs shig na med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gzhan gyi dbang gi rang bzhin la gzung 'dzin du kun du brtags pa dang bral ba nyid la yongs su grub pa'i rang bzhin zhes bya bar zad kyi de la ma gtogs par yongs su grub ba'i rang bzhin logs shig na med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The very freedom from the imagined, the subject-object dichotomy, in the nature of the relative is called the nature of the fulfilled. Apart from that, there is no fulfilled nature existing separately.

original: de'i dpe ni 'dus byas dang / 'dus ma byas kyi mtshan nyid mi rtag pa la sogs pa bzhin te /
analyzed: de'i dpe ni 'dus byas dang / 'dus ma byas kyi mtshan nyid mi rtag pa la sogs pa bzhin te /
translated: An example is impermanence, etc., the characteristic of the conditioned.

original: gal te 'dus byas dang mi rtag pa gcig tu gyur na ni mi rtag pa bzhin du 'dus byas rtag tu zhi bas mi snang ba'i skyon du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gal te 'dus byas dang mi rtag pa gcig tu gyur na ni mi rtag pa bzhin du 'dus byas rtag tu zhi bas mi snang ba'i skyon du 'gyur ro //
translated: If the conditioned and impermanence were one, then, like impermanence, the conditioned would not appear, because it would be always at peace.

original: gal te 'dus byas dang mi rtag pa tha dad par gyur na ni mi rtag ba logs shig tu 'dus byas la mi rtag pa med pa'i phyir 'dus byas la mi rtag par 'gyur ba bzhin te /
analyzed: gal te 'dus byas dang mi rtag pa tha dad par gyur na ni mi rtag ba logs shig tu 'dus byas la mi rtag pa med pa'i phyir 'dus byas la mi rtag par 'gyur ba bzhin te /
translated: If the conditioned and impermanence were different, then, like impermanence, the conditioned would not be impermanent, because impermanence would not exist in the conditioned.

original: 'di ni gnyis su med pa'i don gnyis pa'o //
analyzed: 'di ni gnyis su med pa'i don gnyis pa'o //
translated: This is the second meaning of nonduality.üîΩIt does not arise and does not cease.

original: mi skye mi 'jig ces bya ba la yongs su grub ba de las dang nyon mongs pa'i rgyu rkyen gyis ma skyed pas na mi skye'o //
analyzed: mi skye mi 'jig ces bya ba la yongs su grub ba de las dang nyon mongs pa'i rgyu rkyen gyis ma skyed pas na mi skye'o //
translated: The perfected does not arise because it is not produced by the causes and conditions of karma and afflictions.

original: ma skyes pa'i chos la 'gag pa med bas na mi 'jig pa ste 'dus ma byas kyi rang bzhin te zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: ma skyes pa'i chos la 'gag pa med bas na mi 'jig pa ste 'dus ma byas kyi rang bzhin te zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: Since there is no cessation of unarisen phenomena, it does not cease. This means it has the nature of the unconditioned.

original: 'di ni gnyis su med pa'i don gsum pa'o //üîΩ'bri bar mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: 'di ni gnyis su med pa'i don gsum pa'o // 'bri bar mi 'gyur te /
translated: This is the third meaning of nonduality.

original: 'phel ba med cing zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: 'phel ba med cing zhes bya ba la /
translated: It does not diminish and does not increase.

original: 'khor ba'i dus dang mya ngan las 'das pa'i @75a * //üîΩdus na yang yongs su grub pa de la 'bri ba yang med /
analyzed: 'khor ba'i dus dang mya ngan las 'das pa'i @75a * // dus na yang yongs su grub pa de la 'bri ba yang med /
translated: At the time of cyclic existence and at the time of nirvana,

original: 'phel ba yang med de nam mkha' bzhin no //
analyzed: 'phel ba yang med de nam mkha' bzhin no //
translated: that perfected nature is neither diminished nor increased, like space.üîΩFor example, even though clouds and so on in the sky diminish, the sky is not diminished, and even when clouds and so on that did not exist before arise in the sky, the sky is not newly created.

original: dper na nam mkha' la gnas pa'i sprin la sogs ba bri bar gyur kyang nam mkha' la bri ba med ba dang / nam mkha' la sngon med pa'i sprin la sogs pa byung na yang nam mkha' gsar du byung ba med pa de bzhin du 'phags pa'i lam bsgom pa'i dus na 'khor ba'i chos nyon mongs pa bri yang stong pa nyid la bri ba med de /
analyzed: dper na nam mkha' la gnas pa'i sprin la sogs ba bri bar gyur kyang nam mkha' la bri ba med ba dang / nam mkha' la sngon med pa'i sprin la sogs pa byung na yang nam mkha' gsar du byung ba med pa de bzhin du 'phags pa'i lam bsgom pa'i dus na 'khor ba'i chos nyon mongs pa bri yang stong pa nyid la bri ba med de /
translated: Similarly, when the phenomena of cyclic existence, the afflictions, diminish at the time of cultivating the noble path, emptiness is not diminished.

original: rnam par byang ba'i phyogs byang chub kyi phyogs 'phel na yang stong pa nyid la 'phel pa med de 'di ni gnyis su med pa'i don bzhi pa'o ;
analyzed: rnam par byang ba'i phyogs byang chub kyi phyogs 'phel na yang stong pa nyid la 'phel pa med de 'di ni gnyis su med pa'i don bzhi pa'o ;
translated: And when the factors of enlightenment, the factors of complete purification, increase, emptiness is not increased. This is the fourth meaning of nonduality.

original: / rnam par dag pa med la rnam par dag 'gyur ba //üîΩzhes bya ba la /
analyzed: / rnam par dag pa med la rnam par dag 'gyur ba // zhes bya ba la /
translated: There is no purification and yet there is purification.

original: don dam pa stong pa nyid do //
analyzed: don dam pa stong pa nyid do //
translated: This is ultimate emptiness.

original: de ni nam mkha' dang gser dang chu'i khams dang shel la sogs pa rang bzhin gyis dag ba bzhin du stong pa nyid kyi rang bzhin gyis dag pa ste /
analyzed: de ni nam mkha' dang gser dang chu'i khams dang shel la sogs pa rang bzhin gyis dag ba bzhin du stong pa nyid kyi rang bzhin gyis dag pa ste /
translated: It is pure by its nature of emptiness, like space, gold, the element of water, crystal, and so on, which are pure by nature.

original: nam mkha'i rang bzhin gyis dag pa la chu la sogs pas bkrus te dag par byar med pa bzhin du /
analyzed: nam mkha'i rang bzhin gyis dag pa la chu la sogs pas bkrus te dag par byar med pa bzhin du /
translated: Just as the nature of space is pure and cannot be purified by water and so on,

original: stong pa nyid kyi rang bzhin la yang dri ma dag par byar med bas rnam par dag pa med pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: stong pa nyid kyi rang bzhin la yang dri ma dag par byar med bas rnam par dag pa med pa zhes bya'o //
translated: in the same way, in emptiness, which is by nature pure, there is nothing to be purified, and so it is said that there is no purification.

original: rang bzhin la dri ma bsal du med kyang dper na nam mkha' la glo bur gyi sprin bsal ba dang / gser la glo bur gyis rdo bsal ba bzhin du stong pa nyid la nyon mongs ba'i sgrib pa dang / shes bya'i sgrib pa dri ma glo bur yod pa bsal bar mi bya ba yang ma yin te /
analyzed: rang bzhin la dri ma bsal du med kyang dper na nam mkha' la glo bur gyi sprin bsal ba dang / gser la glo bur gyis rdo bsal ba bzhin du stong pa nyid la nyon mongs ba'i sgrib pa dang / shes bya'i sgrib pa dri ma glo bur yod pa bsal bar mi bya ba yang ma yin te /
translated: Although there is nothing to be removed from the nature, just as clouds are removed from the sky and stones are removed from gold, it is not the case that the stains of defilement-related and cognitive obscurations, which are adventitious to emptiness, cannot be removed.

original: bsal zhing dag par bya dgos bar rnam par dag par 'gyur ba zhes kyang bya ste /
analyzed: bsal zhing dag par bya dgos bar rnam par dag par 'gyur ba zhes kyang bya ste /
translated: And since they must be removed and purified, it is also said that there is purification.

original: 'di ni gnyis su med pa'i don lnga ba'o //
analyzed: 'di ni gnyis su med pa'i don lnga ba'o //
translated: This is the fifth meaning of non-duality.

original: de ni don mtshan zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: de ni don mtshan zhes bya ba la /
translated: That is the characteristic of the ultimate.

original: gnyis su med pa'i mtshan nyid lnga po de ni don dam pa'i mtshan nyid yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: gnyis su med pa'i mtshan nyid lnga po de ni don dam pa'i mtshan nyid yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The five characteristics of non-duality are the characteristic of the ultimate. This is the meaning.üîΩIn order to refute the error of the view of self, he says: The view of self and the view of what belongs to a self are errors.

original: bdag tu lta ba'i phyin ci log dgag ba'i phyir tshigs su bcad pa zhes bya ba la du ma dang mi rtag pa'i mtshan nyid phung po lnga la bdag gir lta ba'i 'jig tshogs su lta ba la bdag gir lta ba'i zhes bya ste ;
analyzed: bdag tu lta ba'i phyin ci log dgag ba'i phyir tshigs su bcad pa zhes bya ba la du ma dang mi rtag pa'i mtshan nyid phung po lnga la bdag gir lta ba'i 'jig tshogs su lta ba la bdag gir lta ba'i zhes bya ste ;
translated: The view of the aggregates as mine, the view of the perishable collection, which has the five aggregates as its object, characterized by multiplicity and impermanence, is the view of what belongs to a self.

original: bdag dang bdag gi med pa la bdag dang bdag gir lta bas na phyin ci log go //
analyzed: bdag dang bdag gi med pa la bdag dang bdag gir lta bas na phyin ci log go //
translated: The view of self and what belongs to a self is an error because it views what is non-existent as existent.

original: phyin ci log de skyon yin pas spang dgos bar bstan pa'i phyir tshigs su bcad pa rtsom mo zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: phyin ci log de skyon yin pas spang dgos bar bstan pa'i phyir tshigs su bcad pa rtsom mo zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: In order to show that this error must be abandoned because it is a fault, he composes the verse.

original: don dam pa bshad pa'i skabs su bdag tu lta ba phyin ci log bshad pa'i skabs @75b ma yin no bdag tu lta ba skabs 'dir bshad pa cir 'brel zhe na /
analyzed: don dam pa bshad pa'i skabs su bdag tu lta ba phyin ci log bshad pa'i skabs @75b ma yin no bdag tu lta ba skabs 'dir bshad pa cir 'brel zhe na /
translated: What is the connection between the explanation of the view of self and the present context?

original: don dam pa zhes bya ba ni gang zag la bdag med pa'i stong pa nyid chos la bdag med ba'i stong pa nyid la bya'o //
analyzed: don dam pa zhes bya ba ni gang zag la bdag med pa'i stong pa nyid chos la bdag med ba'i stong pa nyid la bya'o //
translated: The so-called ultimate is the emptiness of the selflessness of persons and the emptiness of the selflessness of phenomena.

original: de la bdag tu lta ba ni gang zag la bdag med pa'i stong ba nyid du mi mthun pa ste /
analyzed: de la bdag tu lta ba ni gang zag la bdag med pa'i stong ba nyid du mi mthun pa ste /
translated: The view of self is incompatible with the emptiness of the selflessness of persons.

original: de bas na ji tsam bdag tu lta ba yod pa de tsam du gang zag la bdag med pa ma rtogs pas /
analyzed: de bas na ji tsam bdag tu lta ba yod pa de tsam du gang zag la bdag med pa ma rtogs pas /
translated: Therefore, as long as the view of self exists, the selflessness of persons is not realized.

original: gang zag bdag med par rtogs par 'dod bas bdag tu 'dod pa spongs shig ces bstan pa dang / gang zag la bdag med pa'i don gtan la dbab pa'i phyir /
analyzed: gang zag bdag med par rtogs par 'dod bas bdag tu 'dod pa spongs shig ces bstan pa dang / gang zag la bdag med pa'i don gtan la dbab pa'i phyir /
translated: Thus, in order to teach that those who wish to realize the selflessness of persons should abandon the view of self, and in order to ascertain the meaning of the selflessness of persons,

original: 'dir bdag tu lta ba'i skabs bshad par 'brel to ;
analyzed: 'dir bdag tu lta ba'i skabs bshad par 'brel to ;
translated: the present context of the view of self is explained.

original: / mu stegs can rnams bdag tu lta ba yang yang na ni bdag yod do zhes de ltar sems pa'i 'jig tshogs la lta ba nyid rang bdag gi rang bzhin yin grang /
analyzed: / mu stegs can rnams bdag tu lta ba yang yang na ni bdag yod do zhes de ltar sems pa'i 'jig tshogs la lta ba nyid rang bdag gi rang bzhin yin grang /
translated: The tƒ´rthikas‚Äô view of self is either that the self exists or that it does not exist. The view of the transitory collection is the nature of the self.üîΩ

original: yang na 'jig tshogs la lta ba'i gnas nye bar len pa'i phung po lnga po bdag gi rang bzhin yin grang /
analyzed: yang na 'jig tshogs la lta ba'i gnas nye bar len pa'i phung po lnga po bdag gi rang bzhin yin grang /
translated: The tƒ´rthikas‚Äô view of self is either the view that the self exists, or the view that the self is the nature of the five appropriated aggregates that are the basis of the view of the transitory collection.

original: yang na de gnyis la ma gtogs par bdag bya ba zhig logs shig na yod par brtag grang na /
analyzed: yang na de gnyis la ma gtogs par bdag bya ba zhig logs shig na yod par brtag grang na /
translated: Or else, the self is something that is not included in either of those two.

original: de gsum char ltar mi rigs pas gang zag la bdag med do //
analyzed: de gsum char ltar mi rigs pas gang zag la bdag med do //
translated: Since all three of those are illogical, the person is without self.

original: de la bdag tu lta ba'i rang nyid bdag gi rang bzhin yin par mi rigs par bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de la bdag tu lta ba'i rang nyid bdag gi rang bzhin yin par mi rigs par bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: To demonstrate that it is illogical for the view of self to be the nature of the self, it is said:

original: bdag tu lta ba rang nyid bdag mtshan min //üîΩzhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: bdag tu lta ba rang nyid bdag mtshan min // zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: The view of self is not the defining characteristic of the self.

original: bdag tu lta ba'i sgras ni 'jig tshogs la lta ba la bya ste /
analyzed: bdag tu lta ba'i sgras ni 'jig tshogs la lta ba la bya ste /
translated: The term ‚Äúview of self‚Äù refers to the view of the transitory collection.

original: 'jig tshogs la lha ba de nyid mu stegs can gyis brtags pa'i bdag rtag pa'i mtshan nyid ma yin te /
analyzed: 'jig tshogs la lha ba de nyid mu stegs can gyis brtags pa'i bdag rtag pa'i mtshan nyid ma yin te /
translated: That view of the perishable constituents is not the definition of the self imagined by the heterodox.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: de yi mtshan nyid mi 'dra phyir //üîΩzhes bya ba smos so //
analyzed: de yi mtshan nyid mi 'dra phyir // zhes bya ba smos so //
translated: Because their definitions are not similar.

original: 'di ltar 'jig tshogs la lta ba'i mtshan nyid kyang gzhan mu stegs can gyis brtags ba'i bdag nyid de'i mtshan nyid kyang gzhan te /
analyzed: 'di ltar 'jig tshogs la lta ba'i mtshan nyid kyang gzhan mu stegs can gyis brtags ba'i bdag nyid de'i mtshan nyid kyang gzhan te /
translated: Thus, the definition of the view of the perishable constituents is one thing, and the definition of the self imagined by the heterodox is another.

original: de gnyis mtshan nyid mi 'dra bas na 'jig tshogs la lta ba nyid bdag gi mtshan nyid ma yin no //
analyzed: de gnyis mtshan nyid mi 'dra bas na 'jig tshogs la lta ba nyid bdag gi mtshan nyid ma yin no //
translated: Since those two are not similar in their definitions, the view of the perishable constituents is not the definition of the self.

original: ji ltar mtshan nyid mi 'dra ba zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar mtshan nyid mi 'dra ba zhe na /
translated: How are their definitions not similar?

original: mu stegs pas ni bdag de 'dus ma byas pa dang / rtag pa dang khyab pa dang / las mi byed pa'i mtshan nyid du brtags so //
analyzed: mu stegs pas ni bdag de 'dus ma byas pa dang / rtag pa dang khyab pa dang / las mi byed pa'i mtshan nyid du brtags so //
translated: The heterodox imagine that self to be unconditioned, permanent, all-pervading, and inactive.

original: 'jig tshogs la lta ba ni sems kyi chos yin te /
analyzed: 'jig tshogs la lta ba ni sems kyi chos yin te /
translated: The view of the perishable constituents is a mental phenomenon.

original: sems ni 'dus byas dang mi rtag pa dang / ma khyab pa dang las rnam pa gsum byed pa yin pas mtshan nyid mi 'dra'o //üîΩ'jig tshogs @76a * //
analyzed: sems ni 'dus byas dang mi rtag pa dang / ma khyab pa dang las rnam pa gsum byed pa yin pas mtshan nyid mi 'dra'o // 'jig tshogs @76a * //
translated: The mind is not the self because it is conditioned, impermanent, and does not pervade all of the aggregates, and because it performs the three kinds of actions.

original: la lta ba'i rten du gyur pa phung po lnga yang bdag gi mtshan nyid du gyur pa mi rigs par bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: la lta ba'i rten du gyur pa phung po lnga yang bdag gi mtshan nyid du gyur pa mi rigs par bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: The five aggregates, which are the basis of the view of the transitory aggregates, cannot be the self because they have different characteristics.üîΩTo demonstrate this, he says,

original: ngan pa'i gnas min zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: ngan pa'i gnas min zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: ‚ÄúThey are not the basis of negative conditioning.‚Äù

original: ngan pa'i sgras ni 'jig tshogs la lta ba la snyegs te /
analyzed: ngan pa'i sgras ni 'jig tshogs la lta ba la snyegs te /
translated: The word ‚Äúnegative‚Äù refers to the view of the transitory aggregates.

original: phung po lnga po 'di 'jig tshogs su lta ba 'di rten du gyur pa dang / nyon mongs pa'i gnas ngan len gyis bskyed pas na ngan pa'i gnas zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: phung po lnga po 'di 'jig tshogs su lta ba 'di rten du gyur pa dang / nyon mongs pa'i gnas ngan len gyis bskyed pas na ngan pa'i gnas zhes bya ba ste /
translated: The five aggregates are called ‚Äúthe basis of negative conditioning‚Äù because they are the basis of the view of the transitory aggregates and because they are produced by the negative conditioning of the afflictions.

original: ngan pa'i gnas kyi phung po lnga yang bdag gi mtshan nyid ma yin no //
analyzed: ngan pa'i gnas kyi phung po lnga yang bdag gi mtshan nyid ma yin no //
translated: The five aggregates, which are the basis of negative conditioning, cannot be the self.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why not?

original: de'i phyir mtshan nyid mi 'dra ba'i phyir zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: de'i phyir mtshan nyid mi 'dra ba'i phyir zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: He says, ‚Äúbecause they have different characteristics.‚Äù

original: mu stegs pas brtags pa'i mtshan nyid kyang gzhan phung po lnga'i mtshan nyid kyang gzhan te /
analyzed: mu stegs pas brtags pa'i mtshan nyid kyang gzhan phung po lnga'i mtshan nyid kyang gzhan te /
translated: The characteristics imputed by the tƒ´rthikas are also different, and the characteristics of the five aggregates are also different.

original: mtshan nyid mi 'dra bas na phung po lnga nyid bdag ma yin no //
analyzed: mtshan nyid mi 'dra bas na phung po lnga nyid bdag ma yin no //
translated: Since the characteristics are not the same, the five aggregates themselves are not the self.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: bdag ni 'dus ma byas pa dang / rtag pa dang khyab pa dang / las mi byed par 'dod la /
analyzed: bdag ni 'dus ma byas pa dang / rtag pa dang khyab pa dang / las mi byed par 'dod la /
translated: The self is asserted to be unconditioned, permanent, pervasive, and inactive.

original: phung po lnga ni 'dus byas dang / mi rtag pa dang / ma khyab pa dang ; las byed pa yin pas mtshan nyid mi 'dra'o //
analyzed: phung po lnga ni 'dus byas dang / mi rtag pa dang / ma khyab pa dang ; las byed pa yin pas mtshan nyid mi 'dra'o //
translated: The five aggregates are conditioned, impermanent, not pervasive, and active. Therefore, the characteristics are not the same.

original: de nyid ma gtogs par bdag logs na yod par yang mi rigs par bstan pa'i phyir gnyis ma yin zhes smos te /
analyzed: de nyid ma gtogs par bdag logs na yod par yang mi rigs par bstan pa'i phyir gnyis ma yin zhes smos te /
translated: In order to teach that it is illogical for the self to exist separately, apart from those, it says, ‚ÄúIt is not a duality.‚Äù

original: 'jig tshogs la lta ba dang / phung po lnga las ma gtogs par bdag bya ba de logs shig na yod pa yang ma yin te ;
analyzed: 'jig tshogs la lta ba dang / phung po lnga las ma gtogs par bdag bya ba de logs shig na yod pa yang ma yin te ;
translated: Apart from the view of the transitory collection and the five aggregates, the self is not something that exists separately.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: mngon sum gyi tshad ma'i yul du yang ma gyur /
analyzed: mngon sum gyi tshad ma'i yul du yang ma gyur /
translated: It is not an object of direct valid knowledge.

original: rjes su dpag pa'i tshad ma'i yul du yang ma gyur pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rjes su dpag pa'i tshad ma'i yul du yang ma gyur pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is not the object of inference either.

original: 'di ltar dngos po yod pa rnams ni yang na mngon sum gyi tshad ma'i yul du 'gyur te gzugs la sogs pa yin no //
analyzed: 'di ltar dngos po yod pa rnams ni yang na mngon sum gyi tshad ma'i yul du 'gyur te gzugs la sogs pa yin no //
translated: Thus, existent things are either the object of direct perception, like form, etc.,

original: yang na rjes su dpag pa'i tshad ma'i yul du 'gyur te /
analyzed: yang na rjes su dpag pa'i tshad ma'i yul du 'gyur te /
translated: or they are the object of inference.

original: dper na mig gi dbang po bltar mi snang yang /
analyzed: dper na mig gi dbang po bltar mi snang yang /
translated: For example, the eye faculty is not seen,üîΩbut the eye faculty is inferred from the fact that it is the cause of the arising of visual consciousness.

original: mig gi rnam par shes pa skyed pa'i rgyu byed pa'i sgo nas mig gi dbang po yod par brtags na bdag 'di ni tshad ma gnyi gas brtags na yang yod par ma mthong bas na logs shig na med do //
analyzed: mig gi rnam par shes pa skyed pa'i rgyu byed pa'i sgo nas mig gi dbang po yod par brtags na bdag 'di ni tshad ma gnyi gas brtags na yang yod par ma mthong bas na logs shig na med do //
translated: But this self is not seen to exist when examined by either of the two valid cognitions, so it does not exist separately.

original: gal te bdag med na /
analyzed: gal te bdag med na /
translated: If there is no self,

original: ci'i phyir sems can rnams bdag bdag ces rtog snyam pa la de'i phyir /
analyzed: ci'i phyir sems can rnams bdag bdag ces rtog snyam pa la de'i phyir /
translated: why do sentient beings conceive of a self?

original: 'di ni nor tsam skyes zhes smos te /
analyzed: 'di ni nor tsam skyes zhes smos te /
translated: To answer that, he says, ‚ÄúThis is merely an error that arises. . . . ‚Äù

original: dper na thag pa la sprul du 'khrul pa'i thag pa de yod pa ma yin gyi sprul lta bur nor par mthong ba dang / rmi lam na gzugs rnam pa sna tshogs mthong ba yod pa ma @76b yin gyi nor bar mthong ba de bzhin du /
analyzed: dper na thag pa la sprul du 'khrul pa'i thag pa de yod pa ma yin gyi sprul lta bur nor par mthong ba dang / rmi lam na gzugs rnam pa sna tshogs mthong ba yod pa ma @76b yin gyi nor bar mthong ba de bzhin du /
translated: For example, the rope that is mistaken for a snake does not exist, and one sees that it is a mistake to have seen it as a snake, and in a dream, the various forms that are seen do not exist, and one sees that they are mistakes.

original: bdag bdag ces rtog pa 'di yang phyin ci log dang / 'khrul pa'i sems skyed par zad kyi dngos po yod pa'i rtog pa ni ma yin pa'i don to //
analyzed: bdag bdag ces rtog pa 'di yang phyin ci log dang / 'khrul pa'i sems skyed par zad kyi dngos po yod pa'i rtog pa ni ma yin pa'i don to //
translated: In the same way, this conception of ‚ÄúI‚Äù and ‚Äúmine‚Äù is nothing but the generation of a mistaken and deluded mind, and it does not mean that there is a conception of an existent thing.

original: 'di ltar bdag yod pa ni bdag tu nyon mongs pas bcings par gyur la /
analyzed: 'di ltar bdag yod pa ni bdag tu nyon mongs pas bcings par gyur la /
translated: Thus, if the self existed, one would be bound by the afflictions with respect to the self.

original: nyon mongs pa'i bcings pa bcad na thar par 'gyur ba yin na /
analyzed: nyon mongs pa'i bcings pa bcad na thar par 'gyur ba yin na /
translated: If the bonds of the afflictions were severed, one would be liberated.üîΩBut if there is no self, who would be liberated?

original: bdag med na su zhig thar par 'gyur snyam pa la de'i phyir /
analyzed: bdag med na su zhig thar par 'gyur snyam pa la de'i phyir /
translated: Therefore it is said:

original: thar pa nor tsam zad pa'o //üîΩzhes smos te /
analyzed: thar pa nor tsam zad pa'o // zhes smos te /
translated: Liberation is the exhaustion of the mere error.

original: dper na thag pa la sprul du 'khrul pa de sprul gyi 'khrul pa dang bral te /
analyzed: dper na thag pa la sprul du 'khrul pa de sprul gyi 'khrul pa dang bral te /
translated: For example, when one is mistaken about a rope and thinks it is a snake, one becomes free from the error of thinking that the rope is a snake.

original: thag par shes par gyur pa na lus bde ba dang / sems bde ba thob par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: thag par shes par gyur pa na lus bde ba dang / sems bde ba thob par 'gyur ro //
translated: When one understands that it is a rope, one obtains physical and mental well-being.

original: de bzhin du bdag med pa la bdag tu 'khrul pa zad de /
analyzed: de bzhin du bdag med pa la bdag tu 'khrul pa zad de /
translated: In the same way, the error of self in regard to the non-self is exhausted.

original: de spangs pa nyid thar pa dang mya ngan las 'das pa zhes bya bar zad kyi thar pa thob par byed pa'i bdag ni gang yang yod pa ma yin no zhes ston te /
analyzed: de spangs pa nyid thar pa dang mya ngan las 'das pa zhes bya bar zad kyi thar pa thob par byed pa'i bdag ni gang yang yod pa ma yin no zhes ston te /
translated: The mere abandonment of that is called liberation and nirvƒÅ·πáa. There is no self at all that obtains liberation.

original: de bas na tsam gyi sgras ni bdag yod pa yin pa 'gog go //
analyzed: de bas na tsam gyi sgras ni bdag yod pa yin pa 'gog go //
translated: Thus, the word ‚Äúmere‚Äù refutes the existence of a self.

original: phyin ci log kun tu smad pa'i tshigs su bcad pa gnyis so zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: phyin ci log kun tu smad pa'i tshigs su bcad pa gnyis so zhes bya ba la /
translated: Two verses on the condemnation of error.

original: ji tsam du sems can spyod cing gnas pa thams cad phyin ci log yin la /
analyzed: ji tsam du sems can spyod cing gnas pa thams cad phyin ci log yin la /
translated: To the extent that all the conduct and behavior of sentient beings is erroneous,

original: phyin ci log gi rgyus ni skye ba dang rga ba la sogs pa'i sdug bsngal rtag tu myong ste /
analyzed: phyin ci log gi rgyus ni skye ba dang rga ba la sogs pa'i sdug bsngal rtag tu myong ste /
translated: they experience the suffering of birth, aging, etc., constantly, by the power of error.

original: de ltar sems can rnams 'khrul pa la yang gnas sdug bsngal ba yang yin na 'khrul pa la gnas pa dang / sdug bsngal yin par ci'i phyir ma rtogs she na /
analyzed: de ltar sems can rnams 'khrul pa la yang gnas sdug bsngal ba yang yin na 'khrul pa la gnas pa dang / sdug bsngal yin par ci'i phyir ma rtogs she na /
translated: Thus, sentient beings are deluded and also miserable. But why do they not understand that they are deluded and miserable?

original: phyin ci log la gnas pa dang / ma rig pas khebs pas ma rtogs te /
analyzed: phyin ci log la gnas pa dang / ma rig pas khebs pas ma rtogs te /
translated: They do not understand because they are deluded and because they are obscured by nescience.

original: de bas na phyin ci log la smad pa'i phyir tshigs su bcad pa gnyis rtsom mo zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: de bas na phyin ci log la smad pa'i phyir tshigs su bcad pa gnyis rtsom mo zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: Therefore, the two verses are composed in order to condemn delusion.

original: 'khrul tsam gnas zhing rang bzhin sdug bsngal ba /
analyzed: 'khrul tsam gnas zhing rang bzhin sdug bsngal ba /
translated: They are deluded and miserable by nature,

original: skyo bos rtag 'khrul ci phyir rtogs ma gyur //
analyzed: skyo bos rtag 'khrul ci phyir rtogs ma gyur //
translated: and always deluded, but the miserable do not understand.

original: zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la /
translated: Here,

original: 'jig rten pa dag bdag yod do zhes bdag tu yod pa dang / chos yod do zhes rtogs pa yod pa yang nor ba yin pas na 'khrul pa tsam la gnas pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: 'jig rten pa dag bdag yod do zhes bdag tu yod pa dang / chos yod do zhes rtogs pa yod pa yang nor ba yin pas na 'khrul pa tsam la gnas pa zhes bya'o //
translated: the world, saying ‚ÄúI exist‚Äù and ‚Äúthings exist,‚Äù is deluded and has a false understanding. Therefore, it is said that they ‚Äúabide in mere delusion.‚Äù

original: de'i rgyus skye ba dang rga ba la sogs pa'i sdug bsngal rnam pa sna tshogs 'byung bas na rang bzhin gyis sdug bsngal ba zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de'i rgyus skye ba dang rga ba la sogs pa'i sdug bsngal rnam pa sna tshogs 'byung bas na rang bzhin gyis sdug bsngal ba zhes bya'o //
translated: Because of that, the various kinds of suffering such as birth and old age arise, so it is called ‚Äúnaturally suffering.‚Äù

original: de ltar skye bo rnams ni rtag tu 'khrul pa la yang gnas la sdug bsngal ba yang yin la de 'dra ba'i mtshan nyid du @77a * //
analyzed: de ltar skye bo rnams ni rtag tu 'khrul pa la yang gnas la sdug bsngal ba yang yin la de 'dra ba'i mtshan nyid du @77a * //
translated: Thus, beings always abide in error and are also suffering.

original: ci'i phyir rtogs par ma gyur ce na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir rtogs par ma gyur ce na /
translated: Why have they not realized such a characteristic?

original: 'og nas 'byung ba'i tshul du mun pa chen pos khebs par ma gyur to zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: 'og nas 'byung ba'i tshul du mun pa chen pos khebs par ma gyur to zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: It means that they have not been covered by the great darkness that will be explained below.

original: rig pa med cing zhes bya ba la dngos po 'di dag 'khrul pa yin pa dang / sdug bsngal yin par khong du chud pa'i yang dag pa'i ye shes zag pa med pa'i rang bzhin med pas na /
analyzed: rig pa med cing zhes bya ba la dngos po 'di dag 'khrul pa yin pa dang / sdug bsngal yin par khong du chud pa'i yang dag pa'i ye shes zag pa med pa'i rang bzhin med pas na /
translated: As for ‚Äúlacking awareness,‚Äù since they lack the uncontaminated nature of the correct wisdom that comprehends that these things are error and suffering,

original: rig pa med ba zhes bya'o //
analyzed: rig pa med ba zhes bya'o //
translated: they are said to ‚Äúlack awareness.‚Äù

original: rig nyid ces bya ba la yang dag pa'i ye shes kyi rig bas kyang zag pa dang bcas pa'i shes pas tshor ba bde ba dang sdug bsngal ba dang / bde ba yang ma yin sdug bsngal ba yang ma yin pa myong ba yod pas rig pa yod ces bya'o //
analyzed: rig nyid ces bya ba la yang dag pa'i ye shes kyi rig bas kyang zag pa dang bcas pa'i shes pas tshor ba bde ba dang sdug bsngal ba dang / bde ba yang ma yin sdug bsngal ba yang ma yin pa myong ba yod pas rig pa yod ces bya'o //
translated: ‚ÄúAwareness‚Äù means that, because of the awareness of authentic pristine consciousness, there is the experience of contaminated consciousness, which is the feeling of pleasure, pain, and neither pleasure nor pain.

original: sdug bsngal nyid ces bya ba la /üîΩtshor ba rnam pa gsum myong yang gsum char yang sdug bsngal ba'i mtshan nyid yin te /
analyzed: sdug bsngal nyid ces bya ba la / tshor ba rnam pa gsum myong yang gsum char yang sdug bsngal ba'i mtshan nyid yin te /
translated: ‚ÄúSuffering‚Äù meansüîΩthat although the three types of feeling are experienced, all three are characterized by suffering.

original: tshor ba gsum char la yang sdug bsngal gyi rang bzhin spangs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: tshor ba gsum char la yang sdug bsngal gyi rang bzhin spangs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The nature of the three feelings is not abandoned.

original: ji ltar zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar zhe na /
translated: How is that?

original: sdug bsngal gyi tshor bas ni rang bzhin gyi sdug bsngal ma spangs /
analyzed: sdug bsngal gyi tshor bas ni rang bzhin gyi sdug bsngal ma spangs /
translated: The feeling of pain is not abandoned by nature.

original: bde ba'i tshor bas ni 'gyur ba'i sdug bsngal ma spangs /
analyzed: bde ba'i tshor bas ni 'gyur ba'i sdug bsngal ma spangs /
translated: The feeling of pleasure is not abandoned by change.

original: bde pa yang ma yin sdug bsngal ba yang ma yin pa'i tshor bas ni 'du byed kyi sdug bsngal ma spangs te /
analyzed: bde pa yang ma yin sdug bsngal ba yang ma yin pa'i tshor bas ni 'du byed kyi sdug bsngal ma spangs te /
translated: The feeling that is neither pleasure nor pain is not abandoned by formation.

original: de bas na tshor ba gsum char sdug bsngal ba nyid do //
analyzed: de bas na tshor ba gsum char sdug bsngal ba nyid do //
translated: Therefore, all three feelings are suffering.

original: sdug bsngal ba med pa zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: sdug bsngal ba med pa zhes bya ba la /
translated: There is no suffering.

analyzed: mu stegs pa dag gis ni sdug bsngal de dag bdag gis myong ngo zhes smras te /
translated: The tƒ´rthikas say that those sufferings are experienced by a self.

original: chos dngos zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: chos dngos zhes bya ba la /

original: de ltar bdag ni kun rdzob tu yang med kyi phung po dang khams la sogs pa'i chos ni kun rdzob tu sgyu ma dang / smig rgyu ba tsam du yod pas chos dngos zhes bya ste /

translated: Thus, the self does not exist even conventionally, but the entities of phenomena such as the aggregates and constituents exist conventionally, like illusions and mirages. Therefore, it is said that the entities of phenomena exist.

analyzed: 'di yan chad kyi tshig gis gang zag la bdag med pa bstan to //

analyzed: de dngos min zhes bya ba la don dam bar ni chos de yang rang bzhin dang bdag med de stong pa yin pas de dngos min zhes bya ste /
translated: Ultimately, those phenomena also lack intrinsic nature and self and are empty. Therefore, it is said that they are not entities.

original: tshig 'dis ni chos la bdag med pa bstan to //
analyzed: tshig 'dis ni chos la bdag med pa bstan to //

original: dngos po rten 'byung mngon sum 'jug pa la //
analyzed: dngos po rten 'byung mngon sum 'jug pa la //

analyzed: phyi'i dngos po rnams kyang sa bon dang sa gzhi dang chu dang me dang rlung la sogs pa'i rgyu rkyen las 'byung bar snang la /

translated: Therefore, in order to demonstrate that nirvana is attained and that one can be born in samsara even though the self and phenomena do not exist, the treatise declares the following.üîΩThe two are not in the least different

analyzed: skye ba ni 'khor ba la bya ste /

translated: The fifth verse teaches the path of culmination.üîΩThe bodhisattva, having gathered the equipment of

analyzed: mtha' yas pha rol tshogs @79a * // rnams bsags nas su //
translated: infinite merit and knowledge,

It shows the gathering of the great equipment, the attainment of the mind of enlightenment through stability in meditative concentration and the ascertainment of the Dharma, and the understanding that things appear from the conceptualization of the mind.

original: de la byang chub sems dpa' bsod nams kyi tshogs dang / ye shes kyi tshogs mtha' yas pa ste /
analyzed: de la byang chub sems dpa' bsod nams kyi tshogs dang / ye shes kyi tshogs mtha' yas pa ste /
translated: Therein, the bodhisattva, having gathered the equipment of infinite merit and knowledge,

original: bskal pa grangs med pa gcig gi bar du bsags nas mthong ba'i lam dang / sa dang po thob pa nas pha rol du son pa zhes bya ste /
analyzed: bskal pa grangs med pa gcig gi bar du bsags nas mthong ba'i lam dang / sa dang po thob pa nas pha rol du son pa zhes bya ste /
translated: having gathered it for one incalculable eon, attains the path of insight and the first spiritual level, and is said to have gone to the other shore.

original: pha rol gyi sgra ni sa dang po thob pa la bya'o//
analyzed: pha rol gyi sgra ni sa dang po thob pa la bya'o//
translated: The word ‚Äúother‚Äù refers to the attainment of the first spiritual level.

original: 'dis ni tshogs chen po bsags pa bstan te /
analyzed: 'dis ni tshogs chen po bsags pa bstan te /
translated: This shows the great collection of merit.üîΩFor one incalculable eon, he served the Tathagatas with banners, parasols, and so on, which is the collection of merit.

original: bskal pa grangs med pa gcig tu de bzhin gshegs pa la rgyal mtshan dang gdugs la sogs pas bsnyen bkur byas pa ni bsod nams kyi tshogs so de bzhin gshegs pa de dag las dam pa'i chos nyan pa dang / bsam pa dang bsgom pa byas pa ni ye shes kyi tshogs so //
analyzed: bskal pa grangs med pa gcig tu de bzhin gshegs pa la rgyal mtshan dang gdugs la sogs pas bsnyen bkur byas pa ni bsod nams kyi tshogs so de bzhin gshegs pa de dag las dam pa'i chos nyan pa dang / bsam pa dang bsgom pa byas pa ni ye shes kyi tshogs so //
translated: From those Tathagatas, he listened to the holy Dharma, and he contemplated and meditated on it, which is the collection of wisdom.

original: yang na bskal pa grangs med pa gcig tu sbyin pa dang / tshul khrims dang / bzod pa bsgrubs pa ni bsod nams kyi tshogs so //
analyzed: yang na bskal pa grangs med pa gcig tu sbyin pa dang / tshul khrims dang / bzod pa bsgrubs pa ni bsod nams kyi tshogs so //
translated: Alternatively, for one incalculable eon, he accomplished generosity, morality, and patience, which is the collection of merit.

original: bsam gtan dang shes rab bsgoms pa ni ye shes kyi tshogs so //
analyzed: bsam gtan dang shes rab bsgoms pa ni ye shes kyi tshogs so //
translated: He cultivated meditative stabilization and wisdom, which is the collection of wisdom.

original: brtson 'grus ni gnyis ka'i tshogs so //
analyzed: brtson 'grus ni gnyis ka'i tshogs so //
translated: Diligence is the collection of both.

original: yang na sbyin pa nas bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa lnga bsgrubs pa ni bsod nams kyi tshogs so //
analyzed: yang na sbyin pa nas bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa lnga bsgrubs pa ni bsod nams kyi tshogs so //
translated: Alternatively, he accomplished the five perfections from generosity to meditative stabilization, which is the collection of merit.

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa bsgoms pa ni ye shes kyi tshogs so //
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa bsgoms pa ni ye shes kyi tshogs so //
translated: He cultivated the perfection of wisdom, which is the collection of wisdom.

original: chos la sems pa shin tu nges pa ni //
analyzed: chos la sems pa shin tu nges pa ni //
translated: The extremely certain reflection on the Dharma.

original: zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la /
translated: Here,

original: ji ltar bsod nams dang ye shes kyi tshogs bsags pa de mi rtag pa dang / sdug bsngal ba dang stong ba dang bdag med par bsgoms pa'i ting nge 'dzin la brten nas gsung rab yan lag bcu gnyis kyi chos rnams la mi rtag pa dang /
analyzed: ji ltar bsod nams dang ye shes kyi tshogs bsags pa de mi rtag pa dang / sdug bsngal ba dang stong ba dang bdag med par bsgoms pa'i ting nge 'dzin la brten nas gsung rab yan lag bcu gnyis kyi chos rnams la mi rtag pa dang /
translated: the accumulation of the collections of merit and wisdom, based on the meditative stabilization of the contemplation of impermanence, suffering, emptiness, and selflessness, is the Dharma of the twelve branches of the scriptures.

original: stong pa dang / bdag med par bsam ste /
analyzed: stong pa dang / bdag med par bsam ste /
translated: One contemplates the impermanence,üîΩemptiness, and selflessness of the Dharma.

original: gtan la phab nas mi rtag pa dang / stong pa la sogs pa'i don la the tshom med par gyur pa ni chos la sems pa shin tu nges pa zhes bya ste /
analyzed: gtan la phab nas mi rtag pa dang / stong pa la sogs pa'i don la the tshom med par gyur pa ni chos la sems pa shin tu nges pa zhes bya ste /
translated: Having ascertained it, one becomes free of doubt about the meaning of impermanence, emptiness, and so forth. This is called the extremely certain reflection on the Dharma.

original: 'dis ni ting nge 'dzin la brten nas chos la nges par sems pa thob pa bstan te /
analyzed: 'dis ni ting nge 'dzin la brten nas chos la nges par sems pa thob pa bstan te /
translated: This shows that one attains the reflection on the Dharma based on meditative stabilization.

original: 'di yan chad tshigs bcad rkang pa gsum gyis tshogs kyi lam bshad do //
analyzed: 'di yan chad tshigs bcad rkang pa gsum gyis tshogs kyi lam bshad do //
translated: Up to this point, the three lines of verse explain the path of accumulation.

original: rtogs pa'i rgyu can don gyi rnam par rtog / ces bya ba la /
analyzed: rtogs pa'i rgyu can don gyi rnam par rtog / ces bya ba la /
translated: The cause of realization is the conception of the meaning.

original: phyi'i dngos po'i @79b gzugs dang sgra la sogs pa dang / snam bu la sogs pa ni don gyi rnam pa zhes bya ste /
analyzed: phyi'i dngos po'i @79b gzugs dang sgra la sogs pa dang / snam bu la sogs pa ni don gyi rnam pa zhes bya ste /
translated: The forms, sounds, etc. of external things, and cloth, etc. are called the aspects of objects.

original: bsod nams dang ye shes kyi tshogs bsags /
analyzed: bsod nams dang ye shes kyi tshogs bsags /
translated: Having gathered the accumulations of merit and wisdom,

original: chos la nges par sems pa thob pa des ;
analyzed: chos la nges par sems pa thob pa des ;
translated: and having attained ascertainment with regard to the Dharma,

original: / de'i rjes la bum pa dang snam bu la sogs pa 'di dag thams cad kyi rgyu las byung ba yin te ;
analyzed: / de'i rjes la bum pa dang snam bu la sogs pa 'di dag thams cad kyi rgyu las byung ba yin te ;
translated: one subsequently realizes that all these things, such as pots and cloth, arise from causes,

original: sems las ma gtogs par logs shig na yod pa ma yin no zhes rtogs pa ni rtogs pa'i rgyu can don gyi rnam par rtog pa zhes bya ste /
analyzed: sems las ma gtogs par logs shig na yod pa ma yin no zhes rtogs pa ni rtogs pa'i rgyu can don gyi rnam par rtog pa zhes bya ste /
translated: and that they do not exist apart from the mind. This is called the conceptualization of the aspects of objects, which is based on realization.

original: 'dis yid kyi rtog pa las don du snang bar khong du chud pa de ston to //
analyzed: 'dis yid kyi rtog pa las don du snang bar khong du chud pa de ston to //
translated: This shows that one understands that the appearance of objects is from mental conceptualization.

original: de ltar rtogs pa yang mos pas spyod pa'i sa drod kyi dus snang pa thob pa'i ting nge 'dzin gyi dus na rtog pa ston to //
analyzed: de ltar rtogs pa yang mos pas spyod pa'i sa drod kyi dus snang pa thob pa'i ting nge 'dzin gyi dus na rtog pa ston to //
translated: This realization is taught as occurring at the time of heat on the stage of action in faith, and at the time of the concentration of obtaining light.

original: rtog pa tsam du don rnams des rig nas //
analyzed: rtog pa tsam du don rnams des rig nas //
translated: One knows that objects are only conceptualization,

original: des snang sems tsam la ni rab tu gnas //
analyzed: des snang sems tsam la ni rab tu gnas //
translated: and one is well established in the mere mind that appears as objects.

original: zhes bya ba'i rkang pa gnyis kyis bsdus pa'i don ni /
analyzed: zhes bya ba'i rkang pa gnyis kyis bsdus pa'i don ni /
translated: The meaning of the two lines beginningüîΩ‚ÄúWhen he sees that objects appear from mind‚Äù

original: don rnams sems las snang ba mthong ba dang // de nas sems tsam la gnas pa de ston to //
analyzed: don rnams sems las snang ba mthong ba dang // de nas sems tsam la gnas pa de ston to //
translated: is that he teaches that one should then remain in the mere mind.

original: don rnams zhes bya ba ni gzugs dang sgra la sogs pa gzung ba'i chos rnams la bya ste /
analyzed: don rnams zhes bya ba ni gzugs dang sgra la sogs pa gzung ba'i chos rnams la bya ste /
translated: ‚Äú Objects‚Äù refers to the perceived phenomena such as form, sound, and so on.

original: gzung ba'i chos rnams sems las ji ltar byung zhing skye ba mngon sum du gyur pa ni rtog pa tsam du don rnams des rig byas te /
analyzed: gzung ba'i chos rnams sems las ji ltar byung zhing skye ba mngon sum du gyur pa ni rtog pa tsam du don rnams des rig byas te /
translated: ‚Äú When he sees that objects appear from mind‚Äù means that he directly perceives how perceived phenomena arise and originate from mind.

original: tshig des don rnams la snang ba mthong bar bstan to //
analyzed: tshig des don rnams la snang ba mthong bar bstan to //
translated: ‚Äú He knows that objects are mere conceptualization‚Äù teaches that he sees the appearance of objects.

original: 'di ni nges par 'byed pa'i phyogs spyi bo'i dus de snang ba mched pa'i ting nge 'dzin to //
analyzed: 'di ni nges par 'byed pa'i phyogs spyi bo'i dus de snang ba mched pa'i ting nge 'dzin to //
translated: This is the concentration of the increase of appearance, which is the time of the peak in the stage of penetrating insight.

original: de snang ba zhes bya ba'i rnam par shes pa la snang ba'i gzung ba'i chos rnams la bya ste /
analyzed: de snang ba zhes bya ba'i rnam par shes pa la snang ba'i gzung ba'i chos rnams la bya ste /
translated: ‚Äú In that appearance‚Äù refers to the perceived phenomena that appear to the consciousness.

original: gzung ba'i cha spangs nas gzung ba dang bral ba'i sems tsam gyi chos la gnas pa ni sems tsam la rab tu gnas par bya ste ;
analyzed: gzung ba'i cha spangs nas gzung ba dang bral ba'i sems tsam gyi chos la gnas pa ni sems tsam la rab tu gnas par bya ste ;
translated: Having abandoned the aspect of the apprehended, one should abide in the mere mind of the dharma free from the apprehended, which is the complete abiding in mere mind.

original: 'dis ni sems tsam la gnas pa bstan to //
analyzed: 'dis ni sems tsam la gnas pa bstan to //
translated: This teaches the abiding in mere mind.

original: 'dis ni nges par 'byed pa'i phyogs bzod pa'i dus te de kho na'i phyogs gcig la zhugs pa'i ting nge 'dzin to //
analyzed: 'dis ni nges par 'byed pa'i phyogs bzod pa'i dus te de kho na'i phyogs gcig la zhugs pa'i ting nge 'dzin to //
translated: This is the time of forbearance in the side of penetration, the samadhi that has entered one part of thatness.

original: 'di yan chad sbyor ba'i lam bstan to //
analyzed: 'di yan chad sbyor ba'i lam bstan to //
translated: Up to here, the path of preparation is taught.

original: chos kyi dbyings kyang shin tu mngon sum du gyur ces bya ba la ;
analyzed: chos kyi dbyings kyang shin tu mngon sum du gyur ces bya ba la ;
translated: And the dhatu of phenomena becomes directly perceived.

original: de nas nges par 'byed pa'i ting nge 'dzin gyi cha'i 'og tu sa dang po mthong ba'i lam bskyed nas /
analyzed: de nas nges par 'byed pa'i ting nge 'dzin gyi cha'i 'og tu sa dang po mthong ba'i lam bskyed nas /
translated: Then, after the part of the samadhi of penetration, having generated the path of seeing on the first ground,

original: mthong ba'i lam rnam par mi rtog pa'i ye shes kyis chos kyi dbyings mngon sum du byed do zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: mthong ba'i lam rnam par mi rtog pa'i ye shes kyis chos kyi dbyings mngon sum du byed do zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: the path of seeing's nonconceptual wisdom makes the dhatu of phenomena directly perceptible. This is the meaning.

original: de nas gnyis kyi mtshan dang rnam par bral //
analyzed: de nas gnyis kyi mtshan dang rnam par bral //
translated: Then, free from the signs of duality.

original: zhes bya ba la /üîΩmthong @80a * //
analyzed: zhes bya ba la /üîΩmthong @80a * //
translated: Here,

original: ba'i lam la chos kyi dbyings mngon sum du gyur pa dang / de nas gzung ba'i sgrib pa'i mtshan nyid dang yang bral 'dzin pa'i sgrib pa'i mtshan nyid dang yang bral te /
analyzed: ba'i lam la chos kyi dbyings mngon sum du gyur pa dang / de nas gzung ba'i sgrib pa'i mtshan nyid dang yang bral 'dzin pa'i sgrib pa'i mtshan nyid dang yang bral te /
translated: On the path of insight, the reality realm is directly perceived, and then one is free from the characteristics of the obscurations of the apprehended and free from the characteristics of the obscurations of the apprehender.

original: gnyis su med pa'i chos kyi dbyings la gnas so zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: gnyis su med pa'i chos kyi dbyings la gnas so zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that one abides in the reality realm which is nondual.

original: 'dis ni mthong ba'i lam bstan to //
analyzed: 'dis ni mthong ba'i lam bstan to //
translated: This teaches the path of insight.

original: da ni tshigs su bcad pa gsum pas mthong ba'i lam na chos kyi dbyings ji ltar mngon sum du 'gyur ba'i rgyu dang thabs bstan to //
analyzed: da ni tshigs su bcad pa gsum pas mthong ba'i lam na chos kyi dbyings ji ltar mngon sum du 'gyur ba'i rgyu dang thabs bstan to //
translated: Now, in the third verse, the cause and method by which the reality realm is directly perceived on the path of insight are taught.

original: de bas na /üîΩsems la gzhan med par ni blos rig nas //
analyzed: de bas na / sems la gzhan med par ni blos rig nas //
translated: Therefore,üîΩhaving understood that there is nothing other than mind,

original: de phyir sems kyang med par shin tu rtogs //
analyzed: de phyir sems kyang med par shin tu rtogs //
translated: one should understand that mind also does not exist.

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i tshigs su bcad pa gcig smos so //
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i tshigs su bcad pa gcig smos so //
translated: Thus, one verse is stated.

original: 'di ltar bzod pa'i dus na gzung ba'i sgrib pa spangs pa dang / 'jig rten gyi chos mchog gi tshe gzung ba med na 'dzin ba med do zhes rtogs te /
analyzed: 'di ltar bzod pa'i dus na gzung ba'i sgrib pa spangs pa dang / 'jig rten gyi chos mchog gi tshe gzung ba med na 'dzin ba med do zhes rtogs te /
translated: Thus, at the time of acceptance, the obscurations of the apprehended are abandoned, and at the time of the supreme mundane state, one realizes that if the apprehended does not exist, the apprehender does not exist.

original: ji ltar zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar zhe na /
translated: How is that?

original: bum pa dang snam bu la sogs pa 'di dag ni sems las logs shig na yod pa ma yin no zhes khong du chud do //
analyzed: bum pa dang snam bu la sogs pa 'di dag ni sems las logs shig na yod pa ma yin no zhes khong du chud do //
translated: One understands that these things, such as pot, cloth, etc., do not exist apart from mind.

original: de ltar phyi'i yul med pas 'di la dmigs pa'i sems kyang med do zhes rtogs te gzung ba med na 'dzin pa yod par mi rigs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de ltar phyi'i yul med pas 'di la dmigs pa'i sems kyang med do zhes rtogs te gzung ba med na 'dzin pa yod par mi rigs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Thus, since there is no external object, one understands that the mind which has that as object does not exist. If there is no object, it is not reasonable that the subject exists.

original: blo dang ldan pas gnyis po med rig nas //
analyzed: blo dang ldan pas gnyis po med rig nas //
translated: The wise one, having understood the non-existence of the two,

original: zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la /
translated: In this verse,

original: blo dang ldan pa ni byang chub sems dpa' zhes bya ste /
analyzed: blo dang ldan pa ni byang chub sems dpa' zhes bya ste /
translated: the wise one is called the bodhisattva.

original: 'jig rten gyi chos mchog gi tshe gzung ba dang 'dzin pa gnyis med par khong du chud nas gzung 'dzin gyi sgrib pa spangs pa dang de ma thag tu mthong ba'i lam bskyed nas chos kyi dbyings mngon sum du byed do zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: 'jig rten gyi chos mchog gi tshe gzung ba dang 'dzin pa gnyis med par khong du chud nas gzung 'dzin gyi sgrib pa spangs pa dang de ma thag tu mthong ba'i lam bskyed nas chos kyi dbyings mngon sum du byed do zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: At the time of the supreme worldly dharmas, having understood the non-existence of the two, object and subject, having abandoned the obscuration of subject and object, immediately generating the path of seeing, one actualizes the dharmadhatu. This is the meaning.

original: 'di 'jig rten gyi chos mchog gi dus te /
analyzed: 'di 'jig rten gyi chos mchog gi dus te /
translated: This is the time of the supreme worldly dharmas.

original: de ma thag pa'i ting nge 'dzi zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de ma thag pa'i ting nge 'dzi zhes bya'o //

original: de mi ldan pa'i chos kyi dbyings la gnas //üîΩzhes bya ba la /
analyzed: de mi ldan pa'i chos kyi dbyings la gnas // zhes bya ba la /
translated: He abides in the Dharma-element which is devoid of that.

original: de ltar 'jig rten gyi chos mchog gi rjes la mthong ba'i lam skyes nas mthong ba'i mthong ba'i mthong lam na gzung ba dang 'dzin pa gnyis dang mi ldan pa'i chos kyi dbyings la gnas te /

translated: Thus, after the supreme mundane state, the path of vision arises. Having seen the Dharma-element which is devoid of the duality of the apprehended object and apprehending subject, he abides in the Dharma-element which is devoid of the duality of the apprehended object and apprehending subject.

original: mthong bas spang bar bya ba'i nyon mongs pa spangs so zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: mthong bas spang bar bya ba'i nyon mongs pa spangs so zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that he abandons the moral defilement which is to be abandoned by means of the path of vision.

original: blo dang ldan pa rtag par thams cad du //
analyzed: blo dang ldan pa rtag par thams cad du //
translated: The wise one always abides in all things

original: mnyam song mi rtog ye shes rtogs dag gis //
analyzed: mnyam song mi rtog ye shes rtogs dag gis //

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i tshigs su bcad pa bzhi pas bsgom pa'i lam ston te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i tshigs su bcad pa bzhi pas bsgom pa'i lam ston te /

original: blo dang ldan pa ni byang chub sems dpa'o//
analyzed: blo dang ldan pa ni byang chub sems dpa'o//
translated: The wise one refers to the bodhisattva.

original: @80b byang chub sems dpa'i rnam par mi rtog ba'i ye shes kyi stobs kyis dug sman chen po ltar sgrib pa'i dug sel to zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
analyzed: @80b byang chub sems dpa'i rnam par mi rtog ba'i ye shes kyi stobs kyis dug sman chen po ltar sgrib pa'i dug sel to zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
translated: The bodhisattva removes the poison of the obscurations by means of the power of his non-discriminative direct intuition, just like a great antidote removes poison.

original: rtag par ni sa gnyis nas sa bcu man chad rgyun du sgrib pa spong ngo zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: rtag par ni sa gnyis nas sa bcu man chad rgyun du sgrib pa spong ngo zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: Always means that from the second stage up to the tenth stage, he always eliminates the obscurations.

original: thams cad du zhes bya ba ni phyi'i dngos po thams cad dang nang gi dngos po thams cad la zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: thams cad du zhes bya ba ni phyi'i dngos po thams cad dang nang gi dngos po thams cad la zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: Everywhere means that he sees all external things and all internal things.

translated: Evenly means that just as he sees external things as empty, he sees internal things as empty.

original: gzung ba la yang mi rtog /'dzin pa la yang mi rtog pas mi rtog pa'i ye shes zhes bya ste /
analyzed: gzung ba la yang mi rtog /'dzin pa la yang mi rtog pas mi rtog pa'i ye shes zhes bya ste /
translated: Since he does not conceptualize the apprehended, nor does he conceptualize the apprehender, it is called nonconceptual intuition.

original: ye shes de'i mthus na zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: ye shes de'i mthus na zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //

original: de gnas nyes pa bsags pas khrod stug po //
analyzed: de gnas nyes pa bsags pas khrod stug po //
translated: He is a great tree, a thicket of faults,

original: dug sman chen po lta bur dug sel to //üîΩzhes bya ba la /
analyzed: dug sman chen po lta bur dug sel to // zhes bya ba la /
translated: a great antidote, like a great medicine.

original: de'i sgras ni bsgom pa'i lam la gnas pa'i byang chub sems dpa' la bya'o //
analyzed: de'i sgras ni bsgom pa'i lam la gnas pa'i byang chub sems dpa' la bya'o //
translated: The word that refers to the bodhisattva who is situated on the path of meditation.

analyzed: gnas ni byang chub sems dpa'i sems kun gzhi rnam par shes pa gzhan gyi dbang gi mtshan nyid la bya'o //
translated: The ‚Äúplace‚Äù is the consciousness of the ground of all, the mind of the bodhisattva, the dependent characteristic.

analyzed: nyes pa ni kun gzhi la yod pa'i nyon mongs pa'i sgrib pa dang gzung 'dzin gyi bag chags la bya'o //
translated: ‚Äú Fault‚Äù refers to the afflictive obstructions and the habitual tendencies of subject and object that exist in the ground of all.
