analyzed: bsags pa ni 'khor ba thog ma med pa'i dus nas bag chags sems la zhen par byas pa'o //
translated: ‚Äú Accumulated‚Äù refers to the habitual tendencies that have been adhered to in the mind since beginningless time in cyclic existence.

original: bag chags de yang shes par bya ba dka' zhing spang bar bya ba dka' ste /
analyzed: bag chags de yang shes par bya ba dka' zhing spang bar bya ba dka' ste /
translated: Those habitual tendencies are difficult to know and difficult to abandon.

original: phra bas na khrod stug po zhes bya'o //
analyzed: phra bas na khrod stug po zhes bya'o //
translated: Because they are subtle, they are called ‚Äúdense thickets.‚Äù

original: dug sman chen po sman gang thigs pa 'ga' tsam dug gi bum par lhung na dug thams cad sman du 'gyur ba dang / bsnams pa tsam gyis kyang dug sel bar byed pa ste /
analyzed: dug sman chen po sman gang thigs pa 'ga' tsam dug gi bum par lhung na dug thams cad sman du 'gyur ba dang / bsnams pa tsam gyis kyang dug sel bar byed pa ste /
translated: It is like a great medicinal antidote, a drop of which, falling into a poison jar, turns all the poison into medicine and merely smelling it removes the poison.

original: dper na dug sman chen po bsnams pa dang / myangs pas dug thams cad med par byed pa de bzhin du bsgom pa'i lam gyi rnam par mi rtog pa'i ye shes bsgom pas spang bar bya ba'i nyon mongs pa phra mo la sogs pa dug dang 'dra bar bsal nas gzhan du 'gyur te /
analyzed: dper na dug sman chen po bsnams pa dang / myangs pas dug thams cad med par byed pa de bzhin du bsgom pa'i lam gyi rnam par mi rtog pa'i ye shes bsgom pas spang bar bya ba'i nyon mongs pa phra mo la sogs pa dug dang 'dra bar bsal nas gzhan du 'gyur te /
translated: Just as by taking a great antidote or by tasting it, all poisons are eliminated, in the same way, by cultivating the nonconceptual intuition of the path of cultivation, the subtle addictions and so on, which are like poisons, are eliminated and one is transformed.

original: sangs rgyas kyi sa la rnam par mi rtog pa'i ye shes mngon du byed do zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi sa la rnam par mi rtog pa'i ye shes mngon du byed do zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that one realizes the nonconceptual intuition on the buddha stage.

original: yid kyi rtog pas chos de dag gi don rab tu snang bas zhes bya ba la sogs pa la sems las bum pa dang snam bu la sogs pa de dag snang bar zad kyi sems las ma gtogs par logs shig na yod pa ma yin no zhes khongüîΩdu chung cing yid ches pa'i @81a * //
analyzed: yid kyi rtog pas chos de dag gi don rab tu snang bas zhes bya ba la sogs pa la sems las bum pa dang snam bu la sogs pa de dag snang bar zad kyi sems las ma gtogs par logs shig na yod pa ma yin no zhes khong du chung cing yid ches pa'i @81a * //
translated: The phrase by the conceptualization of the mind, the meaning of those dharmas appears and so on means that, having understood that the mind is the creator of all dharmas, one should then understand that the mind is the creator of all dharmas, and that pots, cloth, and so on appear from the mind, and that apart from the mind there is nothing that exists separately.üîΩThe meaning is that one should understand this inwardly and believe it.

original: don to ; /'di ni drod kyi dus dang sbyar ro //
analyzed: don to ; /'di ni drod kyi dus dang sbyar ro //
translated: This is connected with the stage of heat.

original: grangs med pa rab dbye'i dus kyis de'i pha rol yongs su rdzogs pas na mtha' yas pas pha rol to zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: grangs med pa rab dbye'i dus kyis de'i pha rol yongs su rdzogs pas na mtha' yas pas pha rol to zhes bya ba la /
translated: It is a far shore because it is completed after an infinite time of the division of countless eons.

original: mtha' yas pa'i sgra ni bskal pa'i grangs rab tu dbye ba'i dus dang sbyar te /
analyzed: mtha' yas pa'i sgra ni bskal pa'i grangs rab tu dbye ba'i dus dang sbyar te /
translated: The word ‚Äúinfinite‚Äù is connected with the time of the division of the number of eons.

original: bskal pa grangs med pa gcig gi bar du bsgrubs pas na mtha' yas pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: bskal pa grangs med pa gcig gi bar du bsgrubs pas na mtha' yas pa zhes bya'o //
translated: It is called ‚Äúinfinite‚Äù because it is accomplished over the course of one countless eon.

original: de'i rjes la sa dang po thob pa na pha rol tu phyin pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de'i rjes la sa dang po thob pa na pha rol tu phyin pa zhes bya'o //
translated: After that, when one attains the first stage, it is called ‚Äúperfected.‚Äù

original: don rnams yid kyi rtogs pa tsam rig nas //üîΩzhes bya ba la /
analyzed: don rnams yid kyi rtogs pa tsam rig nas // zhes bya ba la /
translated: Having understood that objects are mere mental conceptualizations,

original: gzung ba la sogs pa dngos po gzung ba'i cha rnams sems las 'byung bar mngon sum du mthong zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: gzung ba la sogs pa dngos po gzung ba'i cha rnams sems las 'byung bar mngon sum du mthong zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that one directly sees that the aspects of the apprehended object and so on arise from the mind.

original: 'di ni spyi bo'i dus so //
analyzed: 'di ni spyi bo'i dus so //
translated: This is the time of the crown.

original: 'di lta bur snang ba'i sems tsam la gnas te zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: 'di lta bur snang ba'i sems tsam la gnas te zhes bya ba la /
translated: Abiding in mere mind, which appears as such,

original: gzung pa dang 'dzin pa lta bur snang ba las gzung ba'i cha spangs nas 'dzin pa'i cha tsam la gnas pa ste /
analyzed: gzung pa dang 'dzin pa lta bur snang ba las gzung ba'i cha spangs nas 'dzin pa'i cha tsam la gnas pa ste /
translated: Having abandoned the aspect of the apprehended object, one abides in the mere aspect of the apprehender.

original: 'di ni bzod pa'i dus so //
analyzed: 'di ni bzod pa'i dus so //
translated: This is the time of patience.üîΩFrom that point on, the reality realm becomes manifest.

original: de yan chad chos kyi dbyings mngon sum du 'gyur ro zhes bya ba dang / drod dang rtse mo dang / bzod pa skyes pa'i dus la mthong ba'i lam skyes nas chos kyi dbyings mngon sum du byed do zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: de yan chad chos kyi dbyings mngon sum du 'gyur ro zhes bya ba dang / drod dang rtse mo dang / bzod pa skyes pa'i dus la mthong ba'i lam skyes nas chos kyi dbyings mngon sum du byed do zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning of the above is that the path of seeing arises at the time of heat, peak, and patience, and then the reality realm becomes manifest.

original: gsum pas ni ji ltar chos kyi dbyings de mngon sum du rig pa ston to zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: gsum pas ni ji ltar chos kyi dbyings de mngon sum du rig pa ston to zhes bya ba la /
translated: The third verse shows how that reality realm is known by direct perception.

original: tshigs su bcad pa gsum pas ni thabs gang dang rgyu gang gis mthong ba'i lam skyes na chos kyi dbyings mngon sum du byed pa'i rgyu ston te /
analyzed: tshigs su bcad pa gsum pas ni thabs gang dang rgyu gang gis mthong ba'i lam skyes na chos kyi dbyings mngon sum du byed pa'i rgyu ston te /
translated: The third verse shows the method and cause by which the reality realm becomes manifest when the path of seeing arises.

original: de yang 'jig rten gyi chos mchog gi ting nge 'dzin yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: de yang 'jig rten gyi chos mchog gi ting nge 'dzin yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: That is to say, it is the concentration of the supreme mundane quality.

original: bzhi pas ni bsgom pa'i lam ni gnas yongs su rjes pas don dam pa'i ye shes la 'jug par ston to zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: bzhi pas ni bsgom pa'i lam ni gnas yongs su rjes pas don dam pa'i ye shes la 'jug par ston to zhes bya ba la /
translated: The fourth verse shows that the path of meditation enters ultimate intuition by means of the transmutation of the basis.

original: tshigs su bcad pa bzhi pas ni bsgom pa'i lam ste sa gnyis pa nas sa bcu man chad bsgom pas spang bar bya ba'i nyon mongs pa spong ste /
analyzed: tshigs su bcad pa bzhi pas ni bsgom pa'i lam ste sa gnyis pa nas sa bcu man chad bsgom pas spang bar bya ba'i nyon mongs pa spong ste /
translated: The fourth verse shows the path of cultivation, the elimination of the afflictions to be eliminated by the path of cultivation from the second stage up to the tenth stage.

original: gnas gzhan du gyur nas sangs rgyas kyi sa la rnam par mi rtog pa'i ye shes thob par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: gnas gzhan du gyur nas sangs rgyas kyi sa la rnam par mi rtog pa'i ye shes thob par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: Having become transformed into another state, one attains the nonconceptual intuition on the stage of Buddhahood.

original: rtag par zhes bya ba ni sa gnyis pa nas sa bcu man chad rgyun du sgrib pa spong zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: rtag par zhes bya ba ni sa gnyis pa nas sa bcu man chad rgyun du sgrib pa spong zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The word ‚Äúalways‚Äù means that one constantly eliminates the obscurations from the second stage up to the tenth stage.

original: gzhan gyi dbang gi ngo bo nyid de la mnyam du song ste zhes bya ba ni nyon mongs pa'i bag chags dang / gzung 'dzin gyi bag chags kyis kun gzhi la khyab par gnas zhes bya @81b pa'i don to //
analyzed: gzhan gyi dbang gi ngo bo nyid de la mnyam du song ste zhes bya ba ni nyon mongs pa'i bag chags dang / gzung 'dzin gyi bag chags kyis kun gzhi la khyab par gnas zhes bya @81b pa'i don to //
translated: ‚ÄúHaving become equalized in the other-dependent nature‚Äù means that the instinct for affliction and the instinct for the subject-object dichotomy abide pervading the container consciousness.

original: ring du zhugs pa zhes bya ba ni bag chags de dag thams cad kyang 'khor ba thog ma med pa nas bsags bsags pa yang spongs shing bsal dka' zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: ring du zhugs pa zhes bya ba ni bag chags de dag thams cad kyang 'khor ba thog ma med pa nas bsags bsags pa yang spongs shing bsal dka' zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: ‚ÄúFar advanced‚Äù means that all those habitual tendencies are difficult to eliminate and remove, since they have been accumulated from beginningless cyclic existence.

original: don dam pa'i ye shes kyi che ba'i phyir tshigs su bcad pa zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: don dam pa'i ye shes kyi che ba'i phyir tshigs su bcad pa zhes bya ba la /
translated: A verse on the greatness of ultimate intuition:

original: don dam pa'i ye shes ni rnam par mi rtog pa'i ye shes te /
analyzed: don dam pa'i ye shes ni rnam par mi rtog pa'i ye shes te /
translated: Ultimate intuition is nonconceptual intuition.

original: ye shes de'i che ba'i bdag nyid bstan pa dang / che ba'i bdag nyid bstan pa'i sgo nas mthar thug pa'i lam yang bstan pa'i phyir tshigs su bcad pa rtsom mo zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: ye shes de'i che ba'i bdag nyid bstan pa dang / che ba'i bdag nyid bstan pa'i sgo nas mthar thug pa'i lam yang bstan pa'i phyir tshigs su bcad pa rtsom mo zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The verse is composed to show the greatness of that intuition and to show the culmination of the path in terms of the greatness of that intuition.

original: thub pas gsungs pa'i chos legs par gzhag pa zhes bya ba de la /
analyzed: thub pas gsungs pa'i chos legs par gzhag pa zhes bya ba de la /
translated: The verse says, ‚ÄúThe Dharma well taught by the Sage.‚Äù

original: thub pa ni sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das te /üîΩlus dang ngag yid gsum gyi sgo nas /
analyzed: thub pa ni sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das te / lus dang ngag yid gsum gyi sgo nas /
translated: The Sage is the Lord Buddha.

original: sdig pa mi dge ba mi mdzad pas thub par thub pa'o //
analyzed: sdig pa mi dge ba mi mdzad pas thub par thub pa'o //
translated: He is a sage because he does not commit evil deeds by body, speech, or mind.

original: thub pa des gsungs pa ni thub pa des bshad ces bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: thub pa des gsungs pa ni thub pa des bshad ces bya ba'i don to //
translated: The statement ‚Äúspoken by the Sage‚Äù means ‚Äúexplained by the Sage.‚Äù

original: chos ni gsung rab yan lag bcu gnyis te chos de dag ni thog mar yang dge //üîΩbar du yang dge //
analyzed: chos ni gsung rab yan lag bcu gnyis te chos de dag ni thog mar yang dge // bar du yang dge //
translated: The Dharma is the twelve branches of the scriptures. Those dharmas are good in the beginning,üîΩgood in the middle,

original: tha mar yang dge //
analyzed: tha mar yang dge //
translated: and good in the end.

original: tshig bzang po //
analyzed: tshig bzang po //
translated: They have good words,

original: don bzang po //
analyzed: don bzang po //
translated: good meanings,

original: legs par gzhag pa zhes bya ste /
analyzed: legs par gzhag pa zhes bya ste /
translated: and are well-established.

original: chos de dag gi don dam pa la blo gros gzhag par bya'o zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
analyzed: chos de dag gi don dam pa la blo gros gzhag par bya'o zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
translated: The meaning of those dharmas should be well-established in the mind.

original: rtsa ba'i chos kyi dbyings la blo gros gzhag / ces bya ba la /
analyzed: rtsa ba'i chos kyi dbyings la blo gros gzhag / ces bya ba la /
translated: The root mind is established in the dharmadhatu.

original: don dam pa'i ye shes la zhugs pa'i byang chub sems dpa' theg pa chen po mdo sde thams cad kyi don gcig tu bsdus nas dmigs par byed pa'i sems ni rtsa ba'i sems zhes bya'o //
analyzed: don dam pa'i ye shes la zhugs pa'i byang chub sems dpa' theg pa chen po mdo sde thams cad kyi don gcig tu bsdus nas dmigs par byed pa'i sems ni rtsa ba'i sems zhes bya'o //
translated: The bodhisattva who has entered ultimate wisdom, having gathered the meaning of all Mahayana sutras into one, focuses the mind on that. That is called the root mind.

original: sems de la rtsa ba'i sems zhes bya bar ci mngon zhe na /
analyzed: sems de la rtsa ba'i sems zhes bya bar ci mngon zhe na /
translated: Why is that mind called the root mind?

original: mdo sde rgyan gyi gtsug lag nyid las 'byung bar mngon te /
analyzed: mdo sde rgyan gyi gtsug lag nyid las 'byung bar mngon te /
translated: It is evident that it appears in the scriptures of the Ornament of the Sutras itself.

original: 'di'i rjes su bstan pa dang / bshad pa'i skabs las /üîΩde bas mdo sde la sogs pa'i //
analyzed: 'di'i rjes su bstan pa dang / bshad pa'i skabs las / de bas mdo sde la sogs pa'i //
translated: The following is explained in the section on teaching and explaining:üîΩTherefore, in the two teachings

original: chos gnyis ston pa de la ni //
analyzed: chos gnyis ston pa de la ni //
translated: of the sutra collection and so on,

original: dang po nyid du brtul zhugs pas //üîΩmdo sogs ming la sems gzhag bya //
analyzed: dang po nyid du brtul zhugs pas // mdo sogs ming la sems gzhag bya //
translated: the one who is initially diligentüîΩshould place the mind on the name of the sutra and so on.

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i tshigs su bcad pa gsum gyis sems rnam pa drug bshad de /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i tshigs su bcad pa gsum gyis sems rnam pa drug bshad de /
translated: Here, three verses explain six types of mind:

original: drug gang zhe na /
analyzed: drug gang zhe na /
translated: What are the six?

original: rtsa ba'i sems dang / rjes su dpyod pa'i sems dang / rnam par dpyod pa'i sems dang / rjes su 'dzin pa'i sems dang / kun du bsdus pa'i sems dang / rjes su ston pa'i sems so zhes bshad do //
analyzed: rtsa ba'i sems dang / rjes su dpyod pa'i sems dang / rnam par dpyod pa'i sems dang / rjes su 'dzin pa'i sems dang / kun du bsdus pa'i sems dang / rjes su ston pa'i sems so zhes bshad do //
translated: The root mind, the mind that investigates, the mind that analyzes, the mind that holds, the mind that fully gathers, and the mind that teaches.

original: de la rtsa ba'i sems gang zhe na /üîΩgang @82a * //
analyzed: de la rtsa ba'i sems gang zhe na / gang @82a * //
translated: What is the root mind?

original: mdo sde la sogs pa'i ming la dmigs pa ste /
analyzed: mdo sde la sogs pa'i ming la dmigs pa ste /
translated: It is the focus on the name of the sutra collection and so on.

original: mdo dang lung du bstan pa'i sde la sogs pa'i chos la /
analyzed: mdo dang lung du bstan pa'i sde la sogs pa'i chos la /
translated: In the Dharma of the sutra collection and so on,

original: mdo sde 'di'i ming ni lang kar gshegs pa zhes bya ste /
analyzed: mdo sde 'di'i ming ni lang kar gshegs pa zhes bya ste /
translated: the name of this sutra is called the Descent into Lanka.

original: mdo sde 'di'i ming ni sa bcu pa zhes bya zhes bya ba la sogs pa mdo sde rnams kyi ming la dmigs pa ni rtsa ba'i sems zhes bya'o //
analyzed: mdo sde 'di'i ming ni sa bcu pa zhes bya zhes bya ba la sogs pa mdo sde rnams kyi ming la dmigs pa ni rtsa ba'i sems zhes bya'o //
translated: The name of this sutra is called the Ten Stages, etc. The observation of the names of the sutras is called the basic mind.

original: yang na theg pa chen po'i mdo sde rnams kyi ming dang / tshig dang yi ge rnams la so sor mi dmigs par theg pa chen po'i chos thams cad kyi don thams cad gcig tu bzlums pa nas de la dmigs par byed pa'i sems la rtsa ba'i sems zhes bya'o //
analyzed: yang na theg pa chen po'i mdo sde rnams kyi ming dang / tshig dang yi ge rnams la so sor mi dmigs par theg pa chen po'i chos thams cad kyi don thams cad gcig tu bzlums pa nas de la dmigs par byed pa'i sems la rtsa ba'i sems zhes bya'o //
translated: Or else, the observation of the names, words, and letters of the Mahayana sutras, without observing them individually, is the basic mind that focuses on the collection of all the meanings of all the Mahayana dharmas.

original: blo gros zhes bya ba ni shes rab la bya ste /
analyzed: blo gros zhes bya ba ni shes rab la bya ste /
translated: The so-called intelligence refers to wisdom.

original: rtsa ba'i sems dang 'brel pa'i shes rab kyis chos kyi dbyings la dmigs shing chos kyi dbyings la bsgom pa dang / chos kyi dbyings la sems par byed pa ni chos kyi dbyings blos gzhag pa zhes bya ste /
analyzed: rtsa ba'i sems dang 'brel pa'i shes rab kyis chos kyi dbyings la dmigs shing chos kyi dbyings la bsgom pa dang / chos kyi dbyings la sems par byed pa ni chos kyi dbyings blos gzhag pa zhes bya ste /
translated: The wisdom connected with the basic mind observes the dharmadhatu, meditates on the dharmadhatu, and reflects on the dharmadhatu. This is called the placement of the dharmadhatu by the mind.

original: dran rgyud rtog pa tsam rig brtan pa dag / ces bya ba la /
analyzed: dran rgyud rtog pa tsam rig brtan pa dag / ces bya ba la /
translated: The so-called stable knowledge of the mere conceptual continuum of memory

original: rtsa ba'i sems dang 'brel pa'i shes rab kyis chos kyi dbyings la dmigs pa'i dus na /
analyzed: rtsa ba'i sems dang 'brel pa'i shes rab kyis chos kyi dbyings la dmigs pa'i dus na /
translated: When, through the wisdom connected with the fundamental mind, one focuses on the expanse of reality,

original: sems kyi rgyud las dang po phul du phyin pa dang / byang chub kyi phyogs la sogs pa'i chos la sems shing dran pa yang dag sems las byung ba dang sems tsam du rig nas sems tsam mo snyam du rtog pa de yang spangs te /
analyzed: sems kyi rgyud las dang po phul du phyin pa dang / byang chub kyi phyogs la sogs pa'i chos la sems shing dran pa yang dag sems las byung ba dang sems tsam du rig nas sems tsam mo snyam du rtog pa de yang spangs te /
translated: one reflects on the qualities of the levels, transcendent perfections, strengths, fearlessnesses and so forth and, through the correct mental state that arises from mindfulness, one knows that they are simply the mind and one abandons the idea that they are simply the mind.

original: de la yang mi rtog pa ni brtan pa zhes bya ste /
analyzed: de la yang mi rtog pa ni brtan pa zhes bya ste /
translated: The nonconceptual state that is the result of that is called stability.

original: de ltar du sems dpa' byang chub sems dpa' de mthar 'di ltar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: de ltar du sems dpa' byang chub sems dpa' de mthar 'di ltar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: Thus, it is said that the bodhisattva, the being who is a bodhisattva, will eventually become like that.

original: myur du yon tan rgya mtsho'i pha rol 'gro //üîΩzhes bya ba la ;
analyzed: myur du yon tan rgya mtsho'i pha rol 'gro // zhes bya ba la ;
translated: He will swiftly cross the ocean of good qualities.

original: yon tan de lta bu dang ldan pa'i byang chub sems dpa' de myur du stobs dang mi 'jigs pa la sogs pa'i yon tan rgya mtsho'i pha rol 'gro ste /
analyzed: yon tan de lta bu dang ldan pa'i byang chub sems dpa' de myur du stobs dang mi 'jigs pa la sogs pa'i yon tan rgya mtsho'i pha rol 'gro ste /
translated: The bodhisattva who possesses such good qualities will swiftly cross the ocean of good qualities such as the strengths and fearlessnesses.

original: myur du bla na med pa'i byang chub tu 'tshang rgya bar 'gyur te zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: myur du bla na med pa'i byang chub tu 'tshang rgya bar 'gyur te zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: This is the meaning.

original: de kho na'i skabs bshad pa rdzogs so /
analyzed: de kho na'i skabs bshad pa rdzogs so /
translated: The explanation of the chapter on reality is complete.

original: // / de kho na'i skabs bshad pa'i rjes la /
analyzed: // / de kho na'i skabs bshad pa'i rjes la /
translated: After the explanation of the chapter on reality,

original: mthu'i mtshan nyid kyi skabs bshad par cis 'brel zhe na /
analyzed: mthu'i mtshan nyid kyi skabs bshad par cis 'brel zhe na /
translated: how is it connected to the explanation of the chapter on the characteristics of power?

original: byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyis ni rnam pa gnyis bya ba yin te /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyis ni rnam pa gnyis bya ba yin te /
translated: Bodhisattvas have two things to do:

original: bdag gi don dang gzhan gyi don to //
analyzed: bdag gi don dang gzhan gyi don to //
translated: their own purpose and others' purpose.

original: de la rang nyid kyis sangs rgyas kyi @82b chos yongs su rdzogs par bya ba ni bdag gi don to //
analyzed: de la rang nyid kyis sangs rgyas kyi @82b chos yongs su rdzogs par bya ba ni bdag gi don to //
translated: Among them, fulfilling the Buddha qualities by oneself is one's own purpose.

original: sems can yongs su smin par bya ba ni gzhan gyi don to //
analyzed: sems can yongs su smin par bya ba ni gzhan gyi don to //
translated: Ripening sentient beings is others' purpose.

original: de la bdag gi don de kho na khong du chud par gyur na sangs rgyas kyi chos yongs su rdzogs par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de la bdag gi don de kho na khong du chud par gyur na sangs rgyas kyi chos yongs su rdzogs par 'gyur ro //
translated: Among them, when one's own purpose is understood, the Buddha qualities will be fulfilled.

original: de nas de kho na khong du chud ba'i 'og tu sems can yongs su smin par bya ba'i phyir 'phrul gyi mig la sogs pa'i yon tan khyad par can bsgrubs pas ni sems can yongs su smin par 'gyur te /
analyzed: de nas de kho na khong du chud ba'i 'og tu sems can yongs su smin par bya ba'i phyir 'phrul gyi mig la sogs pa'i yon tan khyad par can bsgrubs pas ni sems can yongs su smin par 'gyur te /
translated: Then, after understanding reality, in order to ripen sentient beings, one accomplishes the special qualities of the superknowledges and so on, and thereby sentient beings are ripened.

original: 'phrul gyi mig la sogs pa'i yon tan khyad par can de yang skabs kyi mngon par rtogs pa dang mthar thug pa'i mngon par rtogs pa gnyis kyis 'grub ste /

analyzed: de bas na de kho na'i rjes la mthu'i skabs bshad par 'brel to //

original: bdag nyid kun nas nyon mongs pa med pas kyang dbang po ma thob pa dang sems can rnams gdug cing dgug par mi nus par byang chub sems dpa' skyo ba skyes te /
analyzed: bdag nyid kun nas nyon mongs pa med pas kyang dbang po ma thob pa dang sems can rnams gdug cing dgug par mi nus par byang chub sems dpa' skyo ba skyes te /
translated: Since one‚Äôs own complete purification is not able to attract and subdue sentient beings who have not obtained the faculties, the bodhisattva becomes discouraged.

analyzed: de bas na sems can yongs su smin par bya ba skyo bar mi 'gyur bar thabs bstan pa'i phyir /

analyzed: de kho na'i rjes la mthu'i skabs bshad par 'brel to // yang na gang la bslab par bya ba la rnam pa bdun du gzhag pa las de kho na'i skabs kyi rjes la mthu smos pa bzhin te bshad dgos pa'i phyir /
translated: the chapter on power is related as following immediately after the chapter on reality.üîΩOr else, since the seven topics of instruction must be explained in the same order as they are mentioned,

analyzed: de kho na'i 'og tu mthu'i skabs bshad par 'brel to //
translated: the chapter on power is related as following immediately after the chapter on reality.

original: mthu'i skabs 'di la don rnam pa drug 'byung ste /
analyzed: mthu'i skabs 'di la don rnam pa drug 'byung ste /
translated: This chapter on power has six topics:

original: mthu'i mtshan nyid rab tu dbye ba dang / mthu'i rgyu dang / mthu'i 'bras bu dang ; mthu'i las dang / mthu'i ldan pa dang / mthu'i rab tu dbye ba'o //
analyzed: mthu'i mtshan nyid rab tu dbye ba dang / mthu'i rgyu dang / mthu'i 'bras bu dang ; mthu'i las dang / mthu'i ldan pa dang / mthu'i rab tu dbye ba'o //

analyzed: mngon par shes pa drug gi mtshan nyid dang rang bzhin gang yin pa las brtsams te /

original: tshigs su bcad pa rtsom mo zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: tshigs su bcad pa rtsom mo zhes bya ba'i don to //

original: skye ba zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: skye ba zhes bya ba la /

original: 'dir 'chi ba ma smos su zin kyang /
analyzed: 'dir 'chi ba ma smos su zin kyang /
translated: although death is not mentioned here,

analyzed: gang na dud pa yod pa de na me yod par gdon mi za ba bzhin du skye ba yod na 'chi ba gdon mi za bar @83a * //
translated: just as it is certain that where there is smoke there is fire, if there is birth, it is certain that death will occur.

analyzed: 'byung la / 'chi ba yod na yang skye ba gdon mi za bar 'byung bas don gyi shugs kyis 'chi ba yang bstan pa yin par rig par bya'o //
translated: And if there is death, it is certain that birth will occur. Therefore, it should be understood that death is also taught by the force of the meaning.

original: de la sems can thams cad 'di nas shi nas gnas che ge mo zhig tu skye ste /
analyzed: de la sems can thams cad 'di nas shi nas gnas che ge mo zhig tu skye ste /

original: de nas shi nas kyang gnas che ge mo zhig tu skye zhes bya ba nas /
analyzed: de nas shi nas kyang gnas che ge mo zhig tu skye zhes bya ba nas /

analyzed: sangs ma rgyas pa dang mya ngan las ma 'das pa'i bar du sems can gyi skye ba dang / 'chi ba shes te /

analyzed: 'di ni 'chi ba dang skye ba shes pa'i mngon par shes pa'o //

original: ngag ces bya ba la sems can shi 'phos nas lha dang mi dang / sems can dmyal ba dang / byol song la sogs pa'i lam rgyud lnga de dang de dag tu skye ba'i tshig ci dang ci smras pa shes shing thos te /

original: 'di ni lha'i rna ba'i mngon par shes pa'o //
analyzed: 'di ni lha'i rna ba'i mngon par shes pa'o //

original: sems shes bya ba la /
analyzed: sems shes bya ba la /

analyzed: sems 'di ni 'dod chags dang bcas /

analyzed: 'di ni 'dod chags dang bral /
translated: this mind is without attachment;

analyzed: 'di ni zhe sdang dang bcas 'di ni zhe sdang dang bral zhes bya ba la sogs pa sems can gyi spyod pa brgyad khri bzhi stong shes pa ni sems shes pa zhes bya ste /

analyzed: dge ba dang mi dge ba skyed ces bya ba la /
translated: With regard to ‚Äúgenerating virtue and nonvirtue,‚Äù

translated: all sentient beings know what virtues and nonvirtues they have committed since beginningless cyclic existence.üîΩThey know that this sentient being in a previous life gave gifts and thus possesses the propensity for generosity, that in a previous life he guarded ethical discipline and thus possesses the propensity for ethical discipline, and so on, knowing the propensities for whatever he did in his previous lives.

original: tshe rabs snga ma 'di'i tshe na ni tshul khrims bsrungs pas tshul khrims kyi bag chags dang ldan pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa tshe rabs snga ma la ci dang ci byas pa'i bag chags shes pa dang / de bzhin du sems can 'dis tshe snga ma 'di'i tshe na ni srog bcad pa byas pas srog gcod pa'i bag chags dang ldan zhes bya ba la sogs pa tshe rabs snga ma la mi dge ba ci dang ci byas pa'i bag chags shes pa ni dge ba
analyzed: tshe rabs snga ma 'di'i tshe na ni tshul khrims bsrungs pas tshul khrims kyi bag chags dang ldan pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa tshe rabs snga ma la ci dang ci byas pa'i bag chags shes pa dang / de bzhin du sems can 'dis tshe snga ma 'di'i tshe na ni srog bcad pa byas pas srog gcod pa'i bag chags dang ldan zhes bya ba la sogs pa tshe rabs snga ma la mi dge ba ci dang ci byas pa'i bag chags shes pa ni dge ba
translated: Similarly, they know that this sentient being in a previous life committed killing and thus possesses the propensity for killing, and so on, knowing the propensities for whatever nonvirtues he committed in his previous lives.

original: 'di ni sngon gyi gnas mngon par shes pa'o //
analyzed: 'di ni sngon gyi gnas mngon par shes pa'o //
translated: This is the superknowledge of the knowledge of former lives.

original: de'i gnas dang zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: de'i gnas dang zhes bya ba la /
translated: The knowledge of his abode refers to

analyzed: de'i gnas ni de bzhin gshegs pa rnams bzhugs pa'i sangs rgyas kyi zhing dang / sems can rnams gnas pa'i 'jig rten gyi khams la bya ste /

translated: The knowledge of how to go to the buddhafields by means of his miraculous abilities in order to worship the tathagatas, and the knowledge of how to go by means of his miraculous abilities to those and those world systems in order to discipline sentient beings, is called the knowledge of his abode.

original: 'di ni rdzu 'phrul gyi yul mngon par shes pa'o ;
analyzed: 'di ni rdzu 'phrul gyi yul mngon par shes pa'o ;

original: /'byung ba zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: /'byung ba zhes bya ba la /

analyzed: de shes pa ni 'byung ba shes pa ste /

analyzed: de ni zag pa zad pa mngon par shes pa zhes bya'o //

analyzed: mngon sum gang zhes bya ba ni mngon par shes pa drug po de dag kyang /

translated: As for the universal, it is the six superknowledges of the bodhisattva, which are called universal because they function in all the world-realms and occur in all the three times.

analyzed: ces bya ba la /

analyzed: thogs pa med pa ni mngon par shes pa de dag 'jig rten gyi khams kun du 'jug pa dang / dus thams cad du 'byung bas thogs pa med pa ste /

analyzed: 'di ni nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas dang / 'jig rten gyi drang srong gi mngon par shes pas kyang 'phags pa ston to //

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /

analyzed: de dag gi mngon par shes pa ni 'jig rten gyi khams thams cad du mi 'jug pa dang / dus thams cad du mi 'byung bas thogs pa dang bcas pa'o //

original: 'jig rten gyi khams thams cad du zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: 'jig rten gyi khams thams cad du zhes bya ba ni /

analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i mngon par shes pa rnams phyogs bcu'i 'jig rten gyi khams thams cad du 'jug go zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: that the superknowledges of the bodhisattvas enter all world-realms in the ten directions. This is the meaning.

analyzed: don drug po de dag rab tu dbye ba dang bcas pa zhes bya ba ni mngon par shes pa drug po de dag gcig la yang du mar spel bar mngon sum du bya ba la /

analyzed: byang chub @84a * // sems dpa' rnams thogs pa med do zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that the bodhisattvas are unobstructed in the direct realization of the multiplication of the single superknowledge into many.

analyzed: de ni byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyis mthu mngon par shes pas bsdus pa'o zhes bya ba la / mngon par shes pa drug po de ni /
translated: This is the bodhisattvas' power included in the superknowledges.üîΩThe six superknowledges are called the bodhisattvas' power.

analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i mthu zhes bya ste mngon par shes pa drug tu rtogs pa nyid la byang chub sems dpa'i zhes bya ba'o zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that the very realization of the six superknowledges is called the bodhisattvas' power.

analyzed: mthu'i mtshan nyid rnam par dbye ba'i rang bzhin gyi don gsungs so zhes bya ba la /

original: byang chub sems dpa'i mthu'i mtshan nyid rnam pa drug tu dbye ba'i sgo nas byang chub sems dpa'i mthu'i rang bzhin ston to zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i mthu'i mtshan nyid rnam pa drug tu dbye ba'i sgo nas byang chub sems dpa'i mthu'i rang bzhin ston to zhes bya ba'i don to //

original: rgyu'i don las brtsams te tshigs su bcad pa zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: rgyu'i don las brtsams te tshigs su bcad pa zhes bya ba la /
translated: The verse beginning The cause, the basis, the act, the sign, the function, and the endowment is for the purpose of explaining the verse.üîΩThe verse beginning The cause, the basis, the act, the sign, the function, and the endowment is for the purpose of explaining the verse.

original: mngon par shes pa drug gi mtshan nyid dang dbye ba bshad nas /
analyzed: mngon par shes pa drug gi mtshan nyid dang dbye ba bshad nas /
translated: Having explained the characteristics and divisions of the six higher perceptions,

original: rgyu rnam pa gsum gang zhen bsam gtan bzhi pa la gnas pa dang / rnam par mi rtog pa'i ye shes la gnas pa dang / ji ltar rnam par gzhag pa yid la byed pa'o //
analyzed: rgyu rnam pa gsum gang zhen bsam gtan bzhi pa la gnas pa dang / rnam par mi rtog pa'i ye shes la gnas pa dang / ji ltar rnam par gzhag pa yid la byed pa'o //
translated: What are the three kinds of causes? Abiding in the fourth concentration, abiding in nonconceptual wisdom, and attending to what is established.

original: bsam gtan bzhi pa shin tu dag thob nas //
analyzed: bsam gtan bzhi pa shin tu dag thob nas //
translated: Having attained the perfectly pure fourth concentration,

original: zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la /
translated: Here,

analyzed: gzugs kyi khams kyi bsam gtan bzhi pa ste /

original: bsam gtan dang po dang / bsam gtan gnyis pa dang / bsam gtan gsum pa dang / bsam gtan bzhi pa'o //
analyzed: bsam gtan dang po dang / bsam gtan gnyis pa dang / bsam gtan gsum pa dang / bsam gtan bzhi pa'o //
translated: the first meditation, the second meditation, the third meditation, the fourth meditation.

original: shin tu dag pa ni sred pa shas cher bsgoms pa dang / nga rgyal shas cher bsgoms pa dang / the tshom shas cher bsgoms pa med pa'o //
analyzed: shin tu dag pa ni sred pa shas cher bsgoms pa dang / nga rgyal shas cher bsgoms pa dang / the tshom shas cher bsgoms pa med pa'o //

analyzed: yang na thod rgal dang / lugs su bsgoms pa dang / lugs su mi bsgoms pa thob pa ni dag pa zhes bya'o //

original: nyes pa brgyad po gang zhe na /
analyzed: nyes pa brgyad po gang zhe na /
translated: What are the eight faults?

original: dbugs rngub pa dang / 'byung ba dang / rtog pa dang / dpyod pa dang / bde ba dang / sdug bsngal pa dang / yid bde ba dang / mi bde ba'o //
analyzed: dbugs rngub pa dang / 'byung ba dang / rtog pa dang / dpyod pa dang / bde ba dang / sdug bsngal pa dang / yid bde ba dang / mi bde ba'o //
translated: Inhalation, exhalation, discursive thought, investigation, pleasure, pain, satisfaction, and dissatisfaction.

original: thob nas zhes bya ba ni bsam gtan bzhi pa dag gnas de la brten nas zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: thob nas zhes bya ba ni bsam gtan bzhi pa dag gnas de la brten nas zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: Having attained means having attained the fourth meditation. The meaning is: based on that state.

original: mi rtog ye shes yongs su gzung ba dang // zhes bya ba ni bsam gtan bzhi pa la gnas pa'i tshe /
analyzed: mi rtog ye shes yongs su gzung ba dang // zhes bya ba ni bsam gtan bzhi pa la gnas pa'i tshe /
translated: And the retention of nonconceptual intuition.

original: gzung 'dzin la mi rtog @84b pa'i rnam par mi rtog pa'i ye shes dang 'brel des kyang yongs su zin zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: gzung 'dzin la mi rtog @84b pa'i rnam par mi rtog pa'i ye shes dang 'brel des kyang yongs su zin zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: This means that when one is in the fourth meditation, one is associated with nonconceptual intuition, which is nonconceptual with regard to subject and object, and one is also sustained by that.

original: rnam par gzhag bzhin yid la byed pa las //
analyzed: rnam par gzhag bzhin yid la byed pa las //
translated: One attends to the object as it is presented.

original: zhes bya ba ni de'i tshe ci zhig yid la byed ce na /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni de'i tshe ci zhig yid la byed ce na /
translated: What does one attend to at that time?

original: rgyu gang dang gang gis mngon par shes pa gang dang gang thob par 'gyur ba'i rgyu mdo sde las bshad de rnam par gzhag pa de yid la byed pa bas mngon par shes pa thob par 'gyur te /
analyzed: rgyu gang dang gang gis mngon par shes pa gang dang gang thob par 'gyur ba'i rgyu mdo sde las bshad de rnam par gzhag pa de yid la byed pa bas mngon par shes pa thob par 'gyur te /
translated: One attends to the object as it is presented, that is, one attends to the presentation of the scriptures that explains the causes by which one attains the various superknowledges.

original: de'i rgyu yang mdo sde las 'phrul gyi mig gis mngon par shes pa thob par 'dod pas phyogs thams cad snang bas khyab par mos shing yid la gyis shig / de gsungs pa dang / rdzu 'phrul mngon par shes pa thob par 'dod pas lus yang par mos shing yid la gyis shig ces gsungs pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: de'i rgyu yang mdo sde las 'phrul gyi mig gis mngon par shes pa thob par 'dod pas phyogs thams cad snang bas khyab par mos shing yid la gyis shig / de gsungs pa dang / rdzu 'phrul mngon par shes pa thob par 'dod pas lus yang par mos shing yid la gyis shig ces gsungs pa lta bu'o //
translated: And when that is said, one who wishes to attain the supernormal knowledge of miraculous powers should imagine and keep in mind that the body is light.

original: mthu grub pa yi dam pa thob par 'gyur ba dang // zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: mthu grub pa yi dam pa thob par 'gyur ba dang // zhes bya ba la /
translated: One attains the highest accomplishment of power.

original: byang chub sems dpa'i mngon par shes pa drug ni nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas dang / 'jig rten pa'i mngon par shes pa bas 'phags pas na dam pa zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i mngon par shes pa drug ni nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas dang / 'jig rten pa'i mngon par shes pa bas 'phags pas na dam pa zhes bya ba ste /
translated: The six superknowledges of bodhisattvas are called highest because they are superior to the superknowledges of hearers, solitary realizers, and worldly beings.

original: bsam gtan bzhi pa la ni gnas /
analyzed: bsam gtan bzhi pa la ni gnas /
translated: One abides in the fourth concentration.

original: rnam par mi rtog pa'i ye shes dang mi ldan /
analyzed: rnam par mi rtog pa'i ye shes dang mi ldan /
translated: One does not possess nonconceptual wisdom.

original: ji ltar rnam par gzhag pa'i chos yid la byas nas mthu rnam pa drug thob pa 'grub par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: ji ltar rnam par gzhag pa'i chos yid la byas nas mthu rnam pa drug thob pa 'grub par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: Having brought to mind the phenomena that are so posited, one accomplishes the attainment of the six kinds of power. This is the meaning.

original: 'bras bu'i don las brtsams te tshigs su bcad pa zhes bya ba la mngon par shes pa drug gi rgyu bshad nas /
analyzed: 'bras bu'i don las brtsams te tshigs su bcad pa zhes bya ba la mngon par shes pa drug gi rgyu bshad nas /
translated: A verse on the topic of the result of the transcendences.

original: mngon par shes pa drug gi 'bras bu bstan pa'i phyir tshigs su bcad pa rtsom mo //
analyzed: mngon par shes pa drug gi 'bras bu bstan pa'i phyir tshigs su bcad pa rtsom mo //
translated: Having explained the cause of the six superknowledges, he composes a verse to demonstrate the result of the six superknowledges.

original: mngon par shes pa drug gi 'bras bu yang rnam pa gsum ste /
analyzed: mngon par shes pa drug gi 'bras bu yang rnam pa gsum ste /
translated: The result of the six superknowledges is also threefold:

original: dpe med cing rgya che ba'i spyod pa shin tu gnas pa dang / sangs rgyas la mchod pa byed pa dang / sems can 'dren par byed pa'o //üîΩgang gis 'phags dang 'phrul dang tshangs pa yi //
analyzed: dpe med cing rgya che ba'i spyod pa shin tu gnas pa dang / sangs rgyas la mchod pa byed pa dang / sems can 'dren par byed pa'o // gang gis 'phags dang 'phrul dang tshangs pa yi //
translated: the performance of the incomparable and vast duties, the worship of the buddhas, and the guidance of living beings.üîΩThe bodhisattva who has attained the superknowledges

original: dpe med rgya chen spyad pa shin tu gnas //
analyzed: dpe med rgya chen spyad pa shin tu gnas //
translated: dwells in the performance of the incomparable and vast duties of the noble, the magical, and Brahma.

original: zhes bya bas dpe med pa rgya chen po spyod pas gnas pa bstan te /
analyzed: zhes bya bas dpe med pa rgya chen po spyod pas gnas pa bstan te /
translated: This shows the dwelling in the performance of the incomparable and vast duties.

original: de la 'phags pa'i gnas pa ni stong pa nyid dang mtshan ma med pa dang smon pa med pas gnas pa'i bden pa bzhis gnas pa'am sa dang pha rol tu phyin pas gnas pa'o //
analyzed: de la 'phags pa'i gnas pa ni stong pa nyid dang mtshan ma med pa dang smon pa med pas gnas pa'i bden pa bzhis gnas pa'am sa dang pha rol tu phyin pas gnas pa'o //
translated: The noble dwelling is the dwelling in the four noble truths by means of emptiness, signlessness, and wishlessness, or it is the dwelling in the stages and transcendences.

original: 'phrul gyi gnas pa ni gzugs kyi khams bsam gtan bzhi pa la gnas pa'am /üîΩgzugs med pa'i snyoms par @85a * //
analyzed: 'phrul gyi gnas pa ni gzugs kyi khams bsam gtan bzhi pa la gnas pa'am / gzugs med pa'i snyoms par @85a * //
translated: The abode of magical emanations is the fourth absorption of the form realm or the formless realm.üîΩ

original: 'jug pa bzhi la gnas pa'o //
analyzed: 'jug pa bzhi la gnas pa'o //
translated: The supernatural states are the four meditations of the form realm and the four formless states of composure.

original: tshangs pa'i gnas pa ni byams pa dang / snying rje dang / dga' ba dang / btang snyoms la gnas pa'o //
analyzed: tshangs pa'i gnas pa ni byams pa dang / snying rje dang / dga' ba dang / btang snyoms la gnas pa'o //
translated: The states of BrahmƒÅ are the states of love, compassion, joy, and equanimity.

original: de la yang rnam par thar pa gsum las stong pa nyid kyi ting nge 'dzin las 'phags pa dag phal cher gnas so //
analyzed: de la yang rnam par thar pa gsum las stong pa nyid kyi ting nge 'dzin las 'phags pa dag phal cher gnas so //
translated: Among those, most of the noble ones abide in the meditative absorption of emptiness, which is one of the three liberations.

original: bden pa bzhi las kyang 'gog pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa la 'phags pa dag phal cher gnas so //
analyzed: bden pa bzhi las kyang 'gog pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa la 'phags pa dag phal cher gnas so //
translated: Also, most of the noble ones abide in the meditative absorption of cessation, which is one of the four truths.

original: gzugs dang gzugs med pa'i ting nge 'dzin las kyang 'phags pas bsam gtan bzhi pa la gnas pa dag phal cher gnas so //
analyzed: gzugs dang gzugs med pa'i ting nge 'dzin las kyang 'phags pas bsam gtan bzhi pa la gnas pa dag phal cher gnas so //
translated: Also, most of the noble ones abide in the fourth meditation, which is one of the meditative absorptions of the form and formless realms.

original: tshad med pa bzhi las kyang snying rje chen po la 'phags pa dag phal cher gnas so //
analyzed: tshad med pa bzhi las kyang snying rje chen po la 'phags pa dag phal cher gnas so //
translated: Also, most of the noble ones abide in great compassion, which is one of the four immeasurables.

original: phyogs su de song sangs rgyas sems can dag / yang dag mchod cing rnam dag 'gugs par byed //üîΩces bya ba la /
analyzed: phyogs su de song sangs rgyas sems can dag / yang dag mchod cing rnam dag 'gugs par byed // ces bya ba la /
translated: Having gone to the directions, he makes offerings to the Buddhas and sentient beings, and he attracts them in a pure way.

original: mngon bar shes pa dang ldan pa'i byang chub sems dpa' de rdzu 'phrul gyis phyogs bcu'i sangs rgyas kyi zhing dag tu song nas sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das la mchod pa byed de /
analyzed: mngon bar shes pa dang ldan pa'i byang chub sems dpa' de rdzu 'phrul gyis phyogs bcu'i sangs rgyas kyi zhing dag tu song nas sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das la mchod pa byed de /
translated: The Bodhisattva who possesses the superknowledges goes to the Buddha-fields of the ten directions by means of his magical power and makes offerings to the Lord Buddhas.

original: 'dis ni sangs rgyas mchod pa'i 'bras bu bstan to //
analyzed: 'dis ni sangs rgyas mchod pa'i 'bras bu bstan to //
translated: This shows the result of making offerings to the Buddhas.

original: gzhan yang rdzu 'phrul gyis phyogs bcu'i sangs rgyas kyi zhing dag tu song nas 'phur ba dang 'bar ba la sogs pa'i sgo nas sems can 'gugs te /
analyzed: gzhan yang rdzu 'phrul gyis phyogs bcu'i sangs rgyas kyi zhing dag tu song nas 'phur ba dang 'bar ba la sogs pa'i sgo nas sems can 'gugs te /
translated: Moreover, having gone to the Buddha-fields of the ten directions by means of his magical power, he attracts sentient beings by means of his flying, blazing, and so on,

original: dge ba la 'jog par byed de 'dis ni sems can 'dren pa'i 'bras bu bstan to //
analyzed: dge ba la 'jog par byed de 'dis ni sems can 'dren pa'i 'bras bu bstan to //
translated: and he establishes them in virtue. This shows the result of attracting sentient beings.

original: las rnam pa drug gi don las brtsams te tshigs su bcad pa bzhi'o zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: las rnam pa drug gi don las brtsams te tshigs su bcad pa bzhi'o zhes bya ba la /
translated: Four verses on the topic of the six kinds of action.

original: mngon par shes pa'i 'bras bu bstan nas da tshigs su bcad pa bzhis mngon par shes pa drug gi las 'chad de /
analyzed: mngon par shes pa'i 'bras bu bstan nas da tshigs su bcad pa bzhis mngon par shes pa drug gi las 'chad de /
translated: Having explained the result of the superknowledges, now, in four verses, he explains the function of the six superknowledges.

original: las rnam pa drug go //
analyzed: las rnam pa drug go //
translated: There are six kinds of function.

original: mthong ba'i las dang / ston pa'i las las brtsams te tshigs su bcad pa zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: mthong ba'i las dang / ston pa'i las las brtsams te tshigs su bcad pa zhes bya ba la /
translated: The verse beginning ‚ÄúThe function of seeing and teaching‚Äù treats the function of seeing and the function of teaching.

original: mngon par shes pa drug dang ldan pa'i byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyis sems can gyi 'jig rten dang / snod kyi 'jig rten gnyis sgyu ma lta bur khong du chud pa ni mthong ba'i las so //
analyzed: mngon par shes pa drug dang ldan pa'i byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyis sems can gyi 'jig rten dang / snod kyi 'jig rten gnyis sgyu ma lta bur khong du chud pa ni mthong ba'i las so //
translated: The function of seeing is the understanding of the two worlds, the world of sentient beings and the world of their environment, as being like a magical creation, on the part of the bodhisattvas who have the six superknowledges.

original: dbang bcu dang ldan pas sems can rnams la 'phur ba dang / 'bar ba la sogs pa dang / 'jig rten gyi khams su 'jig pa dang / chags pa ston pa ni ston pa'i las zhes bya ste /
analyzed: dbang bcu dang ldan pas sems can rnams la 'phur ba dang / 'bar ba la sogs pa dang / 'jig rten gyi khams su 'jig pa dang / chags pa ston pa ni ston pa'i las zhes bya ste /
translated: The function of teaching is the teaching of the destruction and evolution of the worlds, and the teaching of flying through the sky, blazing with light, and so on, to sentient beings, by means of the ten masteries.

original: las de gnyis bstan par bya ba'i phyir tshigs sa bcad pa rtsom mo @85b zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: las de gnyis bstan par bya ba'i phyir tshigs sa bcad pa rtsom mo @85b zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The verse is begun in order to teach these two functions.

original: sems can bcas pa skye dang 'jig pa yi //
analyzed: sems can bcas pa skye dang 'jig pa yi //
translated: The world with its sentient beings is born and perishes.

original: 'jig rten khams kun sgyu ma 'dra bar mthong //üîΩzhes bya ba la /
analyzed: 'jig rten khams kun sgyu ma 'dra bar mthong // zhes bya ba la /
translated: He sees all the world-realms as like illusions.

original: mngon par shes pa dang ldan pa'i byang chub sems dpa' des snod kyi 'jig rten dang sems can du bcas pa skyes te /
analyzed: mngon par shes pa dang ldan pa'i byang chub sems dpa' des snod kyi 'jig rten dang sems can du bcas pa skyes te /
translated: The Bodhisattva who possesses the superknowledges sees the world of beings and the world of their vessels as born.

original: 'jig rten gyi khams 'chags pa dang / 'jig ste bskal pa'i sa sbyong ba na sgyu ma dang 'dra bar mthong ngo //
analyzed: 'jig rten gyi khams 'chags pa dang / 'jig ste bskal pa'i sa sbyong ba na sgyu ma dang 'dra bar mthong ngo //
translated: When the world-realms are formed and destroyed, and the eons are purified, he sees them as like illusions.

original: ji ltar zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar zhe na /
translated: How so?

original: dper na sgyu ma dang / smig rgyu dang / rmi lam la sogs pa rang bzhin gyis stong zhing med kyang skye bar yang snang ba de bzhin du snod kyi 'jig rten dang / sems can gyi 'jig rten gnyi ga yang rang bzhin gyis stong ste /
analyzed: dper na sgyu ma dang / smig rgyu dang / rmi lam la sogs pa rang bzhin gyis stong zhing med kyang skye bar yang snang ba de bzhin du snod kyi 'jig rten dang / sems can gyi 'jig rten gnyi ga yang rang bzhin gyis stong ste /
translated: Just as illusions, mirages, dreams, etc., are empty of intrinsic nature and do not exist, yet appear to be born, in the same way, both the world of beings and the world of their vessels are empty of intrinsic nature.

original: med kyang skye bar snang 'jig par yang snang bas sgyu ma dang 'dra'o zhes mthong ngo //
analyzed: med kyang skye bar snang 'jig par yang snang bas sgyu ma dang 'dra'o zhes mthong ngo //
translated: Although they do not exist, they appear to be born and to be destroyed, so he sees them as like illusions.

original: 'di ni mthong ba'i las te las rnam pa gcig go //
analyzed: 'di ni mthong ba'i las te las rnam pa gcig go //
translated: This is the function of seeing, the one function.

original: dbang ldan rnam pa sna tshogs bcas par yang /
analyzed: dbang ldan rnam pa sna tshogs bcas par yang /
translated: The powerful one also sees the various kinds of worlds as like illusions.

original: ji bzhin 'dod par de dag yang ngag ston //üîΩzhes bya ba la ;üîΩmngon par shes pa thob pa'i byang chub sems dpa' ni dbang dang ldan pas rdzu 'phrul rnam pa sna tshogs kyis sems can gang la rdzu 'phrul gang bstan na 'dul zhing dga' bar 'gyur ba sems can gang la rdzu 'phrul de ston te 'bar ba ston pas 'dul
analyzed: ji bzhin 'dod par de dag yang ngag ston // zhes bya ba la ; mngon par shes pa thob pa'i byang chub sems dpa' ni dbang dang ldan pas rdzu 'phrul rnam pa sna tshogs kyis sems can gang la rdzu 'phrul gang bstan na 'dul zhing dga' bar 'gyur ba sems can gang la rdzu 'phrul de ston te 'bar ba ston pas 'dul
translated: As desired, they also show speech.üîΩThe bodhisattva who has attained the higher knowledges, by the power of his mastery, shows various miracles to sentient beings, whatever miracles he should teach in order to tame them and bring them joy.

original: ba'i sems can rnams la 'bar bar ston /
analyzed: ba'i sems can rnams la 'bar bar ston /
translated: To those sentient beings who are to be tamed by the miracle of blazing, he shows blazing.

original: 'phur bas 'dul ba'i sems can rnams la 'phur ba ston pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: 'phur bas 'dul ba'i sems can rnams la 'phur ba ston pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: To those sentient beings who are to be tamed by the miracle of flying, he shows flying, and so on.

original: 'di ni ston pa'i las te las gnyis pa'o //
analyzed: 'di ni ston pa'i las te las gnyis pa'o //
translated: This is the second activity, the activity of showing.üîΩCommencing with the activity of light rays, the verse begins:

original: 'od zer gyi las las brtsams te tshigs su bcad pa zhes bya ba la byang chub sems dpa' sems can gyi don du phyogs bcur 'od zer ston pa las brtsams nas tshigs su bcad pa rtsom ste /
analyzed: 'od zer gyi las las brtsams te tshigs su bcad pa zhes bya ba la byang chub sems dpa' sems can gyi don du phyogs bcur 'od zer ston pa las brtsams nas tshigs su bcad pa rtsom ste /
translated: The bodhisattva, for the sake of sentient beings, commences with the showing of light rays in the ten directions.

original: de yang don rnam pa gnyis kyi phyir 'od zer gtong ngo //
analyzed: de yang don rnam pa gnyis kyi phyir 'od zer gtong ngo //
translated: And he emits light rays for two reasons.

original: gang zhe na /
analyzed: gang zhe na /
translated: What are the two?

original: ngan song du skyes pa'i sems can sdug bsngal ba rnams mtho ris su dgod par bya ba'i phyir 'od zer btang ba dang / bdud kyi gnas dang bdud rnams bskyod cing skrag par byed pa'i phyir 'od zer gtong ngo //üîΩ'od zer btang bas mi bzad sdug bsngal dang // ngan song ba rnams mtho ris 'gro bar byed //
analyzed: ngan song du skyes pa'i sems can sdug bsngal ba rnams mtho ris su dgod par bya ba'i phyir 'od zer btang ba dang / bdud kyi gnas dang bdud rnams bskyod cing skrag par byed pa'i phyir 'od zer gtong ngo // 'od zer btang bas mi bzad sdug bsngal dang // ngan song ba rnams mtho ris 'gro bar byed //
translated: He sends forth light rays in order to establish in the higher realms those sentient beings who have been born in the lower realms and are suffering.üîΩHe sends forth light rays in order to shake and terrify the abodes and demons of Mara.

original: ces bya ba la /
analyzed: ces bya ba la /
translated: By sending forth light rays, he causes those in the lower realms, who have unbearable suffering, to go to the higher realms.

original: byang chub sems dpa' mngon par shes pa drug dang dbang bcu dang ldan pas phyogs bcur 'od @86a * //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' mngon par shes pa drug dang dbang bcu dang ldan pas phyogs bcur 'od @86a * //
translated: The bodhisattva, who is endowed with the six superknowledges and the ten powers, sends forth light rays in the ten directions.

original: zer btang bas sems can dmyal ba'i gnas na btso zhing gtubs pa la sogs pa'i sdug bsngal dang / yi dags kyi gnas na bkres pa la sogs pa'i sdug bsngal dang / byong song gi gnas na gcig gis gcig gsod pa la sogs pa'i sdug bsngal rnams 'od zer des reg pa dang /
analyzed: zer btang bas sems can dmyal ba'i gnas na btso zhing gtubs pa la sogs pa'i sdug bsngal dang / yi dags kyi gnas na bkres pa la sogs pa'i sdug bsngal dang / byong song gi gnas na gcig gis gcig gsod pa la sogs pa'i sdug bsngal rnams 'od zer des reg pa dang /
translated: By that light ray, the sufferings of those sentient beings in the hells, such as being boiled and cut to pieces, the sufferings of those in the ghost realm, such as hunger, and the sufferings of those in the animal realm, such as killing each other, are touched by that light ray.

original: dad pa skye zhing 'phral du yang sdug bsngal zhi bar byed pa dang / de nas shi 'phos nas lha dang mi'i gnas bde 'gror skye bar byed de /
analyzed: dad pa skye zhing 'phral du yang sdug bsngal zhi bar byed pa dang / de nas shi 'phos nas lha dang mi'i gnas bde 'gror skye bar byed de /
translated: Then, after death and transmigration, one is born in a happy realm, among gods and humans.

original: 'di ni las gsum pa'o //
analyzed: 'di ni las gsum pa'o //
translated: This is the third action.üîΩThe fourth action is stated in the following verse:

original: bdud gnas gzhal med khang mtho mdzes pa dag //
analyzed: bdud gnas gzhal med khang mtho mdzes pa dag //
translated: The lofty, beautiful palaces of the demons

original: bdud bcas rab tu bskyod cing skrag par byed //üîΩces bya ba la /
analyzed: bdud bcas rab tu bskyod cing skrag par byed // ces bya ba la /
translated: are shaken and the demons are terrified.

original: bdud kyi gnas ni bdud de dag 'khod pa'i khang khyim ste /
analyzed: bdud kyi gnas ni bdud de dag 'khod pa'i khang khyim ste /
translated: The demons' abode is the house in which the demons dwell.

original: mtho ba ni rtseg ma dang rim pa du ma 'dug pa'o //
analyzed: mtho ba ni rtseg ma dang rim pa du ma 'dug pa'o //
translated: It is lofty, with many stories and levels.

original: mdzes pa ni rin po che las byas pa'o //
analyzed: mdzes pa ni rin po che las byas pa'o //
translated: It is beautiful, made of jewels.

original: bdud bcas zhes bya ba ni bdud 'khor dang bcas pa ste /
analyzed: bdud bcas zhes bya ba ni bdud 'khor dang bcas pa ste /
translated: The demons are the demons together with their retinue.

original: 'od zer btang ste /üîΩbdud kyi gnas rnams ni bskyod /
analyzed: 'od zer btang ste / bdud kyi gnas rnams ni bskyod /
translated: Having emitted lightüîΩthe demons' abode is shaken.

original: bdud kyi gnas g-yos pas bdud rnams kyang skrag par byed de /
analyzed: bdud kyi gnas g-yos pas bdud rnams kyang skrag par byed de /
translated: And the demons are terrified by the shaking of the demons' abode.

original: 'di ni las bzhi pa'o //
analyzed: 'di ni las bzhi pa'o //
translated: This is the fourth action.

original: rnam par rol pa'i las dang sprul pa'i las las brtsams te tshigs su bcad pa zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: rnam par rol pa'i las dang sprul pa'i las las brtsams te tshigs su bcad pa zhes bya ba la /
translated: A verse on the actions of play and emanation.

original: rnam par rol pa ni nam mkha' mdzod kyi ting nge 'dzin zhes bya ba la sogs pa theg pa chen po'i ting nge 'dzin dpag tu med pa la 'jug pa'o //
analyzed: rnam par rol pa ni nam mkha' mdzod kyi ting nge 'dzin zhes bya ba la sogs pa theg pa chen po'i ting nge 'dzin dpag tu med pa la 'jug pa'o //
translated: Play is the engagement in the immeasurable samadhis of the Great Vehicle, such as the samadhi called the treasury of space.

original: sprul pa'i las ni sems can gyi don du rnam pa gsum du sprul par byed do //üîΩbzo'i gnas sprul nas sems can 'dul ba dang / skye ba sprul nas sems can 'dul ba dang ; dga' ldan gyi pho brang nas 'chi ba bstan nas mya ngan las 'das pa'i bar dag sprul pa bstan nas /
analyzed: sprul pa'i las ni sems can gyi don du rnam pa gsum du sprul par byed do // bzo'i gnas sprul nas sems can 'dul ba dang / skye ba sprul nas sems can 'dul ba dang ; dga' ldan gyi pho brang nas 'chi ba bstan nas mya ngan las 'das pa'i bar dag sprul pa bstan nas /
translated: The activity of emanation is the emanation of the three kinds of emanations for the sake of sentient beings.

original: sprul pa'i mchog bstan nas sems can 'dul bar byed pa'o //
analyzed: sprul pa'i mchog bstan nas sems can 'dul bar byed pa'o //
translated: Emanating as a craftsman, one trains sentient beings; emanating as a birth existence, one trains sentient beings; and emanating the display of passing away from the Tusita palace up to nirvana, one trains sentient beings by displaying the supreme emanation.

original: ting 'dzin dpag tu med la rnam rol cing //
analyzed: ting 'dzin dpag tu med la rnam rol cing //
translated: One plays in immeasurable samadhis,

original: mchog rnams 'dus ba'i 'og tu yang dag ston ces bya ba la /
analyzed: mchog rnams 'dus ba'i 'og tu yang dag ston ces bya ba la /
translated: and after the gathering of the supreme ones, one displays the supreme emanation.

original: sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa'i 'khor tshogs pa ni tshogs rnams 'dus pa zhes bya ste /
analyzed: sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa'i 'khor tshogs pa ni tshogs rnams 'dus pa zhes bya ste /
translated: The gathering of the assembly of the retinue of buddhas and bodhisattvas is called the gathering of the assembly.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa dang byang chub sems dpa' gtso bo tshogs pa'i dbus su theg pa chen po'i ting nge 'dzin dpag tu med pa la snyoms par 'jug pa ston pa ni ting @86b nge 'dzin gyis rnam par rol pa zhes bya ste /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa dang byang chub sems dpa' gtso bo tshogs pa'i dbus su theg pa chen po'i ting nge 'dzin dpag tu med pa la snyoms par 'jug pa ston pa ni ting @86b nge 'dzin gyis rnam par rol pa zhes bya ste /
translated: The display of samadhi is the display of infinite samadhis of the Great Vehicle in the midst of the retinue of the principal Tathagatas and Bodhisattvas.

original: dper na 'phags pa 'jam dpal de bzhin gshegs pa dang / byang chub sems dpa'i 'khor gyi dbus su ting nge 'dzin la snyoms par zhugs pa dang / sus kyang ting nge 'dzin de las bslang bar ma nus pa dang / bu mo legs pa'i blo gros kyis bslang ngo zhes bya ba la sogs pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: dper na 'phags pa 'jam dpal de bzhin gshegs pa dang / byang chub sems dpa'i 'khor gyi dbus su ting nge 'dzin la snyoms par zhugs pa dang / sus kyang ting nge 'dzin de las bslang bar ma nus pa dang / bu mo legs pa'i blo gros kyis bslang ngo zhes bya ba la sogs pa lta bu'o //
translated: For example, when the noble Manjusri entered into samadhi in the midst of the retinue of the Tathagata and Bodhisattvas, no one was able to rouse him from that samadhi, but the girl Sudatta was able to do so.

original: 'di ni rnam par rol pa'i las de las rnam pa lnga'o //
analyzed: 'di ni rnam par rol pa'i las de las rnam pa lnga'o //
translated: This is the fivefold display of that display of samadhi.

original: las dang skye ba dang ni mchog gi sprul pas kyang //
analyzed: las dang skye ba dang ni mchog gi sprul pas kyang //
translated: By means of action, birth, and supreme emanation,

original: thams cad dus su sems can don byed do //
analyzed: thams cad dus su sems can don byed do //

original: zhes bya bas sprul pa'i las bstan te /
analyzed: zhes bya bas sprul pa'i las bstan te /

original: las sprul pas kyang dus thams cad du sems can gyi don byed /
analyzed: las sprul pas kyang dus thams cad du sems can gyi don byed /

original: skye ba sprul pas kyang dus thams cad du sems can gyi don byed /
analyzed: skye ba sprul pas kyang dus thams cad du sems can gyi don byed /

analyzed: mchog gi sprul pas kyang dus thams cad du sems can gyi don byed do zhes bya ba'i don to //

original: 'di las drug dang / de la rdza mkhan dang / pi wang mkhan la sogs pa'i bzo'i gnas rnam pa sna tshogs byed par sprul pa ni las sprul pa zhes bya ste /üîΩlha dang klu dang gnod sbyin nas byol song la sogs pa'i gnas su skyes nas /
analyzed: 'di las drug dang / de la rdza mkhan dang / pi wang mkhan la sogs pa'i bzo'i gnas rnam pa sna tshogs byed par sprul pa ni las sprul pa zhes bya ste / lha dang klu dang gnod sbyin nas byol song la sogs pa'i gnas su skyes nas /
translated: The emanation of action is the various emanations of the artist, such as the emanation of the potter, the emanation of the lute player, and so on.

original: de dag gi lus 'dra bar bstan pa ni skye ba sprul pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de dag gi lus 'dra bar bstan pa ni skye ba sprul pa zhes bya'o //

analyzed: 'og min gyi pho brang nas mya ngan las 'das pa'i bar dag bstan pa ni mchog gi sprul pa zhes bya'o //

original: zhing yongs su dag par byed pa las brtsams te tshigs su bcad pa zhes bya ba las /
analyzed: zhing yongs su dag par byed pa las brtsams te tshigs su bcad pa zhes bya ba las /

original: mngon par shes pa'i las drug bstan nas /
analyzed: mngon par shes pa'i las drug bstan nas /

analyzed: zhing rnams 'dod pa bzhin du bstan pa'i phyir //

original: byang chub sems dpa' dbang bcu thob pa ste /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' dbang bcu thob pa ste /

original: dbang bcu la ye shes kyi dbang gis sangs rgyas kyi zhing @87a * //
analyzed: dbang bcu la ye shes kyi dbang gis sangs rgyas kyi zhing @87a * //

analyzed: / sangs rgyas mtshan dag med par sangs rgyas mtshan // yang dag bsgrags pas dad pas khams gzhan 'gyed //

original: ces bya bas /
analyzed: ces bya bas /

original: sems can gyi 'jig rten dag par byed par ston te /
analyzed: sems can gyi 'jig rten dag par byed par ston te /

analyzed: ldan pa'i don las brtsams te tshigs su bcad pa zhes bya ba la /

analyzed: sems can smin par byed nus pa dang ldan pa bstan te / dper na bya 'dab gshog rdzogs shing rgyas pa nam mkha' la 'gro ba na chen po 'bang  pa med par dga' mgur 'gro zhing nam 'phang gcod pa de bzhin du mngon par shes pa drug dang ldan pa gcig tu 'bad pa med par bsdu ba'i dngos po

translated: Just as a bird with fully developed wings soars in the sky without any effort, in the same way, those who have the six kinds of preternatural knowledge gather beings with the four kinds of attracting activity, without any deliberate effort, and then bring them to full maturity by means of the virtues such as turning them away from nonvirtue and establishing them in virtue.

analyzed: mngon par shes pa dang ldan na sems can smin par byed la de bzhin gshegs pa la 'dri zhing zhu ba rnams kyang phyin ci ma log par 'dri bas ji skad du mdo sde dag las rigs kyi bu khyod kyis mdo zhu ba zhus pa dang dri ba
translated: If one possesses preternatural knowledge, one can bring sentient beings to maturity and, by asking the Tathagata questions and making inquiries, one can ask the questions correctly.üîΩThe meaning of the above is that one will receive praise in the sutras, such as:üîΩ‚ÄúGood son, your questions and inquiries into the sutras

translated: One becomes worthy of the world‚Äôs trustüîΩ.

analyzed: tshig gzung bar 'os pa dang ldan pa bstan te /
translated: This verse shows that one becomes worthy of the world‚Äôs trust.

translated: Having taught the meaning of endowment, in order to teach how sentient beings who are endowed with the six superknowledges engage in the welfare of sentient beings through six kinds of power, the verse is composed.

original: mngon shes drug dang zhes bya ba la /

analyzed: mngon par shes pa drug ni 'phrul gyi mig gi mngon par shes pa nas zag pa zad pa mngon par shes pa'i bar du drug ste ;

original: shin tu bsdams shing zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: shin tu bsdams shing zhes bya ba la /

analyzed: lam 'di dag ni rab tu zhi ba smin pa'i rgyu yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //

analyzed: rtog pa de dag spangs pa ni rab tu zhi ba yongs su smin pa'i rang bzhin no //

original: bar chad med cing zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: bar chad med cing zhes bya ba la /
translated: ‚Äú Without interruption‚Äù means

analyzed: 'dod chags kyi gnyen por mi gtsang ba bsgom pa dang / zhe sdang gi gnyen por byams pa bsgom pa dang / gti mug gi gnyen por rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba bsgom pa la bar chad med do //

analyzed: rgyun du sgom par byed pa ni rab tu zhi ba yongs su smin pa'i lam rnam pa gcig go //

translated: The phrase delighting in virtue means that one practices the six perfections from generosity to wisdom, and one delights in cultivation by nature.

analyzed: 'di ni yongs su smin pa'i lam rnam pa gnyis so // rgyal ba'i sras kyi nyon mongs bsal ba'i phyir //
translated: This is the second aspect of the path of complete maturation.üîΩThe heirs of the victors assert that the path of complete maturation

translated: The cause of maturity, the nature, and the action of compassion are the characteristics of the bodhisattva's maturity of compassion, because it is the cause of the elimination of the afflictions of conceptual thought.

original: snying rje yongs su smin pa'i mtshan nyid kyi dbang du byas te tshigs su bcad pa zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: snying rje yongs su smin pa'i mtshan nyid kyi dbang du byas te tshigs su bcad pa zhes bya ba la /

original: sems can sdug bsngal ba mthong na sems can sdug bsngal bsal ba'i phyir 'jug pa ni snying rje ste sems kyi brtse ba ji tsam zhig skyes na snying rje yongs su smin pa yin pa bstan pa'i phyir tshigs su bcad pa rtsom mo zhes bya ba'i don to
analyzed: sems can sdug bsngal ba mthong na sems can sdug bsngal bsal ba'i phyir 'jug pa ni snying rje ste sems kyi brtse ba ji tsam zhig skyes na snying rje yongs su smin pa yin pa bstan pa'i phyir tshigs su bcad pa rtsom mo zhes bya ba'i don to

analyzed: // de yang snying rje'i rgyu dang / rang bzhin dang ; las gsum dang ldan na snying rje yongs su smin pa ston to //

original: snying rje rang bzhin dang ni zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: snying rje rang bzhin dang ni zhes bya ba la /

analyzed: rang bzhin gyi sgra ni rigs la bya ste /
translated: The word ‚Äúnature‚Äù here refers to lineage.

original: snying rje'i rigs can zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: snying rje'i rigs can zhes bya ba'i don to //

original: de'ang rnal 'byor spyod pa'i sa las /
analyzed: de'ang rnal 'byor spyod pa'i sa las /

analyzed: gzhan sdug mthong ba zhes bya ba la /

analyzed: de dag gi sdug bsngal bsal bar bya'o snyam du sems pa ni snying rje yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: one thinks, ‚ÄúI will remove their suffering.‚Äù This is the meaning of compassion.

analyzed: chung du'i sems kyang yang dag rab tu spong // zhes bya ba la /
translated: And the attitude of the lesser vehicle is completely rejected.

analyzed: chung ngu'i sems ni nyan thos dang / rang sangs rgyas sems can gzhan gyi don btang nas mya ngan las 'das par 'jug pa ste ;
translated: The attitude of the lesser vehicle is the attitude of the disciples and hermit buddhas, who, having abandoned the welfare of other sentient beings, enter into the state of nirvƒÅ·πáa.

analyzed: sems de spangs nas sems can gyi don du 'khor bar 'gro bar sems pa ni chung du'i sems spong ba zhes bya ste /

analyzed: snying rje'i rang bzhin dang / gzhan sdug bsngal ba mthong nas snying rje ba dang / chung du'i sems spong ba dang gsum ni snying rje'i yongs su smin pa'i rgyu yin no // khyad par 'gro dang zhes bya ba la /
translated: These three‚Äîthe nature of compassion, compassion for the suffering of others, and the rejection of the attitude of the lesser vehicle‚Äîare the causes of the full maturation of compassion.

analyzed: sa dang po'i dus pas sa gnyis pa'i dus na snying rje che ba las /
translated: Because of the greater compassion on the second ground compared to the first, and so on, it is called ‚Äúprogressing to the special.‚Äù

original: yongs su smin pa'i rang bzhin no //üîΩ'gro ba'i mchog 'gyur ba zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: yongs su smin pa'i rang bzhin no // 'gro ba'i mchog 'gyur ba zhes bya ba la /

analyzed: de lta bu'i snying rje dang ldan pa'i byang chub sems dpa' de sa dang po'i dus na chos kyi dbyings kun du 'gro bar rtogs pa de'i tshe /

analyzed: sems can kun las 'phags pa'i lus mtshan dang dpe byad kyis brgyan pa thob pa ni 'gro ba'i mchog tu gyur pa zhes bya ste /

original: 'dis ni las bstan to //

analyzed: de yang bzod pa yongs su smin pa'i rgyu dang rang bzhin dang / las gsum dang ldan na yongs su smin pa yin par bstan to //

original: rang bzhin brtan pa zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: rang bzhin brtan pa zhes bya ba la /
translated: As for its nature, it is said:üîΩPatience is firm by nature.

analyzed: brtan pa dang / bzod pa dang / mi brjed pa dang / zhe sdang med pa la sogs pa ni bzod pa'i ming gi rnam grangs so //

analyzed: rang bzhin yang 'di'i skabs su rigs la bya ste /

analyzed: rang bzhin gyis bzod pa'i rigs yod ces bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is: ‚ÄúThere is a natural disposition for patience.‚Äù

analyzed: gang gi phyir bzod pa'i rigs yod pas na /
translated: Because there is a disposition for patience,

original: bzod pa phun sum tshogs pa 'chad pa'i mdo sde ma thos kyang gzhan gyis gnod par byas pa la sogs pa'i sdug bsngal rnams nyams su len cing zhe sdang mi skye'o zhes bya ba'i don to //

translated: Having heard the sutras that possess the perfection of patience, one comprehends that all phenomena are like illusions, dreams, and mirages, and one is patient and endures suffering and harm.

analyzed: so sor brtags pas bsgom pa'i don dag ni de lta bu'o //

translated: Moreover, when others harm me or I experience the suffering of cold, heat, and so on, it is because in past lives I harmed others, and so in this life I experience suffering.üîΩIf I harm others, I will experience suffering in other lives as well.
